description:
Requisition ID:  65482 

Job Function/Category:  Engineering 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Part Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG Long Island Energy Efficiency Area is seeking a Planning and Evaluation Technical intern at our Melville location. This position will offer an opportunity for the intern to expand their knowledge of overall energy efficiency, electric vehicle and non-wire alternative efforts. The intern will be afforded a unique opportunity to work within PSEG Long Island's new and developing Datalake environment and provide opportunities for the intern to develop and demonstrate data science and analysis in support of the aforementioned areas. Assist the Energy Efficiency and Renewable Department in the areas of Electric Vehicle Charging Data analysis, Datalake querying and analysis, Non Wire alternative Request for Proposals development, and support in the launching a Pay for Performance Pilot program. The position will also be requested to support general program planning efforts for 2021 as requested based upon work requirements during the internship period.

The job duties include, but not limited to the following:
• Working with Engineer and Business Support Analyst to develop knowledge base of datalake, LodeStar and Microstrategies structure and functionality. • Developing capability in Tableau writer software capability and functionality. • Developing understanding of Juicebox and Chargepoint portals to support retrieval of customer charging data and export into Datalake. • Interfacing with all members of Planning and Evaluation team to provide data retrieval, analysis and presentation requirements. • Participate and support Energy Efficiency Planning efforts for the 2021 plan year. • Perform cost benefit analysis as requested.
Required Education/Skills : The successful candidate (s) must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in business, math, engineering, economics, computer science or similar discipline. Candidates must have completed sophomore level course work for consideration. This position requires candidates to be able to commute to the assigned work location in Melville, NY PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Preferred Skills :

3.0 GPA

All PSEG internship roles are paid at an hourly rate, however there are no benefits associated with these positions. Candidates are expected to work 40 hours per week over the summer period for the full 10-12 week period. We are targeting currently enrolled students staying in the New York metro area for the duration of the internship and able to commute to the assigned work location. Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions. As an employee of PSE&G or PSEG Long Island, you should be aware that during storm restoration efforts, you may be required to perform functions outside of your routine duties and on a schedule that may be different from normal operations.

This site ( http://www.pseg.com ) is strictly for candidates who are not currently PSEG employees. PSEG employees must apply for jobs internally through empower which can be accessed through the mypseg homepage by clicking on the employee center tab, then under the empower header, choose careers.

Business needs may cause PSEG to cancel or delay filling position at any time during the selection process.

Certain positions at the Company may require you to have access to Part 810-Controlled Information.  Under the law, the Company is limited in who it can share this information with and in certain circumstances it is necessary to obtain specific authorization before the Company can share this information.  Accordingly, if the position does require access to this information, you must complete a 10 CFR Part 810 Export Control Compliance Nationality Request Form, a copy of which will be provided to you by Talent Acquisition if an offer is made.  If there is a need for specific authorization, due to the time it takes to obtain authorization from the government, we will likely not be able to further proceed with an offer.

Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment, including the hiring process, based on any legal protected characteristic. Legally protected characteristics included, race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law in locations where PSEG employs individuals.

Need to request an accommodation?

If you have a disability and need assistance submitting your resume, applying for a position or registering for a test, please call 973-430-3845. Any information provided regarding a disability will be kept strictly confidential and will not be shared with anyone involved in making a hiring decision.

Nearest Major Market: Long Island
Nearest Secondary Market: New York CIty
Job Segment: Intern, Engineer, Computer Science, Compliance, Entry Level, Energy, Engineering, Technology, Legal

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell, Bash and Python
  • Experience with virtualization, scripting automation and storage systems
  • Exposure to performing server, network and storage systems design, implementation and administration
  • Windows and Linux OS administration experience
  • Exposure to traditional enterprise platform management, server administration or relational databases  
  • Experience with infrastructure-as-a-service platforms such as AWS and Google Compute Engine
  • 3 or more years of work toward a bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field 
  • Experience with development using GitHub or TFS

Job Summary

Interns at the Rock Family of Companies gain priceless hands-on experience. Here, they learn how it feels to be in the workplace, participate in events and become a valuable member of our team.

Responsibilities 

  • Pair with engineering teams to support on-prem infrastructure
  • Help document processes and procedures  
  • Work with a mentor to learn and design automation of procedures and or tasks using tools such as PowerShell or Terraform, etc.
  • Assist with management and support of cloud infrastructure as well as on-prem servers   
  • Assist with driving infrastructure as code and configuration management communities of practices across the organization
  • Help perform routine maintenance of owned infrastructure such as patching and OS upgrades
  • Work with a mentor to help migrate systems from on-prem to cloud
  • Work with a mentor to help upgrade server OS
  • Identify opportunities to automate processes to help the server team be more efficient and effective in delivery of services
  • Participate during technical incidents to assist with troubleshooting and resolution of system outages
  • Participate during planning discussions with teams to help understand the scope of work required and communicate realistic expectations of what can be provided
  • Effectively research and troubleshoot solutions to problems as well as learn new technologies to assist the business functions
  • Network with teammates across the organization in order to build a comfort level with asking for help and providing help to others

Who We Are

Rock Central is recruiting for 20+ businesses in the Rock Family of Companies for Summer 2021 internships. Interns can expect to gain hands-on experience, learn how it feels to be in the workplace, participate in professional development opportunities and become a valuable member of a team.

Disclaimer 

This is an outline of the primary responsibilities of this position. As with everything in life, things change. The tasks and responsibilities can be changed, added to, removed, amended, deleted and modified at any time by the leadership group.

As a PhD Applied Research Intern you will work closely with leading experts and apply real-world solutions that span across the areas of Machine Learning, Robotics, and Software Engineering. 
About the Work
Depending on your skill sets and areas of interest, your work will focus on some or all of the following below
Autonomy
Machine Learning Research and develop solutions for behavior prediction, intent understanding, planning using advanced sequence, graph neural networks based on supervised or reinforcement learning
Machine Learning Infrastructure Design scalable and optimizable systems that can process petabytes of data for model compilation & training in production
Perception Resolve real-world robotics problems in one or more of the following areas computer vision, sensor fusion, state estimation, object detection, classification, and tracking
Behavior Develop novel prediction & planning algorithms in domains like machine learning, trajectory optimization, reasoning under uncertainty, modeling system dynamics and reachability, and probabilistic reasoning.
Mapping & Localization Research, develop and implement algorithms to solve large-scale mapping and real-time localization problems for our fleet of self-driving delivery robots

About You

You are currently in a PhD program focusing in one or more of the following areas Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, Mathematics, or a closely related field
You have subject matter expertise and research in one or more of the following areas Advanced Algorithms & Data Structures, Distributed-Systems, Machine Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Robotics, Imitation Learning, Computer Vision, 3D Graphics/Geometry
You have strong problem solving and programming skills in C++ or Python
Demonstrated research publications in any of the major conferences(RSS, ICRA, CoRL, CVPR, ICLR, ICML, NeurIPS, etc.)

We are one of the world’s largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies connecting people to the lifestyles, activities and experiences they cherish through our family of iconic outdoor, active and workwear brands including Vans®, The North Face®, Timberland® and Dickies®.

We’re proud of the scale, diversity and resources we can make available for you so you can explore new and exciting options as your career advances forward.

We offer a uniquely supportive, people-first environment that gives you the chance to be yourself while making a real impact, every day.
 

We’re a down to earth and straight forward culture, filled with smart people, working incredibly hard, doing what they love while striving towards something we all believe in.

We’re determined to make a difference and set an example for social and environmental impact at scale. Everyone can play their part and see their efforts recognized, appreciated and rewarded.

All Internships will be remote.  Depending on World Health Organization guidelines this may change over the course of your internship or be at the discretion of our management.

Job Title:  Intern – Cloud Integration Engineering Analyst

What you could be doing on a daily basis;

This position will offer an opportunity to learn about AWS cloud technologies used in retail Digital transformation especially in Marketplaces integration. As an analyst, you will help with documenting the Agile scrum user stories from product owner perspective and expand the business stories into multiple technical dependent stories as well as handover / explain to the engineering developers.

When you join the Global Cloud Integration engineering team, you will have an opportunity to learn enterprise system integration patterns, challenges, best practices in the new DIGITAL era.

Finally, this role has a flexibility to custom build software reusable scripts / components in Java / Spring boot applications which would run in AWS environments for Dev Geeks.

There will be a mentor / coach for any technical or functional help to learn and contribute.

The types of strengths we would like you to bring;

Interested in Java programming in any flavor (Springboot or Javascript or anything)
Pursuing a Bachelor’s in Computer science or Electronics background with curiosity in programming and technical analysis & design   
Technical Skills such as JAVA, AWS, etc.

Our Intern Program runs from June 7th through August 13th, 2021!  During your time with us, you will have opportunities for training that will enhance you as a professional, give back in our communities and of course have FUN with your colleagues!  All VF internships are paid and offer you work that matters with some of the best teams around!

Colorado Applicants:

If you are a Colorado resident and are interested in applying, you are able to request additional information about this position. To request additional information, please email us HERE. Please be sure to include the complete job title in the email message.

Deliver business value through Right and Fast partnership

HBS installs, integrates and maintains the systems that keep facilities safe, secure, comfortable, productive and energy efficient. You will work with critical building management, HVAC and security systems  with the opportunity to work on a range of commercial and government buildings, health care facilities, airports and correction facilities. In this role you will provide support to our ICT/ Cyber specialists to design, engineer, configure, implement and commission Information

 

 

Have the opportunity to assist on high-level designs using the best of breed technology to support Honeywell systems, including servers, storage, virtualization, and networking. Exposure to/knowledge of virtualization technologies like VMware ESX and/or Microsoft Hyper-V to implement designs will be very beneficial.

 

Assist with technical OT/IT knowledge required to support integration requirements to support customer sites with a heavy focus on securely integrating systems via open building protocols into Honeywell software platforms.  Understanding of emerging IOT technologies as applies to building control systems (i.e. access controls, temperature sensing, smart lighting, facial recognition, navigation controls, RFID sensor controls, etc.)

 

Provide consulting based on current technical knowledge as to the design, procurement, configuration and implementation of the underlying architecture and technologies for new Honeywell based systems.

YOU MUST HAVE

 

Be in your penultimate (rising senior) year of Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Similar IT/ Systems degree. A major in Security would be highly desirable.

 

Be a citizen or have permanent residence for the United States at the time of your application.

 

Ability to travel locally as required to provide support at customer sites

 

WE VALUE

Self-motivated, ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure, determine own work priorities, work independently and as part of a team.

Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

Ability to develop innovative and creative solutions in a complex multiple systems environment.

Some basic network fault finding capability

A good understanding of virtualization, networking, servers, storage, and enterprise applications

Excellent effective communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills, along with proven ability to interact professionally with clients

 

Additional Information

  • JOB ID: req242506
  • Category: Customer Experience
  • Location: Houston,Texas,United States
  • Nonexempt
  • Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status.

Location: West Conshohocken, PA
Description: Our client is currently seeking a Market Research Manager

 
POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team’s capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team’s intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying AmerisourceBergen’s guiding principles. In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive. Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
· Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
· Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
· Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
· Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
· Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
· Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
· Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of AmerisourceBergen’s performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
· Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
· With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
· Becomes AmerisourceBergen’s foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team’s goals
· Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
· Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
· Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
· Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
· Manages the intern’s workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern’s professional development.
· Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team’s workflows, processes, and deliverables
· Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
· Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Typical Education
· Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
· Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
· Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
· Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
· Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
· Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
· Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
· Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
· Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
· Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
· Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
· Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
· Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
· Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
· Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
· Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
· Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
· Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
· Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
· Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
· Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
· Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
· Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
· Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
· Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
· Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
· Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
· Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME’s as required to meet project objectives.

4. What special requirements/skills you would like us to screen for (i.e.: "Must Haves")? See job description as well.
Data analytics skill, statistical modeling skills should be advanced. Intermediate to advanced experience with statistical software (R, SPSS, Qualtrics, Sawtooth etc.)

TechStyle Fashion Group is currently seeking a backend Software Engineer Intern to join the Fission team for Summer 2021. 

Job Overview & Responsibilities: 

As a software engineering intern for the Fission team at TechStyle Fashion Group you will work on backend microservices that serve larger business functions for the company. The Fission team owns these microservices from start to finish and are responsible for moving the companys microservice architecture forward.   

We are seeking a driven individual to help us move towards continuous integration and continuous delivery for the summer. As an intern for the Fission team, we would like to utilize the skills brought to the team by the individual as well as build on skills such as API design, architecture design, and integration.  

  • Focus on meeting the needs of the Fission team by developing and maintaining features  

  • Write unit tests and build reusable code; documentation is a must  

  • Optimize applications built for speed and scalability  

  • Learn throughout the experience and enjoy it!  

Our Software Stack:  

  • Cloud Services (AWS)   

  • API Gateway  

  • Lambda  

  • DynamoDB  

  • CodePipeline  

  • Node.js  

  • Koa/Express  

  • Microsoft SQL Server 

  • Microservices Architecture  

Qualifications:  

  • Able to work in a remote environment and be accountable for meetings and work items  

  • Be enrolled in a Bachelors program in the field of computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineer, or related field  

  • Desire to learn on the job  

  • Experience with REST APIs, Amazon Web Services, or NodeJS  

  • Experience with Docker and continuous integration/delivery are a plus  

  • Experience with any version of git is recommended  

The Intern Gig: TechStyle Fashion Group is looking for enthusiastic students with ambition to go far. Our full-time paid internship program will give you a chance to gain in-depth knowledge of what it is like to be a part of our fast-paced and innovative company. Our summer internship program will be conducted fully remotely, and will run for 9 weeks from June 14th-August 13th. Our interns have the unique opportunity to gain real work experience, while participating in skill-building workshops and interactive social activities throughout the duration of the internship assignment. 

**YOU MUST BE A RISING JUNIOR OR RISING SENIOR (graduating in 2022 or 2023) UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT ENROLLED AT AN ACCREDITED UNIVERSITY TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION** 

TechStyle is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, compensate, develop, and promote regardless of race, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable. At TechStyle, we champion a vibrant workplace culture that thrives on diversity law and do not tolerate discrimination or harassment. We are one team from many backgrounds, innovating through diversity of individuals, who are driven by passion for creating an inclusive space for all. TechStyle will continue to champion a workplace culture that prizes diversity and inclusivity. 

We encourage you to apply regardless of meeting all qualifications and/or requirements.

position: Sr. Assembler Programmer DB2 - Sr. Software Engineer
description:
Sr. Assembler Programmer DB2 – Sr. Software Engineer

 

Sr. Assembler Programmer Job Description Summary

The Senior Software Engineer designs, develops, troubleshoots, debugs, and sets the direction for the design and implementation of software features/functionality/enhancements, correction of defects, and/or the creation of new products. Develops software tools including operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases, and Internet-related tools. Determines software’s compatibility with hardware and/or influences software's design in relation to hardware.

Sr. Assembler Programmer Job Overview

The Senior Software Engineer designs, develops, troubleshoots, debugs, and sets the direction for the design and implementation of software features/functionality/enhancements, correction of defects, and/or the creation of new products. Develops software tools including operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases, and Intern et-related tools. Determines software’s compatibility with hardware and/or influences software's design in relation to hardware.

Sr. Assembler Programmer Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Review and provide feedback on designs.
  • Takes ownership of the design and development of features within their component.
  • Recognizes and practically solves for anti-patterns.
  • Good understanding of how his/her work aligns with high-level use cases and team deliverables.
  • Define (more than a feature, less than a product) a component that fits into an architecture.
  • Describe and defend design decisions for components owned by the team.
  • Optimize software design to leverage platform capabilities.
  • Acts as the technical subject matter expert for a product domain.
  • Quantify and communicate work estimates and risks to direct management
  • Handle multiple competing priorities with minimal help
  • Understand features as a whole and able to break down larger stories and features into tasks
  • Familiar with most of the technologies we focus on and what markets they target
  • Takes ownership of customer issues and effectively communicate with Support/SEs to resolve field questions/issues
  • Discuss with customers what larger concerns and problems they are trying to solve, over and above the immediate technical concerns
  • Willingness to teach and grow junior team members
  • Excellent listening skills
  • Effectively works within the team and across teams
  • Ensures all tasks are completed thoroughly and that any work done is tested, unit tested, documented, and ready for customers
  • Takes identified problems and concerns and create a plan to fix the problem and prevent it from occurring again
  • Follows through on all tasks
  • Reliably delivers expected work products and outcomes
  • Imparts a sense of urgency on junior team member s
     

Sr. Assembler Programmer Required Qualifications

  • 8+ years of software engineering experience
  • Assembler language programming.
  • A minimum of 8 years hands-on, consistent experience with z/OS / mainframe computers
  • A minimum of 8 years experience in DB2 performance tuning for z/OS
  • Mastery of data structures and algorithms.
  • Able to select data structures and algorithms to solve technical problems.
  • Able to write high-quality code rapidly.
  • Able to present a track record of solving problems of increasing complexity
  • Good understanding of trade-offs in solving problems that have variable levels of complexity.
  • Deep understanding of memory allocation and management mechanism, security mechanisms, processing allocation mechanisms of target operating systems.
     

Sr. Assembler Programmer Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with other z/OS middleware (CICS, IMS, MQ) a plus
  • Experience with at least 1 of the following: Java, C, Web app programming, JavaScript/dojo, CSS, HTML
  • Writes code faster than the average developer.
  • Outstanding quality with few bugs in generated code.
     

Sr. Assembler Programmer Education

Bachelors/ Masters’ degree in Computer Science or equivalent

Sr. Assembler Programmer Travel Requirements

0-10%

Description:

Sr. Software Engineer

We are currently seeking a Sr. Software Engineer for our Lafayette, LA location.

**This position can sit in Lafayette, LA OR be remote with travel required**

We are seeking a talented Senior Software Engineer to help us improve our world class autonomy platform. We are a fast-paced team specializing in building next generation autonomy for surface vessels employing state of the art technology from a variety of fields – operator interfaces, sensing, planning, and hardware control. Our product allows naval vessels to operate fully autonomously while safely reacting to the world around it. With over 100 vessels in operation and 2,000 days logged at sea our product is one of the best solutions in the world and we are leading the effort toward naval autonomy in commercial and defense spaces.

Our software developers are a team of highly talented individuals. We take pride in the quality of our product, and we encourage all our developers to take ownership and personal responsibility. We have a strong culture of review and mentoring as part of our collaborative commitment to excellence. Our goal is to provide an extremely accessible work environment that empowers developers to tackle hard problems. We value the best ideas, whether from an intern or a lead, and every individual can have a significant impact on our success.

Our success is due to the people we employ – if you’re smart, adaptable, highly productive, a team player, and relish the challenge that comes with solving difficult problems, join us.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, document, develop, integrate, and test software using C++
  • Participate in peer reviews of design and software
  • Participate in requirements development
  • Participate in system architecture development
  • Participate in project estimation, scheduling, and tasking
  • Provide technical supervision and mentoring of developers

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or related field
  • Must be a US Citizen with the ability to obtain a US DoD Secret clearance
  • At least Six (6) years of professional software development experience
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong working knowledge of computer science theory and practice
  • Strong working knowledge of software development using modern C++ and STL
  • Strong working knowledge of collaborative software development in a Linux environment
  • Knowledge of design patterns
  • Ability to travel 10% of time.

In compliance with Colorado’s Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the salary range for this role in Colorado is $87,500 - $162,000. This is not a guarantee of compensation or salary, as final offer amount may vary based on factors including but not limited to experience and geographic location. TITLE:                            Senior Data Scientist/Engineer

 

COMPANY:                    AMI Group, LLC

 

REPORTS TO:               Chief Executive Officer

 

SALARY RANGE:        $120,000 - $140,000

 

JOB SUMMARY

 

Primarily responsible for providing data science support for various projects within Chicago Parking Meters, LLC (“CPM”).  The Senior Data Scientist assists in overseeing the activities of the data analyst(s) and provides advanced expertise and guidance on statistical and mathematical concepts for the data and analytics team. The Senior Data Scientist applies and inspires the adoption of advanced data science and analytics across the business.

The Senior Data Scientist synthesizes and leverages CPM’s data to enhance the business’ capabilities for overall goal achievement. The Senior Data Scientist is instrumental in helping the business continue its evolution into an analytical and data-driven culture.

This role of the Senior Data Scientist supports relevant stakeholders through quantitative analytics, and the application of appropriate advanced analytics for CPM’s key initiatives.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

 

  1. Provide advanced analysis, recommendations, and support for various projects within CPM. Projects include the rollout and ongoing performance measurement for CPM’s parking meter system and process improvements. The position will support and contribute to the success of these projects, including one or more of the following functions:

 

  1. Collect and manage project data, organize, analyze, and prepare reports on vendor and system performance.
  2. Develop statistical models in key areas of parking data including enforcement and demand.
  3. Assist in identifying and measuring Key Performance Indicators in numerous operational areas.
  4. Develop an understanding of the parking meter system requirements and project goals. Drawing upon this understanding and the collected project data, investigate options, draw conclusions and/or make recommendations as required.

 

  1. Manage the collection of meter data, which is supplied through the operator and meter equipment software and provide analysis of this data. As required, provide input and recommendations for leveraging this data to drive improved asset performance.

 

  1. Develop and support profitability analyses and models, including potential revenue, projected cost-savings, and operating efficiency maximization models. Recommend and develop automated processes for collecting data and managing output for these models. Participate in the development of industry leading work process, technology, revenue collection, and profitability analysis initiatives. 

 

  1. Implement and handle end-to-end data science products and analytics.

 

  1. Manipulate and extract ‘big data’ from large, disconnected datasets that can require complex queries and advanced knowledge of SQL with familiarity in a variety of databases.

 

  1. Work closely with team members and assist in developing the technical, statistical, and analytical skillsets of the data analyst(s). Direct and review the work of data analyst(s) and intern(s) to complete projects as required.

 

 


SKILLS, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

 

At least five years of data science experience, preferably working as a Senior Data Scientist and/or Data Engineer.  The candidate must also have had substantial experience working on strategy or full-life cycle data science as well as experience working with data mining tools such as Python, SQL and R. A suitable candidate for this position will also have had experience in data mining and predictive modeling including linear and non-linear regression, logistic regression, and time series analysis models. Statistical machine learning experience is preferred.   The candidate will also have had experience working with deep learning algorithms and large datasets as well as experience working with unstructured data and experience cleaning and manipulating data.

The Senior Data Scientist should have at least a bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or any other related quantitative field.  A master’s degree in a similar analytical field is preferred. 

 

The candidate must have the ability to organize and prioritize work, and to interpret and present information clearly and professionally.  Must be proactive, meet assigned deadlines, be able to work both independently and as part of a team, must have a strong ability to mobilize people and work with both internal and external contacts.

 

 


All applicants will be afforded equal opportunity without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identification, marital status, national origin or ancestry, age, physical or mental handicap unrelated to ability, or an unfavorable discharge from military service.

 

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

position: Data Analytics Intern - Global Fashion Brands
description:
TechStyle Fashion Group is currently seeking a Data Analytics Intern to join the Data Analytics and Global Fashion Brands team for Summer 2021.  

Job Overview & Responsibilities:  

The Data Analytics Intern will work directly with the GFB Data Analytics team to lead triage, discovery, design, and development of data solutions to empower business decisions. The right candidate would be a self-motivated, highly detail-oriented team-player excited to tackle organizational challenges to strategize and implement data driven solutions to enable the business to derive valuable insights. 

You will work with experienced data analytics leaders, including data analysts, engineers, and architects, to identify and solve high leverage problems with data solutions. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone interested in pursuing a career in data analytics.  

  • Leveraging academic knowledge of SQL in a work environment to identify high leverage issues and potential solutions 

  • Partnering with business users, senior architects, product managers, engineering teams, and other teams to deliver a robust set of data solutions for brand challenges 

  • Participating in cross-functional meetings to review business requirements/use stories, assist in fit/gap analysis and provide detailed technical design documentation 

  • Contribute to the strategy, prioritization, and execution of data solutions with a focus on business impact, return on investment, and customer experience across web and mobile 

  • Work crossfunctionally with stakeholders, including technical, business, and design teams 

Qualifications: 

  • Preferred majors/minors in Statistics, Business, Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another related fields 

  • Proficient in and experience coding in SQL, and excited to learn how to use SQL and Tableau to bring business valuable data insights 

  • Desire to leverage existing knowledge to gain hands on experience working with complex data structures and solving complex data problems and business problems with innovative data-drive solutions 

  • Analytical thinker with logical structuring skills and ability to communicate thought processes articulately 

  • Ability to learn quickly and multi-task in a fast-paced, dynamic environment 

The Intern Gig: TechStyle Fashion Group is looking for enthusiastic students with ambition to go far. Our full-time paid internship program will give you a chance to gain in-depth knowledge of what it is like to be a part of our fast-paced and innovative company. Our summer internship program will be conducted fully remotely, and will run for 9 weeks from June 14th-August 13th. Our interns have the unique opportunity to gain real work experience, while participating in skill-building workshops and interactive social activities throughout the duration of the internship assignment. 

**YOU MUST BE A RISING JUNIOR OR RISING SENIOR (graduating in 2022 or 2023) UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT ENROLLED AT AN ACCREDITED UNIVERSITY TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION**

We are one team from many backgrounds, innovating through diversity of individuals, who are driven by passion for creating an inclusive space for all. TechStyle will continue to champion a workplace culture that prizes diversity and inclusivity.

position: New Grad- Product Development- Cloud Management Performance Engineer
description:
VMware Product Intern and New Graduate Opportunities:

VMware recognizes that today’s students are tomorrow’s trailblazers and we value the opportunity to benefit from your fresh perspective. If you thrive in an open, innovative, technology-driven culture, VMware could be the place for you! You will be exposed to a wide range of software platform technologies that are utilized by customers all over the world.

Business Summary

The VMware Engineering Services team ensures our internal and external customers enjoy a high-quality experience across the entire product portfolio. Our goal is to provide compelling, innovative, scalable, and seamless engineering services, which will protect VMware’s brand reputation by continually improving customer satisfaction. We bring together key R&D functions such as build, performance, security, release management (and more), which frees up R&D business units to focus on product innovation. Our priorities include investing in R&D talent, sharing best practices, and driving scale and agility in VMware products. 

Job Role and Responsibility 

As a New Graduate at VMware, you’ll create innovative solutions and solve complex problems. You’ll take ownership of meaningful, big-picture projects and springboard into an impactful career. At VMware, you will become immersed in all aspects of our innovative and collaborative culture, and ensure you get the full VMware experience. You’ll interact with industry thought leaders and enjoy networking, community service, and career development events.

In VMware’s Performance Engineering team, you will drive scalability and performance of VMware’s management suite of products, that consists of vCenter Server (VC) and emerging cloud management software. You will learn in-depth about the existing solutions and products, new upcoming technologies and hardware trends. You will develop solutions to improve performance and scalability, write benchmarks to evaluate performance and identify and root cause performance issues. You will also be working with various cross functional teams with the opportunity to research ways to stress next generation software architectures for performance and cloud scale. You will have the opportunity to innovate in multiple ways.

  • Study workload characteristics to create a balanced suite of performance workloads

  • Develop standard benchmarks for performance measurement

  • Develop and automate performance measurement and data analysis tools

  • Develop performance diagnostics tools in the products

  • Analyze product performance and scalability across a variety of hardware and software configurations

  • Understand the products in depth to be able to identify bottlenecks in code/design/architecture

  • Root-cause performance problems and implement solutions to resolve them

Required Skills:

  • Pursuing Bachelor’s, Master’s in Computer Science or equivalent 

  • Coursework (in some) of the following: Operating systems, computer architecture, algorithms, storage, networking or distributed systems. 

  • Strong programming skills in Java. Go and Python is a plus.

  • School and/or industry projects involving significant design and development

  • Strong written and spoken communication skills

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience in performance measurement and analysis

  • Experience with application profiling tools such as Yourkit/JProfiler/Jprobe or Zoom/xperf

  • Experience in cloud management or micro-service architecture and related technologies like Docker, Kubernetes etc.

  • Previous internship experience is a plus

  • Interest to grow your career under a progressive team that emphasizes teamwork

Description

CME Group is the worlds leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. We’re small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And were looking for more.

Clearing/Quant Risk Management Internship

CME Group is currently looking for a Clearing/Quant intern. This candidate will assist the Clearing Department on day-to-day activities in support of Over The Counter Valuation in Clearing House Risk is responsible for developing, analyzing models for clearing initiatives. This is a Year-Round internship and we are looking to have this individual as soon as possible in the spring semester.

Principal Accountabilities: Daily responsibilities include code release testing, historical data validation. The candidate must have the ability to efficiently, effectively, and independently conduct research, analyze problems, formulate and implement solutions, and produce high quality results on time.

Skills / Software Requirements: • Strong quantitative and analytical background. • Excellent programming, communication, and documentation skills. • Knowledge of financial markets. • Knowledge in advanced quantitative risk modeling and knowledge of statistical models in risk management preferred. • Knowledge in advanced derivatives modeling and knowledge of volatility models preferred. • Experience with programming languages such as C++/C#, R, VBA, and SQL is also required. • Preference will be given to candidates who can demonstrate the best practices in developing risk models like Historical VaR, Monte Carlo VaR, Multi-Factor Risk Models, Stressed VaR, Liquidity Risk models, etc.

Education: • Bachelor or Masters in Computer Science, Financial Engineering, Financial Mathematics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related discipline. • Location in Chicago.

description:

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG is seeking 2 summer interns to work in the Electric Asset Strategy team in the following areas:

• Transformer Engineering Group: • Engineering and implementation support to assist the Reliability Centered Maintenance group with transformer analytics and design aspects for IBM Asset Health Performance Platform • Perform work with transformer data, systems, contractors, and the RCM group to achieve more efficient methods of equipment ranking compared to existing methods • Model testing with various data inputs to modify and enhance model accuracy • Summer project includes inputting additional in service system equipment data into CMMS/SAP to enhance equipment database • Identify TRV capacitors and arrestors in our system based off of the one-line drawings of various substations and properly enter them into CMMS • Transmission Engineering: • Provide support of engineering for hydraulic and mechanical design aspects of underground transmission system • Development of specifications and standards for installation of "pipe-type" and extruded cable systems (i.e. pressurization plants, valve cabinets, thermal dynamic and fluid expulsion calculations, piping design) • Validation and testing of the Company's Pipe-Type Cable leak detection thermal models • Examine field data collected from monitoring systems, examining accuracy of the model and its various inputs • Modify existing model to enhance data collection and model accuracy
Required Education/Skills: The successful candidate (s) must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or similar related major. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

3.0 GPA; .

Primary Job Duties and Responsibilities (Essential Job Function)

Development of technical or vocational college students who are pursuing an associate degree in applied science in a technical discipline. A Pipeline Technician Intern will be exposed to a variety of pipeline and compressor station operations, pipeline maintenance and other project activities that will provide an opportunity to apply knowledge and skills learned in college and demonstrate abilities in the workplace.

Typical Duties

Under the direction of the operations manager or team leader, support the teams and region specialists with daily operations, maintenance tasks, project activities or administrative duties.

Perform any additional responsibilities as requested or assigned.


Technical Skill Areas
Pipeline Technician Interns are multi-skilled employees who support Northern’s operational goals in each of the following technical areas based on company needs.

Controls - Install, maintain and troubleshoot programmable logic controllers, human machine interfaces, motor control centers, and medium and low voltage power distribution and pneumatic control devices utilized in pipeline operations.

Measurement - Program, maintain, operate and troubleshoot gas measurement equipment including gas meters, control valves, relief valves, regulators and associated software, as well as monitoring gas and quality control equipment.

Corrosion - Install, maintain and troubleshoot corrosion protection equipment to ensure pipeline integrity. NACE CP1 Tester certification is preferred.

Mechanical - Install, maintain, troubleshoot, overhaul and repair rotating and reciprocating compression equipment.

Liquefied Natural Gas Operations - Ensure reliable operation and maintenance of processes required to make liquefied natural gas.

Underground Storage Operations - Ensure reliable operation and maintenance of processes required to store and deliver natural gas from underground reservoirs.

Compressor Station Operations - Ensure reliable operation of compressor station equipment.

Pipeline - Perform pigging operations, damage prevention measures and pipeline right of way maintenance.

Equipment Operation - Transport, inspect, maintain and operate various mobile heavy equipment including backhoes, boom trucks, semi-trucks, dump trucks, excavators, skid loaders, etc. Additional endorsements for hazmat and liquefied natural gas transportation are available.

Welding - Pipeline welders must be qualified in API 1104 and ASME standards to weld on natural gas pipelines. Structural welders must be qualified in AWS standards.

Environmental - Maintain environmental standards, environmental activities and regulatory compliance for assigned locations.

Student currently enrolled in a technical or associate of applied science degree program from an accredited college. Areas of study include:

-Aviation Maintenance Technology
-Diesel Technology or Diesel Mechanics
-Natural Gas Technology or Natural Gas Transmission
-Natural Gas Measurement
-Gas Industrial Mechanics
-Natural Gas Compression Technology
-Electro-mechanical System Technology or Electrical Maintenance Technology
-Electronic Engineering Technology, Electronic System Technology, Electrical System Technology, Automated Systems Engineering, Instrument & Control Technology or Industrial Automation Technology
-Corrosion Technology

Proficiency with personal computer and various software (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, etc.).

Effective oral and written communication skills.

Effective analytical and problem-solving skills.

Support the company’s employee policies and procedures, including workplace safety rules.

Able to work in close quarters, work while kneeling, squatting, sitting, climbing and standing; also able to climb up and down ladders, stairs and platforms.

More information about this job:

Overview:

Sitting on over 1,600 acres in Western Rhode Island, The FM Global Research Campus is one of the worlds most innovative research and testing centers, including the Fire Technology Laboratory, which is the largest facility of its type. The research carried out in the Fire Technology Labs, Remote Test Site, where explosion tests are conducted and FM Approvals laboratories, help FM Global learn more about fire and explosion hazards. Our objective is to use these findings to increase technical knowledge and capabilities needed to provide state-of-the-art loss prevention solutions to FM Global and its customers.


Responsibilities:

The Research Engineering Internship provides a student with the opportunity to participate in Engineering and research projects throughout the campus supporting the campus and Approvals laboratories and systems that facilitate building, preparing, and conducting intermediate and large-scale fire, explosion tests, sprinkler, equipment testing and process automation system maintenance. While working under the supervision of a Research Engineer, this internship offers the student an opportunity to assist with and progress scientific and engineering projects by performing the following duties:

  • Intern will study under the mentorship of Mr. Richard Fortier, Senior Lead Research Engineer, FM Global Research Campus.
  • The internship focus will be on Research Capital and Expense projects, assisting the project manager in subcontractor monitoring, change order preparations, construction plan checking, submittal review, document control, quality control and safety monitoring.
  • The intern will assist in monitoring automation system performance and system/sub system documentation review and drawing modifications.
  • Intern will also at times study under the mentorship of Dr. Stan Kostka Senior Research Scientist at our FM Global Research Office in Norwood Mass on a Sprinkler Event Detection project, with his time sheets and reporting under Mr. Richard Fortier throughout the internship.

Qualifications:

  • Be enrolled and in a college or university and working towards an associate, bachelor, or masters degree in science, engineering, or technology
  • It is beneficial if the candidate is skilled with AutoCAD, LabView, Microsoft Office Applications or similar (Word and Excel at a minimum), and adept with computer usage
  • The applicant must be willing and comfortable working outside and with their hands in seasonal conditions, as well as inside large fire testing laboratories which may be wet and sooty
  • It is desirable for the applicant to be familiar with hand tools and have some basic mechanical skills
  • The student must be a good communicator in a team environment and have a desire to learn new skills
  • The student must be able to provide his/her own transportation to and from campus

Overview

20% - Help with various IT projects. Tasks may include gathering documentation, coordinating meetings, and interfacing with Company personnel and vendors.

Strong communication skills and attention to detail. Proficiency with basic computer functions and experience using Microsoft Office. Knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint is a plus. Requires U.S. Citizenship, U.S. Permanent Residency or other status as a U.S. Person. Must be able to satisfy federal government requirements for access to government information and having dual citizenship may preclude you from being able to meet this requirement.

May require the ability to travel by air or auto. May require the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, safety shoes, and shop coat. Reed Smith is a global relationship law firm with more than 1,700 lawyers in 29 offices throughout the United States, Europe, Asia and the Middle East.

Position Summary

The Reed Smith Client Value Internship program provides college students an introduction to the administrative function of the legal industry. As a cross-functional department, the Client Value Team sits at the intersection of Finance & Accounting, Marketing & Business Development, and Information Technology & Knowledge Management. Interns will work collaboratively with team members to create and execute financial, marketing, and technology projects. Students will learn to work in a group environment and build interpersonal skills.

If this internship is being completed for school credit, we will complete the necessary employer requirement for the student to receive credit.  The intern position pays $15.00 per hour.

Essential Functions

  • Assist team members with the preparation of internal and external financial reports.
  • Assist team members with creating pricing proposals for clients and prospects.
  • Support team members with legal project management activities.
  • Support team members with marketing collateral to promote the firm's Client Value initiative .

Requirements

Education:Candidates must be enrolled in a four-year degree program and have completed at least two years of course work. Preference is given to candidates within one year of graduation. Preferred majors include business administration, finance, economics, and accounting

Experience:Experience not required.

Skills:

  • Ability to receive instructions and complete tasks with minimum supervision. Ability to prioritize in a fast-paced work environment.
  • Ability to work as part of a highly distributed team, including being able to build and maintain relationships with supervisors, peers and internal customers.
  • Ability to work with mathematical concepts, including fractions, percentages, ratios and proportions to practical situations.
  • Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form.
  • Microsoft Office Suite with a focus on Excel skills.
  • Excellent written and oral presentation skills.

Other

Supervisory Responsibilities:None.

Equipment To Be Used: Personal computer and other office equipment such as telephone, calculator, fax, machine, copier, scanner, etc.

Typical Physical Demands: Manual dexterity sufficient to operate standard office equipment.

Typical Mental Demands: Able to deal with stress associated with fast-paced work environment. Multiple priorities/tasks. Make judgment decisions and adapt to changing work situations. Grasp and apply new ideas. Communicate with various personalities at all levels.

Working Conditions: Works in typical office setting. Occasionally called upon to work hours in excess of your normal daily schedule.

 

Reed Smith offers a challenging work environment, business casual dress code and a total compensation package for full time regular employees that includes a competitive salary, flexible benefits program, tuition assistance, and generous 401 (k) plan.

Overview

The Continuous Improvement internship is offered to students in order to educate them on use of the Lean Tools (CI) and related activities and provide the opportunity for visiting the plant, observing Lean Masters performing their work, and looking at how issues are identified and addressed in the manufacturing processes.The internship will be for a period of 3 months during the summer. At the San Diego facility, products are designed and manufactured to protect our ships, aircraft, and most importantly, our country. Join the Cobham San Diego team and gain valuable experience while helping protect U.S. and allied forces around the world. Cobham has hired a number of interns upon their graduation. Our team of engineers are excellent mentors, work with interns to maximize the benefits students can achieve from working in a real manufacturing environment.

Responsibilities

  • Validate current process thru time observations
  • Maintain methods, operation sequence and optimize processes in the manufacture or fabrication of parts, components, sub-assemblies and final assemblies
  • May include development and validation of SWCS
  • Expand and Implement concepts, including Lean Manufacturing, etc., to reduce manufacturing cost and increase process throughput; evaluate new materials and supplies in use based on project scope
  • Collaborate with all levels of CI and drafting new ideas
  • Prepare reports, publishes and makes presentations to communicate findings
  • Help in the creation of visual controls
  • Participate in safety training and comply with safety policies and practices
  • Apply manufacturing principles and practices to specific processes; re-writes processes to correct errors or maximize manufacturing efficiencies
  • Perform other related duties as assigned


Qualifications

Minimum:
  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Actively in process of attaining a Bachelor of Science degree in Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Technology or related Discipline


Preferred:
  • Communication skills: ability to receive messages by telephone, in person, electronically and in writing; ask questions and rephrase statements to clarify meaning; ability to read, interpret and comprehend complex written technical publications; communicate quality, integrity and respect in a way that inspires others and encourages innovation and possibilities
  • Computer skills: working in networked environment using a Windows and or Windows like interface using PowerPoint, Excel, and Word software programs at an advance level; LabView programming a plus
  • Math & Analytical skills: advanced mathematical skills, including statistical analysis; review and compare data to identify inconsistencies and determine priorities; ability to collect, analyze and summarize information to a general understanding; ability to think abstractly and separate complex ideas into simple elements
  • Time Management and Organization skills: flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and assignments; ability to maintain confidentiality; work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information
  • Excellence Behaviors: remain engaged, proactive and positive even in tough circumstances; own assignment to be fully accountable for their success; align actions, behaviors and conversations to what matters most; ability to work independently and as a team member.

Dow has an exciting part-time cooperative education job opportunity available in Houston, TX. This position is open to qualified and highly-committed college students enrolled in a fully accredited college or university located very close to the Houston Dow Center. We are hoping to fill this role in June. Unlike a short-term internship project outside of school terms, this particular role is a long-term, year-round, undergraduate student position -- at least two full years in duration --while the student is simultaneously taking classes toward an undergraduate degree. This opportunity offers the student valuable professional work experience in a dynamic, multi-national corporation interfacing with colleagues and leaders in many different roles. This program is designed for academically successful students who meet ALL of the specific job and co-op program requirements listed below and who can simultaneously succeed both in school and in a professional work environment.

Job Purpose

The position exists to provide administrative support to the Business Communications organization.

Key Job Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Actively participate in monthly team meetings by providing project status

  • Assist with submitting, filing, and tracking purchase orders and invoices in North America budget spreadsheet

  • Provide event and campaign support including actively participating on planning team, helping with communications, ordering/sending supplies, and potentially provide on-site support for tradeshows and other special events

  • Write, proofread and distribute internal communications nationally

  • Assist with updating internal and external web content

  • Schedule meetings and handle logistics as needed

  • Copy/Scan/Fax as needed

  • Order supplies as requested by the communications team

  • Arrange travel for team including providing options/booking

  • Serve as team focal point for sending/receiving packages

  • Take on other communications projects/duties as requested by the team

Required & Preferred Qualifications

  • While no particular academic major is required for this position, those pursuing Communications, Public Affairs, Public Relations, or Business majors are preferred and likely the best fit.

  • Student must have excellent computer skills and preferably experience using Microsoft applications, particularly Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint and Word.

  • Effective interpersonal skills with the ability to work both independently and within a team are essential.

  • Those with very good grammar and communication skills and with a high degree of organization would be most advantaged in this role.

  • Demonstrated ability to effectively multi-task, prioritize and manage various responsibilities simultaneously is extremely important in this fast-paced working environment.

  • Must be self-motivated and have a desire to do whatever is needed to assist the team and be able to adjust to changing priorities.

  • A high degree of reliability and professionalism is expected in this role.

Critical Requirements of the Local Student Co-Op Program

  • High school diploma/GED and already enrolled at an accredited college or university located close to the Houston Dow Center, pursuing an undergraduate degree.

  • Successfully complete a minimum of 6 credit hours per term during both the Fall and Winter terms (~Sept-Apr).

  • Seeking high performing student with strong GPAs of 3.000+; however, a minimum 2.700+ term and cumulative GPA on a 4.000 scale is required at ALL times – both to enter and to continue working in the Dow co-op program.  Attach a screen capture from your school’s website or a copy of your most recent transcripts/grade report showing classes and recent GPAs to this application.  Eligibility to continue in this cooperative education program is checked every term.

  • Able to begin work very soon, usually within 3 weeks of the job offer, and work year-round at least 20 hours each week ONLY during our regular business hours (8am-5pm, Mon-Fri…max 8 hours/day and 30/week during school).

  • Commit to the role for at least 2 full calendar years (BEFORE completing classes for your stated undergraduate degree or BEFORE transferring out of the area).  Students available for two years before completing their degree program are preferred and advantaged. 

  • Reliable attendance and punctuality in commuting to work daily or at least 3 days a week; therefore, dependable transportation, dedication and time management skills are absolutely required. 

  • Registered/enrolled in their school's Cooperative Education Program before the first day at Dow and comply with the school’s policies/requirements, in addition to Dow's, for the duration of co-op employment. 

  • Any current Dow college co-ops wishing to transfer into this role must have been in their current role at least one full year, must have at least two full years left before graduating or transferring out of the area, and must have supervisor approval before applying to each Dow co-op job posting.

​

Candidates who receive a job offer will be required to pass a background check and drug screen/medical evaluation and will verify school-related requirements and I-9 documentation before being hired into Dow.

A minimum requirement for the U.S. based position is the ability to work legally in the United States.  No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.

HELIX Environmental Planning, Inc

Description:

HELIX Environmental Planning, Inc. (HELIX), a California-based environmental consulting and planning firm, is seeking an Environmental Planner(s) for its Placer County office in Roseville, California. HELIX offers environmental, biological, landscape architecture, regulatory permitting, cultural resources, acoustical, air quality, habitat restoration, and GIS services to both the public and private sectors. Our Environmental Planning Division prepares CEQA/NEPA documentation and supporting technical studies for a wide range of projects including highways, rail, airports, energy/utilities and water/wastewater facilities, planned communities, commercial/industrial development, educational facilities, agricultural and mining operations and military facilities.


Why work for HELIX? We are an employee-owned firm, hard-working with a casual and collaborative work environment. Our employees describe us as Client-focused, Caring, Team-oriented, Focused on Integrity, and Flexible. In addition to our competitive benefit package, we have robust, award-winning wellness and community volunteer programs and much more! We are excited to meet you!


The Environmental Planner position involves research and preparation of multi-disciplinary environmental documents in compliance with CEQA and/or NEPA, working as a member of a multi-disciplinary team. In addition, the position may support HELIX's biology, noise, air quality/greenhouse gas and other specialists in conducting field work and in the preparation of technical studies. Training will be provided.


The Environmental Planner position is best suited for a candidate with a positive attitude and strong research, writing, mathematical/scientific, analytical and verbal communication skills. Writing will comprise a major part of the responsibilities of the position. This individual must have the ability to coordinate effectively with multiple planning project managers, and to prioritize and complete high-quality work within specified deadlines. Attention to detail, including strong spelling, proofreading, and organizational skills, is required. The applicant must have a strong work ethic, positive attitude and experience working in a team-oriented environment. A test of practical skills will be required of final candidates.

Please note that this is not a laboratory, environmental testing or hazardous materials studies/management position.


Please submit a cover letter in addition to your resume.


HELIX is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage all qualified applicants to apply regardless of gender, race, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age, family status, or veteran status.


Salary DOE


. Requirements:

Minimum Requirements for the Environmental Planner:

· Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in environmental studies, environmental science, geography, natural science, environmental engineering, public planning, or a related field

· Knowledge of the California environmental and regulatory setting, obtained through intern, volunteer or work experience (outside of the academic requirements)

· Strong written and verbal communication skills in the English language

· Strong research, mathematical/scientific and analytical skills

· Strong computer skills including proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint


Additional qualifications considered a plus:

· Master's degree (or equivalent) in environmental studies, environmental science, geography, natural science, environmental engineering, public planning, business, or a related field

· Related professional work experience in the research and writing of CEQA and/or NEPA documents, such as EIRs, EISs, Initial Studies, and MNDs, or supporting technical studies/analyses of biology, economic/fiscal, noise, air quality, agriculture, water quality, geology, or visual or community impacts

· Knowledge of the Northern California/Central Valley environmental and regulatory setting with related education and/or experience within that setting

· Knowledge of the mobile data collection process, with Trimble GPS units using Pathfinder and Terrasync software as well as ArcGIS for Collector using ArcGIS Online for Organizations

· Experience as a field assistant for noise or air quality monitoring, or on biological surveys


PM21
