GENERAL SUMMARY OF POSITION:

Under the direction of the assigned manager, the Graduate Intern is responsible for project-based tasks to support a designated department.  These tasks may be administrative or research oriented, depending on the department. Assigned projects will require advanced analytical and communications skills. For research-based departments, the Graduate Intern will be responsible for complex laboratory tasks. Primary communications will be in a team environment within assigned department and will be focused on collecting the appropriate input for the assigned projects.  Specific job responsibilities will vary by department but may include information gathering, analysis, writing, editing and/or laboratory work.  This is a temporary, non-benefitted role.

 

 


MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES (Administrative):

  • Perform complex and varied executive/administrative tasks  which require a high degree of independent action and the setting of priorities and procedures
  • Conduct advanced research to assist other team members
  • Create reports and perform in-depth data analysis
  • Implement and manage tasks in accordance with departmental objectives
  • Perform assigned project tasks within specified timeframes
  • Perform other duties as required

 

MAJOR RESPONSIBLITIES (Research):

  • Perform complex experiments according to written protocols
  • Perform advanced statistical analysis of data, genetic analysis and/or clinical studies
  • Perform advanced library searches, reading and copying relevant materials
  • Perform complex laboratory maintenance tasks
  • Operate  research equipment (i.e. scintillation counters, microscopes, centrifuges, balances) and record results
  • Prepare laboratory media and solutions
  • Perform other duties as required

 

 


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Graduate school candidate
  • Related experience preferred
  • Advanced analytical and communication skills
  • Attention to detail with the ability to collect and record information from a wide variety of sources 
  • Ability to use standard office tools and software (MS-Office)
  • Must be reliable and able to set consistent work hours

SUPERVISION RECEIVED:

Under the direction of the assigned manager

 

SUPERVISION EXERCISED:

None

 

ENVIRONMENTAL WORKING CONDITIONS:

Usual office environment or laboratory environment


Graduate Research Intern

Location

University of Massachusetts Medical School, Worcester, MA, USA

Description

Department of Population and Quantitative Health Sciences (PQHS) is recruiting 1-2 prospective students to participate research development in natural language processing (NLP) and clinical informatics. It will involve designing and developing innovative NLP systems based on machine learning/deep learning approaches, to extract and analyze meaningful information from electronic health records (EHR) and radiology reports for improving patient safety and healthcare outcome.

 

The recruit will work under supervision of Dr. Feifan Liu and has opportunities to interact with talented computer scientists, linguists and physicians at UMMS. With more than 10 years of NLP research experiences and a joint faculty appointment at department of radiology and QHS, Dr. Liu has passion in performing novel interdisciplinary research to leverage big data for next generation of clinical intelligence.

Qualifications

  • PhD/MS student in computer science, data science, or related field
  • Proficient in scikit-learn/pytorch or other platforms for developing machine learning and deep learning applications
  • Solid programming skills in Python, Java or C++
  • Familiar with Unix/Linux environment, SQL database, parallel computing
  • Experience in natural language processing and/or image processing
  • Ability to work independently with minimum supervision
  • Self-motivated learning, results oriented and able to meet deadlines
  • Excellent inter-personal skills and teamwork spirit
  • Excellent writing and oral communication skills

Application

Applicants please email

feifan.liu@umassmed.edu

your updated resume and 1-page cover letter to briefly state your background, knowledge and skills that are directly related to this position. You may include “Intern Application 2019” in the subject line.

position: Data Scientist Intern - Applied Research Team
description:
SparkCognition catalyzes sustainable growth for their clients throughout the world with proven artificial intelligence (AI) systems, award-winning machine learning technology, and a multinational team of AI thought-leaders. Clients are trusted with advancing lives, infrastructure, sustainability, and financial systems across the globe. They partner with SparkCognition to understand their industry’s most pressing challenges, analyze complex data, empower decision-making, and transform human and industrial productivity. With leading-edge artificial intelligence products—Darwin®️, DeepArmor®️, SparkPredict®️, and DeepNLPTM—SparkCognition’s clients can adapt to a rapidly changing digital landscape and accelerate their business strategies. 

We are seeking a Data Science Intern to join our team of Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers on the Applied Research Team. At SparkCognition, you will develop the latest tools in Machine Learning and Deep Learning to solve challenging real-world problems. Specifically, the project involves exploring a hard problem involving seismic imaging. Experience in seismic interpretation for oil exploration is desired. This is a paid internship that requires a highly motivated and results-driven personality who will thrive in a fast-paced environment. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual who wants to work as part of a skilled team to gain valuable experience with a variety of products and industries.

Who you are

 

You’re a junior or above pursuing a degree in Computer Science with a Data Science concentration or Masters/PhD candidates in Math/Physics/Statistics and are interested in crafting solutions to complex problems. Alternatively, you’re an advanced student in geoscience and you have experience using Machine Learning for seismic imaging. You are a highly motivated and results-driven individual who thrives in fast-paced environments.

 

What you’ll do

  • Work on our Research team of data scientists and machine learning engineers on solving inverse problems involving seismic imaging.
  • Work on a supercomputer running massive Machine Learning jobs.
  • Be paired with a data science mentor to guide you throughout the internship

 

What we’re looking for

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelors, Masters, or PhD in Computer Science (or related field) or Geosciences with experience using Machine Learning
  • Positive attitude and a strong team player
  • Available to work full-time for 10 weeks during the Summer
  • Expertise with Python or similar Machine Learning languages/packages
  • Expertise with Machine Learning algorithms and techniques
  • Familiarity with neural networks and at least one deep learning framework (Tensorflow, PyTorch)
  • Detail-oriented self-starter who can independently manage deadlines in a remote environment

Cyber Security Business Analyst Intern - Virtual Internship Summer 2021

Morsco is offering virtual internships this summer.

The details:

You will not need to relocate as you will be working remotely

You will receive a company laptop to borrow for the duration of your internship

The internship will be 40 hours a week, Monday-Friday, during normal business hours.

Starting May through August

Overview

This role will be remote for summer 2021 but candidates should be open to working in Dallas if they are converted to a full-time employee after graduation. The position is within the Digital Solutions Software Engineering team.

A successful intern should possess an understanding of both information security and computer science. They should understand basic concepts such as networking, applications, and operating system functionality and be able to learn advanced concepts such as application manipulation, exploit development, and stealthy operations. This career is technical and challenging with opportunities to work in some of the most exciting areas of security consulting on extremely technical and challenging work.

Responsibilities:

Perform network penetration, web and mobile application testing, source code reviews, threat analysis, wireless network assessments and social engineering assessment

Build internal scripts, tools and methodologies to enhance our capabilities

Develop comprehensive and accurate reports and presentations for both technical and executive audiences

Qualifications:

Currently pursuing a degree in Cyber Security, computer science, computer engineering or information technology

Technical skills in at least two of the following areas:

Network penetration testing and manipulation of network infrastructure

Mobile and/or web application assessments

Email, phone, or physical social-engineering assessments

Shell scripting or automation of simple tasks using Perl, Python, or Ruby

Developing, extending, or modifying exploits, shellcode or exploit tools

Developing applications in C#, ASP, .NET, ObjectiveC, Go, or Java (J2EE)

Reverse engineering malware, data obfuscators, or ciphers

Source code review for control flow and security flaws

A technical security-related internship, security related projects or other similar experience

Must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship

Additional Qualifications:

Strong technical acumen and ability to quickly assimilate new information

Ability to successfully interface with clients (internal and external) and manage expectations of others

Ability to document and explain technical details in a concise, understandable manner


MORSCO is a leading U.S. distributor of commercial and residential plumbing, waterworks and HVAC, with showrooms across the country. Since our inception in November 2011, we've grown rapidly through a series of acquisitions and store openings. MORSCO 's family of brands consists of Morrison Supply, DeVore & Johnson, Murray Supply, Wholesale Specialties, Express Pipe & Supply, Farnsworth Wholesale, and Fortiline Waterworks. In 2018, MORSCO was acquired by The Reece Group, Australia's leading provider of plumbing, HVAC and waterworks products.

MORSCO is an EEO/AA/Disability/Vets Employer

STRATTEC Security Corporation is one of the world's largest suppliers providing access and security systems to the automotive market. This drives us to be an innovative company with the latest technology. STRATTEC creates exciting opportunities to people who like to work in an environment that challenges them to be creative, deal with multiple customers and projects, and research the latest technology. You will help STRATTEC to be a pioneer by working closely with the largest automotive customers in the world along with the largest electronic partners.

 

Let us know who you are! We want to know what motivates you and why you are the ideal candidate for our growing team. The ideal candidate will possess a team oriented attitude; have a multidiscipline background, and a passion for innovation. We are looking for leadership skills to develop a new group internally.

 

If you are one who like to build a team, has strong skillsets and likes to see your own ideas come to life, apply quickly!

 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES .

  • Learn on the job experience on the various computer applications used, their capabilities and their use, through the means of self-paced tutorials and every day real world experiences.
  • First level general Helpdesk support for End-Users focusing on proper operation of computer hardware and applications; Microsoft Office, Adobe Acrobat, Groupwise email, Internet browsers and others.
  • Provide user hardware support for workstation, printer, and plotter issues.
  • Assist with computer system imaging using standardized desktop management tools.
  • Assist with backup and archive operations.
  • Continued development into a strong and effective team player while working with a geographically distributed support team.
  • Ensure documentation standards are created and adhered to.
  • Participate in projects and testing as required.
  • Research, troubleshoot, and resolve issues reported via Helpdesk.
  • Ability to track and close tickets in the Helpdesk queue.
  • Other duties may be assigned

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

-At minimum, a High School diploma and in the process of obtaining either a four year bachelor’s degree, Sophomore standing. an Associate's degree (A. A.) or equivalent from a two-year College or technical school in Engineering, Information Technology or Computer Science.

-This is a year round internship and the right candidate must be available to work during the school year and during the summer break.

                                                                               

 

DESIRED COMPUTER SKILLS          

  • Novice computer skills with a minimum of “basic-to-moderate” skills in the operation of computer hardware and software; including but not limited to MS-Office, Internet Explorer/Chrome/FireFox, e-mail, and more.

  • Conceptual understanding of basic networking and network protocols such as TCP/IP, RDP, TELNET, FTP.
  • Conceptual understanding of basic wired and wireless networking.
  • Aptitude for learning quickly and a strong desire to become a computer support expert.

Urban Science is a business-solutions company focused on supporting the needs of the sales and marketing function of the automotive industry. We leverage a scientific methodology to help our client partners sell more vehicles, improve profitability and increase customer loyalty.  And we do that by helping solve their toughest challenges including planning an optimal dealership network, improving individual dealer performance and efficiently converting sales leads into sales. In short, we guide business through science—and we’ve been doing this since 1977.

 

OVERVIEW

The Data Engineering Intern will assist with functions of the Global Data Services team for daily data processing operations and supporting software tooling.  The intern will aid in specific project work and enhance their skillset.

 


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Data Processing
    • Interact with Urban Science client databases, utilizing Urban Science proprietary software and commercial tooling
    • Execute ongoing and ad hoc processing of data
    • Troubleshoot data processing issues
    • Apply data analysis methods and tools to enhance data cleansing and readiness for use
    • Create and generate data reports and deliverables
    • Follow data confidentiality and regulatory compliance standards
  • Data Tooling Implementation
    • Develop maintainable data pipelines, including the required software technologies
    • Employ a variety of languages and tools (e.g. scripting or compiled languages) to marry systems and sources together
    • Apply software engineering best practices, data management fundamentals, data storage principles, recent advances in distributed systems, and operational excellence best practices
    • Perform research and acquire new knowledge and skills on new technologies, processes, and tools for use in data management
    • Document developed tooling and processing for sustainable reuse

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, abilities, and competencies required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Self-starter, detail and process oriented individual, with a strong desire to learn an Data Engineering and related skillsets
  • Requires ability to:
    • Create and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues and/or customers
    • Behave in a trustworthy & transparent manner
    • Monitor and check work related information and deliverables ensuring high quality and accuracy and paying strong attention to detail  
    • Work cooperatively with others and be part of a team
    • Communicate ideas, facts and data in writing using appropriate grammar and syntax
  • Requires initial exposure to:
  • SQL storage technologies, with a preference for Microsoft SQL server
  • Relational data modeling
  • Data integration and processing
  • Software Engineering practices and processes
  • Configuration management & deployment
  • Exposure to basic programming languages such as: C#, python, HTML/XHTML, XML/XSLT, .NET, JavaScript
  • Willingness to learn new technology and possibly merge together many different technologies into a single solution

 

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

  • Currently pursuing a Baccalaureate degree in an appropriate IT field such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Management Information Systems from an accredited U.S. college or university, equivalent foreign institution, or equivalent experience.

 

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

DISCLAIMER

This description is intended to describe the type and level of work being performed by a person assigned to this position.  It is NOT an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required by a person so classified. The job may require additional hours beyond the normal 40-hour workweek.

Acrisure Technology Group (ATG) is a fast paced, AI-driven team building innovative software to disrupt the $6T+ insurance industry.  Our mission is to help the world share its risk more intelligently to power a more vibrant economy. To do this, we are transforming insurance distribution and underwriting into a science. 

At the core of our operating model is our technology: we're building the premier AI Factory in the world for risk and applying it at the center of Acrisure, a privately held company recognized as one of the world's top 10 insurance brokerages and the fastest growing insurance brokerage globally. By using the latest technology and advances in AI to push the boundaries of understanding risk, we are systematically converting data into predictions, insights, and choices, and we believe we can remove the constraints associated with scale, scope, and learning that have existed in the insurance industry for centuries. 

We are a small team of extremely high caliber engineers with a diverse background across industries and technologies. Our engineers have worked at large companies like Google and Amazon, high frequency trading companies like TwoSigma and Jump Trading, and a variety of smaller startups, including successful startup founders.

 

The Role

As an AI Engineer Intern, you'll help move artificial intelligence out of the labs and into production in a way that transforms the insurance industry. You'll help build cutting edge AI systems that aid our customers in ways they might not deem possible. As a successful candidate, you combine machine learning and deep learning experience with strong computer science fundamentals and software engineering experience. You will take full advantage of state-of-the-art algorithms and tools, conceiving of new ones when the right solution does not yet exist. You work with modern ML tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Spark, Kubeflow, and MLFlow to create robust, scalable, state-of-the-art products. You are driven by a passion for improving the world through technology. Help us to turn vision into reality. 

Our technology runs on Google Cloud and is configured with Kubernetes, leveraging various services in that environment. Our data storage layer includes BigQuery, BigTable, and Postgres. We code primarily in Kotlin, Python, Java, and JavaScript and make use of many frameworks, including Dataflow, Cloud AI Platform, KubeFlow, Spring, and React.

 

Here are some of the ways in which you'll achieve impact:

  • Build efficient and reliable technology with a customer-first mindset.
  • Develop and deploy production ML models to solve business problems
  • Participate in model reviews alongside a leading team of AI researchers and AI engineers, helping to grow a world-class center of excellence for applied AI
  • Assist in designing and maintaining our tech stack, building when it makes sense, inventing when necessary, and upgrading as tools evolve.
  • Identify, adopt, and evangelize best practices.
  • Measure the effectiveness of new features, find and address performance issues, and drive continuous improvement.
  • Work collegially and effectively as we grow a world-class, diverse engineering team.
  • Design and conduct experiments, solving complex measurement challenges.

 

You may be fit for this role if you:

  • Possess exceptional knowledge of machine learning, computer science fundamentals, and software engineering principles.
  • Possess theoretical understanding and practical experience with machine learning algorithms for regression, classification, clustering, and unsupervised learning.
  • Have experience putting quantitative models into production, including by using deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch, workflow tools such as Kubeflow, etc.
  • Take a scientific, data-driven approach to problems, with a solid understanding of statistics (Frequentist and Bayesian) and applied mathematics.
  • Have an ability to measure, understand, and debug complex integrated systems.
  • Are product and customer focused, with a passion for delighting the end user.
  • Possess empathy, kindness towards others, a positive attitude, and self-awareness.
  • Obtaining a Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Are willing and able to work remote for Summer 2021.
  • Are excited to work for an early stage company to experiment, discover product-market fit and are focused on maximizing business impact.

 

It's not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of these areas. If you are a solid engineer and eager to work on data- or insurance-related platforms/products, we are eager to talk!

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. Job Summary

As a Technology Professional this role is an entry level role that provides college hires the opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects throughout the Information Technology organization. This position prepares candidates for advanced information technology positions through challenging assignments, and allows them to develop their skills and launch an exciting career in information technology. They will learn and assist in various technology projects and programs such as assisting in the development of processes and procedures related to business continuity and disaster recovery of IT systems. Participating in various projects assisting teams in ensuring systems and infrastructure plan for and incorporate required resiliency to meet business needs for high availability. In this entry level role, the successful candidate will be exposed to various IT technologies and will develop skills related to system design, integration, support and operations.

Job Responsibilities

•As a Sr Technology Professional, this role is a natural growth progression for Technology Professionals who have gained 2 or more years of relevant technology experience. They will provide technical and/or business analysis in support of technology applications or infrastructure. Analyzes simple to moderately complex inquiries and determines appropriate technical area or vendor to resolve problems and makes suggestions for improvements. Responsible for executing smaller projects and/or support tasks and typically maintain a high level of direct client interaction. • Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

Desired:

• Knowledge of testing methodologies and/or project management
• Experience designing and maintaining high availability systems or infrastructure including building and maintaining disaster recovery environments.
• Certifications in technical specialties such as Microsoft, Cisco, etc.
• Prior experience supporting a Windows environment
• Familiarity with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP networks
Knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley controls

position: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern - Full Stack Developer
description:
Requisition ID: 282257

Work Area: Software-Design and Development

Expected Travel: 0 - 10%

Career Status: Student

Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. Thats why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.


SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because its the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve peoples lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program:


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP:


1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


SAP SuccessFactors is the platform that empowers employees to perform at their best, and for the business to streamline the way they handle HR.


We’re a multi-tenant SaaS offerings company, automating HR-centric processes—encompassing the entire lifecycle of employee and business partner engagement. We have: 7000 customers, 100 million users and peak daily transaction rates of 1 BILLION per day.


What you’ll do:


Position Title: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern – Full Stack Developer

Location : (Virtual)

Expected start date to end date : June 7th- August 13th, 2021


In this role, you’ll:

• Have the unique opportunity to design, develop and deliver core experiences of our new applications using Java, SAP UI5

• Collaborate and innovate with Product, Design and other engineering teams to deliver a seamless, consistent and engaging user experience for millions of users

• Design and develop front-end interfaces, RESTful APIs and backend systems


Who you are:


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


• Candidates to currently be enrolled in an undergraduate or masters degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent proven experience).

• Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript, SQL, CSS

• Experience developing rich applications with HTML/CSS/JS

• Strong communication skills that include the ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions.

• Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies

• Preferred experience: familiarity with Gradle, Microservices, CI/CD tools using Jenkins, Github. Experience building cloud applications is a plus (eg. Google Cloud Platform, AWS and Azure).


WHAT YOU GET FROM US


Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. description:
Description

 

We have a wide variety of career opportunities around the world — come find yours.

Technical Operations 

Technical Operations is the maintenance, repair, and overhaul division of United. The department includes aircraft maintenance technicians, engineers, planners, ground equipment and facilities teams, supply chain teams and more.

Job overview and responsibilities

Ready to join one of the world's leading airlines and work in a fast-paced, challenging environment and like to solve complex problems, then join a dynamic, enthusiastic, and innovative team in one of United Airlines Technical Operations Teams. As an intern you are a part of the United team, you'll learn everything you need to take your career higher by working alongside one of our diverse teams. We are hiring interns for the summer in the following areas.  
Based on your qualifications you can be placed in one of the many of the teams that support our operations.  

Highlights of teams below:

Technical Services Engineering, Maintenance Programs, Quality Assurance and Training:  You may work with engineers in writing engineering paperwork, analyzing maintenance programs, or assisting in analyzing data from a wide variety of data bases. As a Technical Services Intern you are a part of the team and will be given projects that directly support the team you are working with during the internship. We recruit for students in mechanical, electrical, aeronautical, and aerospace engineering degree programs as well as other technical related degree programs. 

Planning: Optimize maintenance plans to minimize out of service aircraft, maximize capacity utilization, and reduce overall life cycle cost. We recruit students from engineering, mathematics, and business administration degree programs.

Data Analytics: Data mining, discovering trends, creating analysis, assisting with continuous improvements, and giving presentations.  We recruit students from degree programs quantitative field like mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, and econometrics. With experience or familiarity with coding in Python and/or R; database querying tools (ex. SQL); visualization tools (ex. Tableau, Spotfire) and manipulating and analyzing complex, high volume, high dimensionality data from various sources to highlight patterns and relationships.

Process Standardization and Strategy: Manage process improvement, process standardization, and evaluating technology solutions. We recruit students from degree programs in computer science, computer or electrical engineering, information management & technology industrial or general engineering
information systems.

Airframe Vendor Maintenance: Compare financial and performance data. We recruit students from degree programs from engineering, business logistics, or finance.

Ground Services Equipment (GSE):  Plan equipment deployment based on mission requirements, aircraft effectivity, station modeling methodologies, equipment capabilities, environment, and federal / local governance. We recruit students from degree programs in business administration, project management, and engineering management. 

Internships are paid and Interns are eligible for travel privileges.

Interns are placed throughout our system, depending on the project / discipline; however, this year most work will be done remote.  Travel for certain internships could be a part of the work program.


Responsibilities could include:

  • Provide aircraft engineering support to line and check aircraft
  • Review, evaluate, and determine next steps on manufacturer bulletins, management requests and regulatory requirements on United Airlines Airbus/Boeing aircraft
  • Prepare cost analysis on projects
  • Investigate and provide decisions for non-conformances resulting from in-service failures or maintenance incidents
  • Extract data from a variety of sources for use in analysis and models to communicate results

Qualifications

 

Required 

  • Must have a minimum of 12 semester hours in core degree course work
  • Individual should be a rising junior (at minimum) when internship begins
  • Summer internships occur end of May/beginning of June – mid/late August
  • If needed, United will provide air transportation to/from internship location during the term of employment for any scheduled meeting
  • Work related travel may be required, individuals must be able to travel without any restrictions
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship
  • Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualification
  • Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position

Medscape, a division of WebMD, develops and hosts physician portals and related mobile applications that make it easier for physicians and healthcare professionals to access clinical reference sources, stay abreast of the latest clinical information, learn about new treatment options, earn continuing medical education credits and communicate with peers.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Intern – BI
Summer Internship – 6/7 – 8/20

Local applicants only, no housing assistance offered. 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Acquire data from different data sources and correlate, and map data to develop new integrated data sets using business logic
  • Filter and “clean” data, and review reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Data profiling and data cataloging
  • Solving business and technical problems using innovative and well-planned approaches
  • Communicating, verbally and written, with both business and technical stakeholders to achieve project objectives
  • Working in an environment that leverages project management skills, including planning and tracking, issue and risk management, multitasking, team organization and activity prioritization
  • Collaborating and contributing as a team member by understanding personal and team roles, contributing to a positive working environment by building solid relationships with team members and proactively seeking guidance, clarification

 

Qualifications:

Required:

  • Minimum 3.2 GPA
  • Enrolled in Undergrad or Graduate program and returning for the Fall 2021 semester.
  • computer science, mathematics, engineering or related majors

Must show experience on your resume with Data Manipulation and some of the following:

  • Experience with SQL or Python
  • Experience with using databases like Vertica or Google Big Query
  • Experience with Tableau, Excel or any other BI Tool

Preferred:

  • Writing with the ability to produce clear and concise documentation;
  • Working within a structured and methodical approach, combined with an inquiring mind;
  • Having an aptitude for problem solving, with the ability to take a logical route to the source of an error;
  • Exhibiting a work modality that is open to new ideas and possessing a strong passion for learning and understanding new and emerging technologies, techniques, tools, etc.;
  • Innovating through new and existing technologies, along with helping to support the experimentation of digitizing solutions.
  • We seek professionals with a thorough interest in managing digital solutions on a large scale.

At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You’ll always feel empowered and valued here. 

 

Incredible teams doing exceptional work, every day

As an intern, you will gain hands-on experience at a high-growth company that values its people. You’ll earn a competitive starting wage while absorbing a culture that emphasizes collaboration, entrepreneurial thinking and quick decision-making. Start doing the best work of your life here.

As part of the Information Services, the Lending Technology Team drives the vision to create an industry leading, client-centric lending technology experience. The team is looking for forward thinking, action-oriented individuals to help drive the implementation and development of innovative, cutting-edge solutions to support the roadmap.

  • Identify and document bugs in usability and functionality; help engineers troubleshoot issues as they are uncovered

You could be a great fit if you have:

  • Strong technical skills, ability to quickly learn and adapt to use new technologies

  • Excellent Verbal and Written Communication skills; including meeting facilitation, experience communicating and presenting solutions for problems to stakeholders
  • Outstanding organization and prioritization skills
  • Experience with multitasking and to function efficiently in a high volume, high risk and fast paced deadline-oriented environment

Job Demands:

  • Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.

Own your work and your career - apply now

Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

 

We want hard working team players. You’ll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability—that’s the First Republic way. Come join us!

Job Description
Student Intern - Crowson Research

Remote Undergraduate Clinical Data Science Research Opportunity, Dr. Crowsonrsquo;s Lab, Mass Eye amp; Ear


Contact information:
Matthew G. Crowson MD MPA MASc FRCSC


Laboratory Website: https://projects.iq.harvard.edu/crow/people/matthew-g-crowson


Harvard Catalyst Profile: https://connects.catalyst.harvard.edu/Profiles/display/Person/193106


Project description and duties:


Dr. Crowsonrsquo;s work involves applying data science techniques (i.e. machine learning and its various forms) to clinical data. Dr. Crowson has several ongoing projects including innovative applications of:


-Computer vision for image segmentation as part of autonomous surgery,


-Natural Language Processing for clinical notes,


-Among others.


Dr. Crowson also performs lsquo;traditionalrsquo; clinical research using existing clinical data from the electronic health record. Further, Dr. Crowson also generates systematic reviews and other review-style manuscripts of interest to the machine learning and Otolaryngology fields.


Example prior projects:


Crowson MG, Dixon P, Mahmood R, Lee JW, Shipp D, Le T, Lin V, Chen J, Chan TCY. Predicting Postoperative Cochlear Implant Performance Using Supervised Machine Learning. Otol Neurotol. 2020 Sep; 41(8):e1013-e1023. PMID: 32558750.


Crowson MG, Lee JW, Hamour A, Mahmood R, Babier A, Lin V, Tucci DL, Chan TCY. AutoAudio: Deep Learning for Automatic Audiogram Interpretation. J Med Syst. 2020 Aug 07; 44(9):163. PMID: 32770269.


Crowson MG, Hamour A, Lin V, Chen JM, Chan TCY. Machine learning for pattern detection in cochlear implant FDA adverse event reports. Cochlear Implants Int. 2020 11; 21(6):313-322. PMID: 32623971.
Learning outcomes:


Goals for this research experience is to improve competency in data analysis methods, presentations, and scientific writing. Deliverables such as 1-2 peer reviewed manuscripts with student serving as first-author on the manuscript if work completed. The student may complete additional manuscripts if motivated.


Relevant texts for methods of the lab:


* Applied Predictive Modeling. by Max Kuhn and Kjell Johnson. ISBN-10: 1461468485


* R for Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, and Model Data by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. ISBN-10: 1491910399


Dr. Crowson, the principal investigator, will be the primary mentor. Research meetings will be held weekly, as well as continued daily contact using a mobile/web-based platform (e.g. Discord or Slack).


About Us:


Massachusetts Eye and Ear is an international center for treatment and home to the world#39;s largest vision and hearing research centers. Mass. Eye and Ear is a member of Mass General Brigham and a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School.

Mass. Eye and Ear clinicians are driven by a mission to find cures for blindness, deafness and diseases of the head and neck. Internationally acclaimed since its founding in 1824, Mass. Eye and Ear employs full-time, board-certified physicians who offer high quality and affordable specialty care that ranges from the routine to the very complex. Learn more about our Mission, Vision and Values and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion on our site.

Providing a safe environment for everyone is the core tenet of our Safe Care Commitment. Across Mass General Brigham, employees are doing their part to ensure that the hospitals, clinics, practices and office spaces across our system are safe and ready.



Mass. Eye and Ear physicians are located at our main campus in Boston, and at our suburban locations in the greater Boston and Providence areas, across 21 locations.



Skills required:


Some experience with statistics and computer programming languages such as Python or R strongly recommended. Students do not necessarily need to consider medicine as a possible career, as computer science and engineering students would also benefit from such an experience. Experience with machine learning techniques preferred.

Who we are:

Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold. 

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for ‘Most Innovative Use of AI’ from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards. 

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You’ll work with 600+ talented people across seven offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it!

As our Product intern, you'll have the opportunity to get hands on experience working with our product managers as they build and scale real time product features across our  Engineering and Sales teams. Alongside your team, you will help to bridge the gap between incoming feedback and product development, facilitating on-time product delivery across our various verticals of business. Your coursework and/or prior experience in software engineering or technology focused business areas will enable you to continue to develop a strong understanding of modern web technologies and product synthesis during your 10 week summer internship at Dataminr.

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG Long Island Energy Efficiency Area is seeking a Planning and Evaluation Technical intern at our Melville location. As a summer intern for Energy Efficiency, you will b uild upon experience and knowledge developed in 2019 internship in the PSEG Long Island Planning and Evaluation department, this position will offer and opportunity for the intern to expand their knowledge of overall Energy Efficiency, Electric Vehicle and Non Wire Alternative efforts. The intern will be afforded a unique opportunity to work within PSEG Long Island's new and developing Datalake environment and provide opportunities for the intern to develop and demonstrate data science and analysis in support of the aforementioned areas. Assist the Energy Efficiency and Renewable Department in the areas of Electric Vehicle Charging Data analysis, Datalake querying and analysis, Non Wire alternative Request for Proposals development, and support in the launching a Pay for Performance Pilot program. The position will also be requested to support general program planning efforts for 2021 as requested based upon work requirements during the internship period.

The job duties include, but not limited to the following:
• Working with Engineer and Business Support Analyst to develop knowledge base of datalake, LodeStar and Microstrategies structure and functionality. • Developing capability in Tableau writer software capability and functionality. • Developing understanding of Juicebox and Chargepoint portals to support retrieval of customer charging data and export into Datalake. • Interfacing with all members of Planning and Evaluation team to provide data retrieval, analysis and presentation requirements. • Participate and support Energy Efficiency Planning efforts for the 2021 plan year. • Perform cost benefit analysis as requested.
Required Education/Skills : The successful candidate (s) must have interned in the PSEG Long Island Planning and Evaluation group in prior years, be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in business, math, engineering, economics, computer science or similar discipline. Candidates must have completed sophomore level course work for consideration. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Preferred Skills :

3.0 GPA

We are targeting currently enrolled students staying in the New York metro area for the duration of the internship and able to commute to the assigned work location. Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions. position: AI Engineer Intern – IT Digital Engineering
description:
When you are part of the team of more than 75,000 extraordinary minds at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you will do work with broad societal impact: helping customers find cures for cancer, protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe, and much more. Your work will have real-world impact. Thermo Fisher is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies, or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them.

 

Our intern program will give you a chance to get real world business and IT experience and build your network before graduation. In this position, you will be expected to learn about how IT supports our business units with software and AI expertise. You will focus on developing AI solutions that will make our scientific instruments smarter and enable the next generation of scientific discovery. You can expect to gain valuable insights into your chosen career field.

 

Summary of Internship

The IT Digital Engineering AI Engineer Intern position provides an opportunity for students who are currently pursuing a data science, computer science, computer engineering, or similar degree to get hands on experience working with AI engineers and software developers in a fast-paced environment.

The position starts in May/June, paid working 40 hours per week through August. We are looking for students who are creative in tackling complicated problems and are willing to solve technical challenges.

 

 

Essential Functions

  • Develop AI solutions to help Thermo Fisher improve business and scientific workflows utilizing computer vision technologies
  • Collect and prepare images for object detection and image segmentation tasks
  • Train deep learning models to detect objects and segment images
  • Learn to deploy deep learning models on mobile and edge devices
  • Accept candid feedback and look for areas of improvements
  • Specific tasks will be tailored to the intern’s experience level and abilities
  • An intern works under the close supervision of engineers, project managers, and software engineering managers

 

Skills and Abilities

  • Good programming skills in Python
  • Familiarity with at least one deep learning framework such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, MXNet, or others
  • Familiarity with AI techniques and algorithms, such as deep learning, CNNs, RNNs, decision trees, clustering, ensembles, etc.
  • Familiarity with working in Linux and Windows environments
  • Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team
  • Demonstrate a passion for machine learning
  • Basic knowledge of statistics, linear algebra, and calculus is preferred
  • Basic knowledge in big data analysis is a plus
  • Knowledge of Amazon/Microsoft/Google cloud is a plus
  • Some exposure to web development is a plus

 

Qualifications

  • Candidates currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in data science, computer science, computer engineering, or similar field
  • Previous Internship Experience
  • To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

We know it takes a Collaborative Culture to deliver on our promise to provide the very best, innovative care and to foster new discoveries, made possible by the most groundbreaking research. Anywhere.

Ask anyone with a Nationwide Children’s badge what they do for a living. They’ll tell you it’s More Than a Job. It’s a calling. It’s a chance to use and grow your talent to make an impact that truly matters. Because here, we exist simply to help children everywhere.

  • Applies strategic, system-level thinking and operational excellence techniques for problem solving.
  • Performs some clerical office coordination and administrative tasks as needed.
  • Collaborates directly with manager and provides recommendations to improve department or business unit.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

 

Education:

  • The Intern must be currently seeking or has recently received a Degree in a field related to Computer Science, Engineering or Technology.
  • Continues to stay actively enrolled or involved in outside education advancement.
  • Intern roles are temporary in nature so it is the expectation that the individual will inquire and continue to learn about new opportunities within and outside of the hospital.
  • If a candidate has recently graduated we will consider them for an intern position not to exceed 6 months to allow them time to gain experience in their field.

Experience:

  • Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
  • Works well both independently and as part of a cross functional team.
  • Detail oriented and organized.
  • Excellent time management skills.
  • Good customer service and communication skills (oral and written).
  • Solid work ethics and willingness to put in extra time/effort.
  • Ability to multitask and at the same time provide quality deliverables.
  • Strong skills in the use of PC desktop applications such as Word, Visio, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project.
  • Excellent communication skills with all types of employees and management.

Minimum Physical Requirement:

  • Position requires ability to talk, listen and type.
  • Position requires the ability to interact effectively with customers and information services.
  • Typing on a keyboard (Constantly)
  • Talking on the phone/in person (Frequently)
  • Sitting for extended periods (Frequently)
  • Standing/walking (Occasionally)
  • Lifting 50 lbs (Occasionally)

Student Intern - Crowson Research-(3151516)
Description

Remote Undergraduate Clinical Data Science Research Opportunity, Dr. Crowson’s Lab, Mass Eye & Ear

Contact information:
Matthew G. Crowson MD MPA MASc FRCSC

Laboratory Website: https://projects.iq.harvard.edu/crow/people/matthew-g-crowson

Harvard Catalyst Profile: https://connects.catalyst.harvard.edu/Profiles/display/Person/193106

Project description and duties:

Dr. Crowson’s work involves applying data science techniques (i.e. machine learning and its various forms) to clinical data. Dr. Crowson has several ongoing projects including innovative applications of:

-Computer vision for image segmentation as part of autonomous surgery,

-Natural Language Processing for clinical notes,

-Among others.

Dr. Crowson also performs ‘traditional’ clinical research using existing clinical data from the electronic health record. Further, Dr. Crowson also generates systematic reviews and other review-style manuscripts of interest to the machine learning and Otolaryngology fields.

Example prior projects:

Crowson MG, Dixon P, Mahmood R, Lee JW, Shipp D, Le T, Lin V, Chen J, Chan TCY. Predicting Postoperative Cochlear Implant Performance Using Supervised Machine Learning. Otol Neurotol. 2020 Sep; 41(8):e1013-e1023. PMID: 32558750.

Crowson MG, Lee JW, Hamour A, Mahmood R, Babier A, Lin V, Tucci DL, Chan TCY. AutoAudio: Deep Learning for Automatic Audiogram Interpretation. J Med Syst. 2020 Aug 07; 44(9):163. PMID: 32770269.

Crowson MG, Hamour A, Lin V, Chen JM, Chan TCY. Machine learning for pattern detection in cochlear implant FDA adverse event reports. Cochlear Implants Int. 2020 11; 21(6):313-322. PMID: 32623971.
Learning outcomes:

Goals for this research experience is to improve competency in data analysis methods, presentations, and scientific writing. Deliverables such as 1-2 peer reviewed manuscripts with student serving as first-author on the manuscript if work completed. The student may complete additional manuscripts if motivated.

Relevant texts for methods of the lab:

* Applied Predictive Modeling. by Max Kuhn and Kjell Johnson. ISBN-10: 1461468485

* R for Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, and Model Data by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. ISBN-10: 1491910399

Dr. Crowson, the principal investigator, will be the primary mentor. Research meetings will be held weekly, as well as continued daily contact using a mobile/web-based platform (e.g. Discord or Slack).

About Us:

Massachusetts Eye and Ear is an international center for treatment and home to the world's largest vision and hearing research centers. Mass. Eye and Ear is a member of Mass General Brigham and a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School.

Mass. Eye and Ear clinicians are driven by a mission to find cures for blindness, deafness and diseases of the head and neck. Internationally acclaimed since its founding in 1824, Mass. Eye and Ear employs full-time, board-certified physicians who offer high quality and affordable specialty care that ranges from the routine to the very complex. Learn more about our Mission, Vision and Values and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion on our site.

Providing a safe environment for everyone is the core tenet of our Safe Care Commitment. Across Mass General Brigham, employees are doing their part to ensure that the hospitals, clinics, practices and office spaces across our system are safe and ready.


Mass. Eye and Ear physicians are located at our main campus in Boston, and at our suburban locations in the greater Boston and Providence areas, across 21 locations.

Qualifications

Skills required:

Some experience with statistics and computer programming languages such as Python or R strongly recommended. Students do not necessarily need to consider medicine as a possible career, as computer science and engineering students would also benefit from such an experience. Experience with machine learning techniques preferred.

Overview

Why Consider JAGGAER? 

 

JAGGAER is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest commercial, manufacturing and life sciences companies and government organizations in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

 

What We’re Looking For:

 

As our Business Analyst intern, you will work with a Scrum development team to learn business operations, requirements gathering, business case and user story development and quality assurance testing. You will take part in various aspects of the software development life cycle for product feature development and delivery on his/her assigned team; from need determination, to intake of customer requirements, to reviewing that development output meets requirements, to post-development documentation, and more.  

As stated by QAT Global “The business analyst works with the stakeholders to analyze and document business processes for the system to be developed, determine functional requirements and high-level features, elaborate on the details of the software project and requirements to set the direction of the project, and support its implementation.”

 

This position is part of an eight week internship program, consisting of 30 hour work weeks Monday-Friday. As a our BA ntern, here are a few exciting things you can expect during your time with JAGGAER:

  • Working with a Scrum team Product Owner (PO), you will have responsibilities in conducting business systems analysis for your Scrum team. You will learn and perform work processes from documenting requirements gathering from internal and external customers all the way through participating in some QA of the final product features. Additionally, you will work in a downstream function from the PO, to learn the career path to product owner; but also, to be eligible for an entry level Scrum team role in quality assurance, business analysis or other similar available position upon graduation.
  • Reporting to a Product Owner and or Product Development Manager this intern will learn about Agile and Scrum procedures, take part in various of its ceremonies, and learn about the life cycle development process. The intern will also receive various assignments in support of these processes, in conducting documentation and technical writing, and otherwise assisting in the conduct of the team, as assigned.

Principal Responsibilities

Awesome things you’ll do:

  • Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Document requirement gathering with business users and technical team to capture the requirements and use cases.
  • Detailed documentation preparation for requirements, use cases, functional requirements, and non- functional requirements.
  • Support in providing analysis, modeling, and other quantitative techniques as needed to answer business questions and evaluate business issues and objections.
  • May learn and apply user interface prototype development or designing UI mockups; but not a regular function
  • Process flow development and diagraming
  • Will develop basic Project Management skills and learn to provide project progress updates to project stakeholders.
  • Due to Covid-19 safety protocols, you will get to experience first-hand how teams have shifted to working remotely yet maintaining collaboration and teamwork

Position Requirements

What you’ll bring:

  • Excitement for learning something new and being an important part of a small, focused team
  • At least 2 years completed in a bachelor's degree seeking program
  • Major of study in computer science, business information systems, commercial design or computer graphics for software, project management, business administration, analytics, or other general majors where your course of study includes a focus and interest in technology
  • Or Recent graduate of a Coding Bootcamp or other computer technology program, or professional management certification such as Six Sigma or Agile certification
  • Strong analytical skills, work ethic, independence, problem solving ability, effective communication skills, and overall positive attitude
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel; in particular formula writing
  • Basic SQL ability not required, but a plus (demonstrated acumen to learn is necessary)
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
  • Interest in becoming a software QA, BA, software designer or software developer
  • Demonstration of basic knowledge of the software development life cycle
  • Knowledge of basic code writing principles
  • Willing to learn Agile Scrum development process

JAGGAER offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran or military status and other protected class characteristics.

GENERAL DUTIES:

  • The MBSE Intern position will support the development and integration of systems engineering models for our Navy customers. Specific activities will include developing information extraction and data transformation algorithms, applying Machine Learning techniques to engineering artifacts, and creating workflows for the movement of data from and to system engineering models.

MINIMUM SKILL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Entry Level
  • Degree (BS) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field from an ABET accredited program (within 6 months of hire)
  • Windows and Linux OS knowledge/experience
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Ability to Travel

DESIRED SKILLS/PREFERENCES:

  • Magic Draw, Cameo or CATiA experience
  • Knowledge and understanding of shipboard control systems
  • Navy experience a plus

One must have good written communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, analytical, mathematical, and organizational skills. Ability to follow directions is a must. Applicants must be able to work well alone and as part of a team. A Security Clearance or the ability to obtain one will be required. U.S. Citizenship required.

Description

Founded in Tokyo in 2012, SmartNews has quickly become the go-to source of news for millions of users around the world, and a leading news discovery mobile app in Japan and the US. Our mission is bigger than simply aggregating news, and we are working to break through the filter bubble and deliver the world’s quality information to the people who need it.

SmartNews is seeking strong AI/Machine Learning interns to work on US news ranking projects. The team pursues research & development in the areas of applied machine learning, with focus on deep neural networks, large-scale recommendation systems, NLP and reinforcement learning etc. As a member of the team, you will work with experienced ML engineers and AI researchers on some of the most challenging technical problems, develop new ML solutions that will impact user experience, and collaborate with the best product teams to integrate your ideas into our products.


Requirements

• In-depth expertise in deep learning and recommendation

• Excellent programming skills in Java, Python, Sql, C/C++

• Strong publication record and good communication skills

• Knowledge of common ML frameworks such as TensorFlow and/or PyTorch

• Creative, collaborative, & product-focused

• Expected to perform well in a fast-paced environment


Education & Experience

Pursuing PhD, Masters degree in AI/Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Computer Science, Data Science, or related areas.

Benefits

Due to the covid-19 situation, the intern can choose to work remotely from your own place.

position: Software Engineering Summer Intern (Cedar Rapids, IA, US)
description:
If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking.  Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect.  We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates.

Requisition ID: 64637 

Job Description

We’re seeking a talented software engineer,data scientist, or an electrical or computer engineerwith strong software background to develop advanced circuit design and verification automation tools. The position will include development in Python, MATLAB, and SKILL. A candidate with strong object-oriented programming and software design skills is desired. Experience with electrical circuit simulation, verification, design, and layout would be desirable. Experience in data science, machine learning, and Linux administration (csh), or electronic design automation (EDA) tools would also be desirable. Familiarity with Cadence Virtuoso and simulating analog and RF circuits is desirable.Responsible for developing design automation tools to assist CMOS and SOI analog and RF IC design teams. Work in a fast-past environment to help develop solutions for mobile handset applications. Capture code requirements, refine and implement ideas, implement into reusable and robust code, solicit feedback. The candidate will work within a group of analog/RF IC design engineers and be assigned to one or two summer automation projects. The candidate will interface with design management and module design teams to create the detailed specification, articulate a clear development plan, demo and share results, and implement feedback from the team.

Requirements

The ideal candidate will be familiar with Linux and Cadence. Candidate must be familiar with Python, Matlab, and other scripting language. This person must have good communication skills, be able to break down complex problems, set priorities, report progress, execute to a schedule, and have strong people skills. Must be pursuing a BS degree in engineering or computer science.

Intern – BSR Technology Risk-268043
Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas

Primary Location

 TX-Dallas

Full-time / Part-time

 Full-time

Employee Status

 Temporary

Overtime Status

 Non-exempt

Job Type

 Internship

Travel

 No

Shift

 Day Job
Work Hours M-F, 8:00am-5:00pm, with flexibility
Job Sensitivity Tier II - No Credit Check

ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are looking for a talented and highly-motivated Technology Risk Intern to join the Banking Supervision Department for the 2021 – 2022 academic year. The candidate will gain valuable experience supporting Supervisory Risk and Surveillance programs and contribute to IT assessments and examinations of financial institutions (FIs) and service providers (SPs).

ABOUT THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM:

We offer paid internships for many majors, with fulfilling work and opportunities to grow. To help launch your career, we provide dedicated staff mentors. You’ll also learn from senior leaders and industry experts. As part of the Federal Reserve System, you’ll be connected to a professional network that spans the nation. You will be based in the Dallas office and available to begin in summer 2021.

ABOUT THE TEAM:

The Technology Risk team is part of the Banking Supervision Department and conducts IT assessments and examinations of FIs and SPs under Reserve Bank supervisory authority, with the overall goal of protecting the nation’s financial system.

YOU WILL:

  • Conduct research and prepare reports on bank technology, digital payments, and cybersecurity emerging risks.
  • Assist in conducting IT, payments, and cybersecurity examinations of banks and/or service providers.
  • Review bank or service provider examination reports.
  • Participate in supervisory and risk meetings and related organizational functions.
  • Work with department management on special projects and other time-sensitive assignments.

YOU WILL BRING:

  • Strong analytical and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively work in groups
  • Good working knowledge of technology concepts and risk
  • Proficient in software for documenting, organizing information, delivering presentations and processing data
  • Exposure to audit, banking, or cybersecurity industry is preferable but not required
  • Programming skills are preferable but not required
  • Student must be pursuing a graduate degree in Finance, Information Systems, Computer Science, Cybersecurity or a related field with a GPA of 3.0 or better
  • Equivalent education and/or experience may be substituted for any of the above requirements

OUR VIRTUAL BENEFITS:

  • Flexible location and hours
  • Free LinkedIn Learning account
  • Professional development opportunities 
  • One-on-one Senior Management engagement across District
  • Broader networking opportunities across District 

WORK HOURS:
 
This is a part-time internship for the 2021—2022 academic year located in the Dallas office.  Interns will be expected to work approximately 20 hours per week with flexibility to accommodate class schedule.


NOTES:

This is a security sensitive position. By federal law, this position requires that the candidate be a U.S. citizen.
 
Employment is contingent upon the selected candidate passing a background check and drug screen. Candidates will be required to submit at least three references and submit fingerprints prior to employment.
 
If you need special accommodations during your interview process, please notify your Talent Acquisition Consultant.

Battelle delivers when others can’t. We conduct research and development, manage laboratories, design and manufacture products and deliver critical services for our clients—whether they are a multi-national corporation, a small start-up or a government agency.


We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.


We are currently seeking a Digital Marketing Intern/Co-op for Summer - Fall 2021. We are looking for a student who is either available for both Summer and Fall semester (May – December) OR just Fall semester (August – December). This position will either be located in Columbus, Ohio or remote work available.


JOB SUMMARY



In alignment with corporate and global business unit strategies, the Digital Marketing Intern/Co-op plays a crucial role in executing our company’s digital marketing strategy. The Digital Marketing Co-op/Intern will assist in developing engaging content and helping to optimize digital campaigns, across paid and organic media. He/she is a creative scientist, continually evaluating and improving digital media effectiveness, ensuring adherence to best practices, analyzing digital landscapes, and creating and implementing optimization strategies. The Digital Marketing Intern’s primary responsibility is to perform search engine optimization, but the Digital Marketing Intern will also be expected to help with other projects and marketing needs, such as reporting, content creation, social media scheduling, website development, market research and more.


The role requires strong communication skills, timeliness, attention to detail, and critical thinking to ensure accuracy and continuous improvement of digital marketing efforts.



MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES



+ Perform SEO, including tagging, meta data, link building and citations

+ Assist with content creation, including website, email and blog content

+ Evaluate large data sets to identify trends, monitor key performance indicators and recommend optimizations

+ Set-up and audit Google Analytics profile settings and tracking, including goals

+ Perform market and client research

+ Assist with media campaigns as needed, including Paid Search and Social Advertising

+ Create and/or optimize recommended searches and other website features as needed

+ Work with all members of the Battelle team to resolve problems

+ Submit, manage and troubleshoot support tickets as needed

+ Create and update best practices documentation

+ Assist with email marketing campaigns promoting Battelle’s offerings

+ Assist with social media scheduling and optimization


THE FOLLOWING IS REQUIRED



+ Currently pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree with at least a Junior standing in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, Computer Science or a closely related field of study

+ Maintaining a minimum 3.0 GPA

+ Knowledge of Google Analytics

+ Understanding of HTML and Search Engine Optimization

+ Advanced computer skills, particularly Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

+ A strong work ethic and team mentality including professional presentation, timeliness, discipline and behavior

+ Resourcefulness and ability to work independently to problem solve


THE FOLLOWING IS DESIRED



+ Applicants available to work part time during the school year following will be given preference.

+ Applicants for Previous internship or experience as a Digital Marketer

+ Applicable course work in Digital Marketing

+ Experience with tagging, link building, user experience, content management and optimization tools like MOZ

+ Strong communication and writing skills; comfortable creating original content

+ Knowledge of social media platforms and schedulers like Hootsuite and Octopost

+ Working knowledge of Google AdWords, Facebook Ads, LinkedIN Ads

  • Intermediate understanding of technology systems and infrastructure
  • Intermediate understanding of programming methodologies

Competencies

  • Ability to resolve business issues in a timely manner
  • Ability to prioritize multiple issues simultaneously
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a sense of urgency and focus
  • Problem solving and situational analysis skills
  • Strong customer support skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
