Urban Science is a company that is focused on leveraging data and logic to solve real world business problems. We use cutting edge analytics, proprietary software solutions, and years of industry experience to help our automotive clients create strategies and solutions that make their customers the focal point of their efforts. The right candidate will develop business acumen, communication and technical skills - all while gaining real world experience with analytical applications.

 

This paid internship will be remote, work from home.


Assigned to one or different projects, the intern will:

  • Actively participate in Urban Science’s intern program, attending virtual networking activities with  interns from other teams, attending learning sessions with business leaders, and other unique opportunities to learn about the broader business and useful career enhancing topics.
  • With manager guidance, plan, organize, develop and deliver client-requested reports, deliverables and projects on time, adhering to client requested specifications.
  • Work with extensive databases utilizing Urban Science proprietary software.
  • Track, process, analyze and verify data using Microsoft products, such as Excel and Access
  • Help plan, organize, develop and deliver client-requested projects and ad hoc requests within in prescribed time schedule. 
  • Focus on improving new and existing processes to effectively and efficiently communicate data from various sources such as dealership sales and financials, vehicle registrations, customer satisfaction, demographics, economics, etc.
  • Adhere to quality control standards for Urban Science and the client.
  • Other duties as assigned.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Have a fundamental understanding of database concepts in order to complete client requests 
  • Have a fundamental understanding of MS Excel for charting and graphing of data, writing formulas within cells, and/or filtering, sorting, and formatting data
  • Have fundamental computer programming knowledge and skills
  • College level math skills and solid mathematical grounding required
  • Ability to prioritize competing demands, manage multiple concurrent tasks and adapt to changing priorities
  • Ability to collaborate with other team members and have dedication to meeting and exceeding their expectations
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

  • Current enrollment in a Baccalaureate or Master’s program in a technical field (engineering, applied math, computer science, applied science, MIS, or other) at an accredited U.S. college or university, or equivalent foreign institution is required
  • Technical skills necessary to support Urban Science systems 
  • Microsoft Word, Access, Excel, and PowerPoint skills required
  • Knowledge of SQL preferred

WORK ENVIRONMENT 

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

WHO WE ARE

Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Seamless, HBO, Disney, Urban Outfitters, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale – each month, tens of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 2 billion active users through Braze.

Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Mobile Marketing Platforms in 2019 and the Forbes Cloud 100. The company has also been selected as one of Inc. Magazine’s Best Places to Work (2019 and 2020), and Crain's Best Places to Work in NYC (2019 and 2020).

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

You love everything about data.  You have no problem diving into data; cleaning it, transforming it, analyzing it, visualizing it, and using it to tell stories.  You want to develop your passion into a career at a rapidly growing company with tons of data about mobile and digital interactions.  You want to contribute to the business as well as grow the business.                                        

WHAT YOU’LL DO

As an Intern on the Analytics team, you will join a rapidly growing group of analysts and engineers whose work runs the gamut from data visualization to Big Data and forecasting. With us, you will:

  • Work with data products like Snowflake, Looker, and MongoDB
  • Pull, model, analyze billions of behavioral data points
  • Create valuable data products like reusable Python scripts, data visualizations, or data-driven thought leadership 
  • Gain exposure to and work with multiple teams across the organization

WHO YOU ARE

  • Pursuing an degree with coursework related to the data and analytics discipline (Math, Computer Science, Statistics) 
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Solid analytical and technical skills
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Self-motivating, able to assume responsibility, and work autonomously in a professional manner
  • Fast learner, self-starter, go-getter, and intellectually curious

IDEALLY, WHAT YOU'LL HAVE

  • Experience with Programming and/or Scripting Languages (Python, R, Java, C#, C++, SQL, etc.)
  • Experience with a Reporting/Statistics Tool (Tableau, Looker, SAS, Matlab, STATA)

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Competitive compensation that includes equity
  • Generous time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave
  • Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
  • Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture

If you are located in the EU or UK visit our privacy policy to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.

Position: Software Engineering Intern (Masters)

Location: Atlanta, Georgia

For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,500 companies and 100 Million threats detected a day.

We work in a fast paced, dynamic and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrive on being the first to solve problems.  We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative and humble people that want to make a difference.  

Zscaler’s Summer Internship is a great opportunity to dive deep into security, networking and cloud infrastructure. You will gain exposure to one or more of our engineering teams according to your skills and interests. Interested? Complete our universal application and tell us more about you!

Responsibilities:

  • Fundamental understanding of web services and REST
  • Implement REST API clients to interact with Cloud services using spring framework
  • Ability to work with JSON, different data structures, databases and algorithms
  • Contribute in coding components of a large-scale distributed system with a keen sense for high performance and scalability
  • Develop and maintain automated test scripts to ensure it meets requirements
  • Participate in some phases of the product development cycle, like development, test and debut

Requirements:

  • Must remain enrolled in a Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent for the duration of the internship and graduate between December 2021 - June 2022
  • Proficiency in Java, Python
  • Knowledge in Springboot, message queues like Kafka, caching technologies
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Strong software design, profiling and verification skills
  • Very good debugging and troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills
  • Self-starter takes initiative & ownership, identifies and completes tasks; goal driven
  • Ability to work with remote teams, handle multiple tasks, prioritize and meet deadlines

What You Can Expect From Us:

  • An environment where you will be working on cutting edge technologies and architectures
  • A fun, passionate and collaborative workplace
  • Competitive salary and benefits, including equity

Why Zscaler?

People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team!

Learn more at zscaler.com or follow us on Twitter @zscaler. Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ : ZS ) is available athttp://www.zscaler.com.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

description:
When you're part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you'll do important work. You'll have the opportunity to grow and learn in a culture that empowers your development. You will focus on learning how our organization runs, and can be expected to gain valuable insight that can further your interest in your chosen career field.


Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science. With revenues of $30 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our 70,000 employees the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world. The customers we serve fall within pharmaceutical and biotech companies, hospitals and clinical diagnostic labs, universities, research institutions and government agencies. Our products and services help accelerate the pace of scientific discovery, and solve challenges ranging from complex research to routine testing to field applications.


Summary of Internship

The Front End Visualization Engineering Internship position provides an opportunity for students who are currently pursuing a degree in a design, computer science, animation, UI / HCI, data science, statistics, or similar major in your degree to get hands on experience working with finance, business analysts, and data engineers in a life sciences business environment. The front end visualization intern will be a strong lead in building new front end interactive visual experiences for the internal finance organization . The position starts in June, paid working 40 hours per week through August. Opportunity exists for this position to continue through the academic year on a part-time basis to allow for class schedules.


Essential Functions


+ Prepare data for applications from visualization to statistical modeling

+ Responsible for cleaning, organizing, and analyzing financial data to provide meaningful insights and opportunities

+ Design and document workflows and data assets, their schemas and interfaces

+ Develop code for automated workflows that source, process, and convey data (Python/SQL/R)

+ Configure various platforms and vendors (AWS Redshift, Databricks,... ) to enable integrations with our data workflows

+ Build interactive visualization products (JS frameworks) to Wow our finance leaders in how great design can automate and streamline business decision-making

+ Share results and updates in written and presentation format

+ Be a visionary storyteller with a natural sensitivity for varying context

+ Specific tasks will be tailored to the interns experience level and abilities


Skills and Abilities


+ Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team

+ Willingness to learn, be mentored, and improve

+ Excellent verbal / written communication skills with attention to detail

+ Programming languages experience that may include Python, R, Matlab, HTML, JavaScript, JS Frameworks (Angular, React, Vue, D3)

+ Familiarity and interest in data science techniques (correlation, decision trees, machine learning)

+ Strong interest and knowledge in design principles

+ Portfolio to share examples of visualization tools, front end platforms, design, animation, code base


Qualifications


+ Student currently enrolled in classes leading to an accredited degree in a major -UI Design, HCI, Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, Math, Visual Design, Animation or related field to the description


At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission-enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Apply today!
Thermo Fisher Scientific is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, religion, color, national or ethnic origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, genetic information, veteran status, age or disability status.

The Institute for Genomic Medicine at Nationwide Children’s Hospital is paving the way for a future that integrates genomics into the everyday practice of pediatrics in which genetic sequencing is a standard of care. Most of healthcare today is very reactive â€“ with care being delivered when someone is already ill. We believe that healthcare should be about keeping individuals and their families well â€“ to prevent them from ever becoming sick. Building on years of published research from our founders at Stanford University, our mission is to give patients, providers, and payers the insights they need to improve patient health and prevent adverse medical events. Through machine learning and the extensive experience of our founders, team, and advisors in healthcare, we are committed to helping healthcare organizations see around the corner so that they can take a proactive approach to helping patients.

The Technology Ventures Office (TVO) promotes technology transfer into and out of MIT Lincoln Laboratory. The office serves as a central entity contributing technology transfer strategies, expanding the pool of high-quality businesses with whom we work, and expanding our Intellectual Property (IP) portfolio and licensing activities. Among these licensing activities, nearly 100 software and data sets have been made publicly available through open-source licenses. As a result, academic researchers, entrepreneurs, and the greater open-source community have been able to engage, adapt, and co-creating extensions for the benefit of national security and future economic growth. To promote even broader engagement, the TVO is developing an interactive web-frontend to improve the discoverability of our organization's open source resource.

Internship Opportunity:

  • Design a new central gateway to MIT Lincoln Laboratory's open-source projects
  • Identify the design trade space: requirements, viable design patterns, implementation constraints
  • Create wireframes, storyboards, user/process flows and site maps communicating design ideas and user interaction
  • Implement HTML prototypes to help refine features of the design
  • Draft a specification for follow on implementation of the web application design

Requirements

Student must have completed at least their junior year of college in Web Technology, Human Computer Interaction, Digital Media, Computer Science or a comparable technical field

In addition, student candidates must demonstrate

  • Digital media design experience (links to past projects or portfolio are valued)
  • Proficiency with visual design and wire-framing tools like Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or Gliffy
  • Experience prototyping applications using HTML/CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, and/or JAVA
  • Understanding of agile development methodologies
  • Familiarity with open-source hosting and package management platforms like GitHub and NPM
  • Excellent communication skills, including writing and presenting
  • Ability to work collaboratively as well as independently

Selected candidate will be subject to a pre-employment background investigation and must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret level DoD security clearance.

Requisition ID: 33142

Overview

Why Consider JAGGAER? 

 

JAGGAER is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest commercial, manufacturing and life sciences companies and government organizations in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

 

What We’re Looking For:

 

We are seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) intern to learn with our QA team and perform functional testing on our state-of-the-art procurement software service. Along with performing functional testing, you may have the opportunity to learn the basis of automation techniques and scripting, and perhaps complete discrete assignments with the automation team.

Functional testing is a type of user testing that is conducted by test feeding inputs into or performing operations of software to check for compliance with development requirements. This is non-code testing that will be performed primarily as part of an agile Scrum team.

Automation testing uses script automation to test code performance. Learning in this area may be performed as part of scrum team testing; but will be in conjunction with the QA automation team and may be done also outside of a Scrum team.

This position is part of an eight week internship program, consisting of 30 hour work weeks Monday-Friday. As a our QA intern, here are a few exciting things you can expect during your time with JAGGAER:

  • Working with staff QAs, youwill have responsibilities primarily of performing functional test of actual software on given environments, towards production, just as a regular staff QA. They will also learn and may begin over time to take on responsibilities of designing and implementing tests, and to debug and define corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance and outcome metric.
  • Reporting to a Product Owner and or Product Development Manager, you will learn about Agile and Scrum procedures, take part in various of its ceremonies and learn about the development life cycle process. The intern will also receive various assignments in support of these processes, in conducting documentation and technical writing, and otherwise assisting in the conduct of the team, as assigned.
  • Ultimately the successful candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software feature effectiveness, and that it meets requirements. Simultaneously you will learn the software development life cycle in a real development environment; while gaining experience in resolving system malfunctions to meet quality standards.

Principal Responsibilities

Awesome things you’ll do:

  • Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Learn to create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
  • Will learn the use of industry standard Agile software to identify, record, document and track bugs
  • Perform regression testing when bugs are resolved
  • Learn new testing tools and test strategies
  • May have opportunity to develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools
  • Due to Covid-19 safety protocols, you will get to experience first-hand how software teams have shifted to working remotely yet maintaining collaboration and teamwork

Position Requirements

What you’ll bring:

  • Excitement for learning something new and being an important part of a small, focused team
  • 2+ years in a Business Information Systems or Computer Science degree seeking program 
  • Interest in becoming a software QA, BA, software designer or software developer
  • Demonstration of basic knowledge of the software development life cycle
  • Knowledge of basic code writing principles
  • Basic knowledge of HTML, SQL and scripting
  • Willing to learn Agile Scrum development process and QA testing techniques

JAGGAER offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran or military status and other protected class characteristics.

position: Intern, Video Processing & Machine Vision Algorithms in Camera Applications
description:
We are currently looking for interns with solid Electrical Engineering and Computer Science backgrounds who would be interested in exploring the applications of machine learning, computational photography and optimization in developing advanced visual computing techniques for cameras.

Responsibilities and opportunities to learn:

• Explore and develop machine learning-based (e.g., DNN, GAN, and reinforcement learning) video processing and machine vision algorithms for camera applications.

• Research topic can be decided according to your experiences, interests and work period. Possible topics may include the following:

  • Dynamic range compression
  • Denoising in low-light conditions
  • Non-local convolution layer for efficient pixel processing
  • Multi-spectral fusion and deblurring
  • Depth sensing and estimation
  • Depth-aware image and video processing
  • Depth perception enhancement
  • Reflection removal and rolling shutter correction

• Collaborate with fellow camera / multimedia research engineers on a regular basis.

 

Prefer candidates with multiples of the following qualifications:

• Ability to learn new knowledge and to master new skills quickly.

• Knowledge of camera processing pipeline, optics, and image sensors.

• Knowledge of image and video processing and computation photography algorithms.

• Deep understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms, both theory and practice.

• Proficiency in Python and relevant ML packages, e.g., numpy, scipy, PyTorch, or Tensorflow.

• Experience in developing software in C, C++, Python, or Matlab preferred.

• Well organized, detail-oriented team player.

• Good verbal and written communication skills.

• Ph.D. or M.S. in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or closely related majors.

position: Information Technology Intern Fall 2021 Job (Columbus, MS, US)
description:
Company Information

PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of premium light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates and also provides customized financial services, information technology and truck parts related to its principal business.

Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services, you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started!

PACCAR ENGINE COMPANY

PACCAR Engine Company in Columbus, Mississippi produces the best-in-class, state-of-the-art MX engines that power Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR MX engines bring a new level of innovation through quality, exceptional reliability, and proven performance. In more than 50 years, PACCAR has delivered over one million engines globally, providing innovative solutions and an unwavering commitment to superior performance. Join our best-in-class team today through the following opportunity:

Requisition Summary

PACCAR Engine Company has an immediate opening for an Information Technology Intern in Columbus, MS


Job Functions / Responsibilities

This is an opportunity in a fast paced dynamic work environment that will test and develop your analytical, technical, and problem solving abilities. This position will work as part of a team to provide support to employees and assist with Windows10 application testing. Activities include but not limited to computer setup, application troubleshooting, software installation, and multimedia support. You will be exposed to a broad range of technologies that support engineering, accounting, and manufacturing functions.

This position will also include:

·         Deploying new PC’s as part of PC Refresh Program

·         Upgrading PC’s to Windows 10

·         Implement WASP IT Inventory Tracking System

·         First level Incident Report support

 ·        Support Service Requests



Qualifications & Skills

The candidate we seek will be currently enrolled in an Information Systems, Computer Science or related Program and have completed at least their Sophomore year of College.

The skills that are important to be successful in this position are as follows:

  • Competency with Windows 10 and Microsoft Office
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Resourceful self-starter with a strong sense of urgency
  • Strong professionalism and customer service skills
  • Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills

Company Summary

Join our team! As a global leader in providing title insurance, settlement services and risk solutions for real estate transactions, First American (NYSE: FAF) is an ideal place to build your career. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com

Job Summary

Undergraduate Summer Intern

Information Security – Summer 2021 Internship Program

10-12 weeks of full-time work

Paid internship with sessions starting on June 14, 2021 

Summary

First American is a premier title insurance and settlement services company with the aim of providing a premier internship experience to college students.

As a Fortune 100 Best Places to Work and a Fortune 500 company, First American understands the impact of an inclusive developmental pre-career experience on an individual’s career trajectory.

At First American, interns receive real-world work experience and development opportunities to help further their career goals.

We are seeking a rising undergraduate entering their Junior or Senior year enrolled in an accredited college with a focus in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field.

The undergraduate track is open to any student currently enrolled in a college or university program.

In addition to the day-to-day responsibilities, undergraduate interns participate in professional development opportunities, panel workshops, as well as industry and organizational overviews.

You will have the opportunity to bridge the gap between academic understanding and practical professional experience to develop skills that will help set you up for success.

Interns also engage with senior leaders and executives in collaborative discussions aimed at providing professional insight and inspiration about First American as an employer of choice.

All interns are paid a competitive rate based on their specific track and have the flexibility to work from home in the event that local offices are not open.

Position Overview

The Information SecurityVulnerability Remediation Management team is responsible for managing Vulnerability Items (VITs) across the organization.

The team is required to perform comprehensive vulnerability assessments in an effort to validate, triage, identify issues, and take action on VITs.

With collaboration from various units, the team helps to identify areas of improvement with integrations from multiple security platforms to the ServiceNow Vulnerability Remediation Module.

These tasks require the ability to learn and understand Information Security Policies and Standards.

Duties may include assisting the team with: documenting functionality, creating process flow diagrams, VIT assessment, VIT monitoring, scheduling meetings, taking meeting notes, creating or updating Knowledge Base articles, researching in vulnerability management tools, creating excel reports, analyzing issues, and testing enhancements.

This position works closely with IT groups outside of InfoSec and business units involved in VIT remediation.  

Knowledge and Skills/Technology Used

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access, Excel, Visio)

Working in a fast-paced environment where priorities can change regularly, requiring the ability to adapt and adopt quickly

Ability to self-start and be versatile in a dynamic environment

Strong problem solving skills

Listens to others and accepts input from team members

An interest and willingness to learn

Interest in and basic awareness of Information Security and Cyber security

The ability to solve problems, be detailed oriented and be conscientious about all work completed

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Basic awareness of server and operating systems

Knowledge of Agile methodology basics

Ability to work from home

First American invests in its employees’ development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO/paid sick leave and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan.

METER is seeking a part-time Software Engineering Intern to support its Food Science Division. The successful candidate will be pursuing a degree in computer science or a related field at a local university within 50 miles of Pullman, WA. The Software Engineering Intern will champion a number of small projects under the supervision of the Director of Food Science Products and a mentor who is a seasoned software engineer. The duration of the internship will be at least three months.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement systems using Python.
  • Create and maintain documentation.
  • Test systems for bugs.
  • Collaborate and communicate with coworkers in software, internal development partners, and at times external development partners regarding project progress, and issue resolution.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • At least a junior at a local university studying computer science or a similar field (candidates not located within the area won't be considered).
  • Experience with Python programming (a coding test will be required during the interview process).
  • Demonstrated problem solving ability.
  • Strong academic and/or professional references will be required.
  • Background check results satisfactory to METER.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with git version control.
  • Familiarity with scrum or agile development methodologies.

To Apply for This Position:

We ask all applicants to apply through our website at https://metergroup.applicantpro.com/jobs/. If your interests, qualifications, and experience match any of our openings please apply for that position so that you are considered immediately. You may also subscribe at our careers page so that we email you when we have openings in your area of interest.

METER is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants are considered regardless of ethnicity, nationality, gender, veteran or disability status, religion, age, sexual orientation or gender identity, or other protected status.

Data Stream Processor UI Intern

Office Location(s): (REMOTE) Bay Area - San Jose and San Francisco, CA

Team Description: 

Data Stream Processor (DSP) is Splunk’s real-time stream processing solution that collects, processes, and distributes data to Splunk and other destinations at high velocity and high volume scale, on both our Splunk Cloud and On-Premises platforms. The Data Stream Processor UI team is building a rich application that provides a graphical interface that allows users to easily author, execute, manage, and monitor their streaming pipelines. We collaborate closely with User Experience designers, product managers, backend engineers, and test engineers, to deliver a user-friendly, production-quality, end-to-end experience into real customer hands. We are a team of highly passionate and collaborative individuals who love solving problems together!

What You'll Get To Do:

  • Develop rich web application features with JavaScript, HTML, CSS
  • Work directly with User Experience Designers, Backend Engineers, Test Engineers, and Product Managers on conceiving product capabilities all the way to rolling it out in production
  • Use modern web frameworks such as React
  • Learn web application and UI best practices
  • Learn modern UI testing practices, from unit testing with Jest to browser automation
  • Work with backend REST APIs and microservices
  • Participate in design and code reviews
  • Gain experience in the software development life cycle in a CI/CD environment
  • Practice Agile development methodologies

Tech Stack: React, Jest, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Git, Gitlab, React Testing Library, Protractor, Typescript 

Education:

Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field, and a strong record of academic achievement.

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

Software Engineer Intern

 

Why YOU want this position

Since our founding as a groundbreaking provider of oil & gas data, we have evolved our solutions to cover oil & gas analytics, trading & risk, and business automationfor customers across the energy industry. Enverus represents this growth while bringing us closer together as one team. Enverus delivers business-critical insights to the global energy industry through a state-of-the-art SaaS platform built on industry-leading data and energy analytics. Our solutions deliver value across the entire energy value chain, empowering customers to be more agile, efficient, and competitive. The range of energy industry participants we serve includes exploration and production (E&P) companies and related businesses such as oilfield services, midstream, capital markets, power generators and utilities, energy traders, and downstream commercial & industrial energy consumers.

As part of the emphasis on growing our presence in the power industry, we are currently seeking a highly engaged and eager to learn Software Engineer Intern to join our Development team in Dallas, TX. This role offers the opportunity to join a rapidly growing company delivering industry-leading solutions to customers in the world’s most dynamic and fastest-growing sector. Enverus is the right company at the right time.

 

As a Software Engineer Intern, you will be responsible for assisting the development efforts on SaaS softwareand machine learning services for the Enverus PRT product suite.

The successful candidate will start in May 2021 and be required to be available for an 8 or 12 month term for 20 hours/week.


Performance Objectives

  • Proactively meet standards for information security and compliance, such as SOC2 and GDPR
  • Lead acquisition integration to define common practices and tooling. 
  • Define and measure performance objectives for engineering teams
  • Drive improvement to operational practices and procedures
  • Partner closely with counterparts across engineering and other functions to ensure the success of their products and programs


Competitive Candidate Profile

  • Computer science graduate or current computer science student
  • Enjoys an agile development environment (Scrum and/or Kanban methodology experience a plus)
  • You are a very strong communicator
  • You have a passion for the software and machine learning world
  • You are comfortable with the rapid pace of a company in growth mode and the change that occurs as the business evolves and changes
  • You are not afraid to learn from mistakes and share them with the team
  • You take full ownership of your work and take responsibility every step of the way
  • You are a self-starter, a great teammate, and a strong driver for results and continual improvement
  • You have experience with modern programming languages such as JavaScript, C#, Python.
  • You enjoy learning and can take constructive comments from others as you have opportunities to learn
  • You prefer to lead the charge, not just keep up with it
  • You like to work with cutting edge technologies

Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future


Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading STEM Organization, where our employees come first.  At ManTech International Corporation, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for skills-development and career advancement.


Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated Application Developer Intern in the Clarksburg, WV area, with strong Customer relationships. At ManTech, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.


The FSS Division provides cyber solutions to a wide range of Defense and Intelligence Community customers. This division consists of a team of technical leaders that deliver advanced technical solutions to government organizations. Our customers have high standards, are technically adept, and use our products daily to support their mission of protecting national security. Our contributions to our customers success is driving our growth.


A qualified candidate will be responsible for the following duties and responsibilities, but are not limited to:


+ Perform hands-on Java application development in a team supporting applications that we are transitioning to the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud.

+ Must have experience in Java software development plus analyzing customer needs and developing overall concept and design objectives.

+ Must have experience in debugging and correcting errors in computer programs. Knowledge of the latest application development best practices and technologies.

+ Good organizational skills Good communication skills.

+ Will work in an Agile Scrum team following Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).

+ Perform other duties as assigned.

Physical Requirement:


+ Sedentary work


Required Qualifications:


+ Bachelors degree (in Computer Science or related field) or equivalent and five to seven years related experience preferred not required.


Preferred Qualifications:


+ Spring-boot

+ CircleCI

+ NPM

+ Karma

+ Angular2 Experience


Security Clearance Requirement:


Must be a US citizen with the ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance is required.

Engineering Intern Job responsibilities will include assisting with the Engineering team in design, development, fabrication and testing of Airborne Engineering Systems, AP&T and LiDAR Drone Mapping. Essential Functions:

  • Perform general engineering support
  • Conduct requirements analyses and specifications
  • Plan and perform engineering research, design development and other assignments in conformance with design, engineering and customer specifications Review and evaluate technological developments in hardware, software, and telecommunications for applicability to current or future requirements
  • Define database requirements for information systems
  • Evaluate, design, program, test, debug, verify and validate, implement, support, and maintain and/or modify software for both new and existing infrastructure or administrative applications
  • Design and oversee development projects, software testing, and maintain computer programs using advanced software programming and/or scripting languages, techniques and standards
  • Develop prototypes, architectural models, test plans; establish test databases; and conduct alpha tests and coordinate beta tests of new or modified applications based on industry best standards and procedures for testing and review
  • Support both the evolution and continued development of existing application and the design and delivery of new application sin an agile environment
  • Analyze user requirements to derive software design and performance requirements
  • Design, develop, deploy, configure, document and debug software, while properly escalating issues to meet deadlines
  • Supply the appropriate standards, processes, procedures, and tools throughout the development lifecycle, and ensure reuse of code
  • Design and code new software or modify existing software to add new features
  • Troubleshoot and debug existing software and correct defects integrate existing software into new or modified systems or operating environments
  • Collaborate with sales, business development and program management teams to understand customer requirements, promote the sale of company products, and provide software support
  • Maintain technical understanding and familiarity with company's products and services
  • Cable building, wire stripping and crimping, soldering, installation of avionics equipment
  • Assisting with electrical wiring drawings
  • Assist fellow engineers with designing 3D models for structures and electrical enclosures for airborne applications
  • Perform other related duties as assigned

Qualifications and Education:

  • Seeking a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or applicable technical field
  • Detail oriented and capable with working in a team environment
  • Ability to work with hand tools and power tools Ability to use electronic test equipment and diagnostic tools
  • Must have experience working though the design, development, testing, release cycle and delivering software products
  • Ability to lead and collaborate in the development effort while also providing innovative and creative solutions
  • Vision for what needs to be done, without specific direction A record of successful delivery or software applications as an individual and with a team
  • Strong understanding of the software development life-cycle (SDLC)
  • Strong understanding of the agile software development methodologies and principles
  • Desire to implement continuous delivery and integration within the development life-cycle Willingness and ability to dive into technical issues within environments high command of verbal and written English and able to clearly communicate design, architecture, implementations and requirements
  • Self-motivates, self-managed
  • Team player, action and results- focused
  • Able to work under tight deadlines
  • Experience in Aerospace or defense industry is preferred

Experience in the following software tools is preferred but not all required:

  • Solidworks
  • DraftSight
  • National Instruments LabVIEW
  • Microsoft Visio

About AEVEX Aerospace

AEVEX Aerospace, headquartered in Solana Beach, California, supports the U.S. national security mission around the world by providing full-spectrum airborne intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance solutions. The company's capabilities include custom design and engineering, sensor integration and sustainment, aircraft modification and certification, mission operations services, advanced intelligence data processing, exploitation, and dissemination solutions, and tailored hardware and software mission-system tools. With over 600 professionals, AEVEX uses agile and customized approaches to rapidly define, develop and deliver specialized solutions for airborne intelligence requirements to DoD, other government agencies, and commercial businesses. AEVEX has major offices in California, Massachusetts, North Carolina, Ohio, and Virginia.

Software Engineering Intern – Full stack
Castlight Health’s Development team is seeking a summer intern based in Sunnyvale, CA. Come join us on the Castlight mission and help change healthcare for the better!

The intern will have the opportunity to write and test software in a web application framework while partnering with a group of experienced software engineers who help and challenge them as they work on projects that matter to our customers. INTERNSHIP DURATION: June - August 2021

INTERNSHIP PROGRAM EXPERIENCE: Competitive compensation, Lunch & Learns with company executives, Intern Only company sponsored events, Company-wide networking opportunities, All-company Hackathons, plus so much more! CFD Research is currently looking to fill our intern class for the Summer of 2021.  Interns in this program will support research in their area of study and/or interest ranging from CFD Simulation Development and analysis, propulsion system development & analysis, test and evaluation of propulsion systems, developing computational models of physiology and pharmacology topics, working in microbiology research lab, and more. The program runs 8-10 weeks over the summer and has flexible start and finish dates based on candidate's availability.  

Each CFD Research Internship has both a mentor and technical manager to help guide them on their research project over the summer.  In addition to challenging technical work, CFD Research's program offers professional development and social activities designed to help our interns have a great, all around summer internship experience. 

Typical Degrees hired will include:

  • Aerospace Engineering (Graduate and Undergraduate)
  • Chemical Engineering (Graduate and Undergraduate)
  • Biomedical Engineering (Graduate or Undergraduate)
  • Computer Science (Artificial Intelligence or Machine Learning as well)
  • Mechanical Engineering (Graduate or Undergraduate)

We Are Hiring



Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As one of the leading non-profit and Catholic health systems in the U.S., Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, with special attention to persons living in poverty and those most vulnerable. In FY2019, Ascension provided $2 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs.


Ascension includes more than 150,000 associates and 40,000 aligned providers. The national health system operates more than 2,600 sites of care – including 150 hospitals and more than 50 senior living facilities – in 20 states and the District of Columbia, while providing a variety of services including clinical and network services, venture capital investing, investment management, biomedical engineering, facilities management, risk management, and contracting through Ascension’s own group purchasing organization.

Description




Job Description:

At Leidos we build artificial intelligence and autonomous systems (AI/AS) that perceive, learn, decide and act on their own, for a wide variety of customers including the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) and the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL). However, the inability of these systems to explain their processes, decisions and actions to human users severely limits their effectiveness. Recently, the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) began the task of facilitating researcher and practitioner discussions on automation transparency using four principles of explainable AI: Explanation, Meaningfulness, explanation accuracy, and knowledge limits. Leidos, is interested in developing actionable strategies and tools to build transparent and explainable systems essential if users are to understand, appropriately trust, and effectively manage emerging AI/AS.




The Data Science & Engineering team at Leidos is looking for a talented individual to intern this summer in our Arlington, VA office (or virtually, depending on COVID restrictions) to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team of scientists to explore the development and incorporation of explainable AI/AS in applied domains. This is an exciting opportunity to apply your academic knowledge to real-world strategic company initiatives. The internship will offer an opportunity for the successful candidate to work with leading Leidos practitioners and team members in computer, data, and behavioral science to develop strategies that build human trust and understanding into our AI/AS and participate in other data science /developer/psychology based projects. Applicant should be available in May 2021.




Primary Responsibilities

+ Work as part of a team of Leidos computer/data/behaviors scientists to explore the development and incorporation of explainable AI/AS in applied domains.

+ Tasking by project team as needed






Basic Qualifications

+ Currently pursuing an undergraduate education in Computer Science, Data Science, Systems Engineering, Behavior Science, Ethics or related field, with at least 2+ years completed. Maintain a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA (on a 4.0 scale).

+ Ability to obtain DoD security clearance- US Citizenship required.

+ Demonstrated knowledge of basic artificial intelligence methods: neural networks, reinforcement learning, deep learning, etc. with demonstrated uses in coursework (term projects) or capstone projects.

+ Understanding of the fundamental principles of ethics and the NIST proposed principles and categories for explainable AI.

+ Must be detail-oriented, have excellent organizational skills, and the ability to work with minimal supervision

+ Must have strong written and verbal communication skills






Preferred Qualifications

+ Pursuing Graduate degree

+ Desire to continue working with Leidos on a part-time basis during the school year

Potential for Telework:No


Clearance Level Required:None


Travel:Yes, 10% of the time


Scheduled Weekly Hours:40


Shift:Day


Requisition Category:Intern


Job Family:Intern Technical

Helping keep all Splunk products secure! Splunk offers a host of products and apps - this means being involved in and staying on top of security in cutting edge tech (cloud, container technology, on-premise, etc). Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Computer Science, Information Security or a related technical major, and strong record of academic achievement.

Teradata helps businesses unlock value by turning data into their greatest asset. We’re the cloud data analytics platform company, built for a hybrid multi-cloud reality, solving the world's most complex data challenges at scale. Collectively, we endeavor to serve equal parts innovator and contributor. Because our mission isn’t just about the collection of data – it’s about revolutionizing the future of transportation to save lives, optimizing energy costs to make the planet a cleaner place, and using data to predict and identify cancer risks.


Our Company


Teradata, the world’s largest company solely focused on enterprise data warehousing and analytic solutions, provides powerful solutions for companies of all sizes. Through innovation, consulting services, technology, and industry-specific applications, our customers are outpacing their competition with enterprise agility. It's no secret our people make Teradata great. The world’s business leaders have trusted Teradata for decades as the key to their competitive edge with business intelligence. Why? Because we provide them the agility to adapt and move with confidence – just like we do. We are more than 10,000 passionate professionals in more than 42 countries and we are relentless in our pursuit of excellence.


Our Team


The Teradata Service Analytics team is dedicated to automating customer support and transforming customer support from reactive to proactive by leveraging data and analytics. Our vision is to optimize customers' Teradata solution performance and availability, through automated analytics-driven predictive/proactive issue resolution while enabling Customer self-service. Specifically, to develop an analytics software system for customer support, which will:


+ Utilize data and analytics to predict Customer operational issues

+ Proactively provide solutions to avoid impact to Customer operations

+ Enable Customers to quickly and easily resolve their own problems

+ Assist Customer Support Associates to quickly resolve customer issues


What You'll Do


You will work with data scientists on our team to develop tools to parse text data and extract information from it. The data in question may consist of computer generated logs or natural language work notes. The techniques used may include automated log parsing, natural language processing (NLP), named entity recognition, relation extraction, event extraction, part of speech tagging, sequence modeling, or text clustering. You will have some room to tailor your project to your interests, but the objective is to help automated systems understand and utilize text data, which will in turn make our customer support processes more automated and efficient. You will also collaborate with business analysts, software engineers, product owners, and support engineers to ensure your work provides concrete business value.


Your Background


+ Pursuing a bachelor's degree or higher in data science or machine learning, or in a related field (like statistics or computer science) with coursework in these areas

+ Experience (possibly from coursework) in working with large data sets, data manipulation, data cleaning, exploratory data analysis (EDA), data visualization, and data modeling

+ Experience with text data, natural language data, or natural language processing (NLP) preferred

+ Programming experience, preferably in Python and SQL

+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills

+ Ability to collaborate on an interdisciplinary team to solve problems in a fast-paced environment

+ Self-starter with a positive attitude, intellectual curiosity, and a passion for analytics and solving real world problems.


Teradata invites all identities and backgrounds in the workplace. We work with deliberation and intent to ensure we are cultivating collaboration and inclusivity across our global organization. n​nWe are proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, ancestry, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related conditions), national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, military and veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Each Teledyne Marine company is a leader in its respective field, with a shared commitment to providing premium products backed by unparalleled service and support.

If you have what it takes to help us redefine the future of mobility, we'd love to have you join us.

Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

position: Project Engineer Intern Fall 2021 Job (Columbus, MS, US)
description:
Company Information

PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of premium light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates and also provides customized financial services, information technology and truck parts related to its principal business.

Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services, you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started!

PACCAR ENGINE COMPANY

PACCAR Engine Company in Columbus, Mississippi produces the best-in-class, state-of-the-art MX engines that power Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR MX engines bring a new level of innovation through quality, exceptional reliability, and proven performance. In more than 50 years, PACCAR has delivered over one million engines globally, providing innovative solutions and an unwavering commitment to superior performance. Join our best-in-class team today through the following opportunity:

PACCAR Engine Company has an immediate opening for an Information Systems Analyst in Columbus, MS

This position will work with the on-site Product Engineering team to solve complex problems across multiple facets of the manufacturing environment.

  • Strong professionalism and communication skills

Autonomous Vehicle Intern

Job Description
Intern level position. Design and develop software and embedded hardware applications. Responsible for the application of computer science methods and techniques to store, manipulate, transform, or present information by means of computer systems. Computer science work requires in-depth knowledge of the theoretical foundations of computer science, including computer system and system software organization, the theoretical models for the representation and transformation of information structures, and knowledge of relevant mathematical and statistical sciences. At this level employee often refers problems not covered by instructions or guides to the supervisor or senior level for help or a decision.

**This job requires you to be either a US Citizen or a US Permanent Resident, due to State Department Regulations regarding ITAR related programs.

Required Skills
* Must have practical expertise with one or more of the following programming languages: C++, Java.

* Linux operation and knowledge of the software development tool chain.

*Ability to code through a variety of methods, such as subversion, make, gcc, javac, and a text editor.

 

Additional preferred skills:

*basic physics (mechanics), basic electrical circuit knowledge, familiarity with Linux/Posix system calls, WPF, mechatronics, strong science and math skills. Specifically, comfortable working with linear algebra, trigonometry and understanding of calculus concepts.

Required Experience
* High School Diploma or Equivalent

*0-2 years of experience in Software Engineering or a related technology field

 

Additional preferred experience:

* Familiarity with Linux/Posix system calls.

* Interest in machine vision.

* Experience with openCV, boost, openGL, and Swing is useful

* Comfortable with linear algebra and trigonometry.

* Knowledge about Calculus, physics (mechanics), and electrical circuit concepts are also useful

* Some knowledge of Solidworks

Job Location
Ann Arbor, United States


Position Type
Intern

Job Description:

Copart is looking for interns to work on the development of application projects for our global expansion. You will work with Program Managers, Business Analysts, and Team Leads to understand requirements, and develop and modify existing applications built on Java, using modern, cutting-edge tools like Spring Cloud, RabbitMQ, Hibernate, Solr, Kafka, Machine Learning and MySQL etc.

Candidates must be available for 40 hours a week to be considered for this role

This position will assist in duties including, but not limited to, the following:

* Assist senior engineers, and management, to achieve optimal application architecture and design, utilizing Java technologies

* Assist in the development of efficient, secure websites, peer-review code, and document solutions within an agile-blended software environment

* Communicate proactively with teammates, infrastructure, security, and quality assurance to continuously improve processes and engineering excellence.

Required Experience:

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or similar

* 1-3 years Java Experience

Preferred Experience:

* Experience with web services and SQL

* Experience with Spring+

Aeroseal is hiring immediately! Data Analyst Summer Intern needed!

Who are we? A fast-growing company with award-winning technology that has created new products that are disrupting well-established industries.
Yes, we have fun company amenities including a ping pong table, popcorn machine and company happy hours. Our team members play as hard as they work. But it takes more than amenities to be a great place to work.

How is Aeroseal different?

We are:
  • Restless with curiosity and always asking if there's a better way
  • Passionate about turning our customers' problems into opportunities to grow their business
  • Constantly learning, because we understand we must try new approaches to get new outcomes.
There is more to our culture of innovation. But we also have a sense of urgency, so we won't list them all here.

What's the rush? Well, our company has an ambitious mission.

Aeroseal wants to make a lasting impact on people and the world around us, improving their lives and making the world a better place in which to live.

And we need your help to make it happen.

Overview

The Data Analyst Intern would be responsible for building out our prospect database to accommodate new initiatives and achieved desired company goals. This individual would utilize multiple sales and marketing tools, including Salesforce and Sales Navigator, to both prospect and capture within our CRM. There is a strong component of creativity, resourcefulness, and ingenuity to appropriately locate and determine appropriate prospects for entry. Additionally, this intern will gain a great deal of exposure to CRM software, namely Salesforce, having shared responsibility for pulling lead reports generated from events and correctly labelling each for accurate entry to Salesforce. This role will also be tasked with updating current data within Salesforce to remedy inaccurate collection over time (especially where automated methods are not feasible or available), properly organizing accounts by hierarchy, general lead conversion, and CRM maintenance support. Working closely with the Marketing team and Sales leaders, this intern will have full support and walk away with a greater understanding of Salesforce, Sales Navigator, prospecting methods, business strategy, and more.


Responsibilities include:

  • Lead/ Account Prospecting using tools such as Sales Navigator to find contacts and accounts needed to support current and future business initiatives.
  • Export, Review, Update and Import lead lists to Salesforce, from various events (webinars, tradeshows, association events, member lists, etc.)
  • Update current data within Salesforce to accommodate data validity efforts.
    • An example might include reviewing current accounts and assigning proper hierarchy to those that have a Headquarters location along with branch offices, or accounts requiring secondary industries.
  • General lead conversion to support both Salesforce maintenance and the Sales Teams.

Skills and Requirements:

  • Pursuing a Bachelors Degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Computer Sciences or Sales or other related areas with applicable skill sets
  • Junior or Senior with 3.0 GPA or higher
  • Passionate about Marketing and Sales
  • Working knowledge of software applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) and familiarity with the Windows operating system.
  • Desire and aptitude to learn new software's
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and remote
  • Local to the Dayton area, or within reasonable commuting distance

Check out this video and find out why our team loves to work here!

Perform support and project responsibilities on both the Technical Support and Infrastructure Services teams in the Information Systems (IS) Department.







Essential Functions:



End User Support



• Respond to requests for assistance in person or via remote support tools. Document and escalate problems and requests as appropriate.



• Diagnose hardware problems. Perform and/or coordinate the repair of hardware.



• Install new laptops, desktops, printers, personal device assistants and other peripherals. Maintain and enforce hardware policies and standards.

• Validate and update the configuration of computers, copiers, printers and phones

• Conduct research on new technologies and products.

Requirements and Qualifications:

• Possess a service orientation and attitude in working with others.



• Be detail-oriented and methodical in solving problems and managing multiple projects.



• Possess an aptitude toward learning technical concepts. Be results-oriented and a quick learner in supporting new products and technologies.



• Strong knowledge of relational databases and accounting practices.



• Possess a working knowledge of Windows 7 and Office 2010 and at least one software package in each of the following categories: word processor and spreadsheet.



Physical Requirements:

• Involves work of a general office nature usually performed standing such as operation of a fax and printer.



• Involves movement between departments to facilitate work.

This position regularly interacts in both verbal and written form with employees.

Reports to the Manager, IT Services

Cintas is currently looking for an Intern for the Information Technology department.  The Intern will be responsible for assisting partners with current projects, gaining knowledge and skills within their discipline, sharing recent developments in the field, and actively seeking educational opportunities.

Required

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree and enrolled in college; Sophomore or Junior standing
  • Ability to work 40 hours per week (Monday-Friday) during the scheduled period
  • Familiar with computer operating systems

Headquartered in Cincinnati, Cintas is a publicly held company traded over the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol CTAS and is a component of both the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index and Nasdaq-100 Index.
Cintas Corporation helps more than 900,000 businesses of all types and sizes get READY™ to open their doors with confidence every day by providing a wide range of products and services that enhance our customers’ image and help keep their facilities and employees clean, safe and looking their best. With products and services including uniforms, mats, mops, restroom supplies, first aid and safety products, fire extinguishers and testing, and safety and compliance training, Cintas helps customers get Ready for the Workday®.

Shift: 1st Shift

Explore an exciting opportunity to work with a global 3D visionary leader!

Our FARO University Internship Program is designed to equip students with the tools needed to succeed in the 3D world. You will be part of a cohort of students and work on meaningful projects that will add to your professional portfolio and skills. Internships can often lead to professional roles after graduation.

Our interns use their education and newly gained skills on real projects and are embedded in our teams, working side by side with FARO professionals. 

As Data Analyst Intern, you will be designing, developing, and maintaining the data analysis infrastructure for the FARO laser projector. You will work with a multi-disciplinary team and provide critical contributions to research and development to expand product capabilities. You will assess technology feasibility and reliability data and make recommendations based on data analysis.

In this internship, you will GAIN KNOWLEDGE – Become familiar with core processes and develop working knowledge of industry terminology. You will BUILD RELATIONSHIPS – Experience the business rhythm of the organization through participation in department meetings and observation of team role models. You will PRODUCE RESULTS – Complete projects and assignments as given. This is a part time position and there will be some on-site work in our facility in Exton, PA.

Hiring Preferences:

  • Junior / Senior or Pursing a master’s degree in data analytics, statistics, computer science or related degree
  • GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite
  • JMP (SAS), mini-tab or other statistics base software and/or data manipulation/analysis
  • Research skills
  • Proficiency in development of tools to automate analysis of large data sets using languages such as Python, SQL.
  • Proficiency in manipulating and analyzing large, complex, multi-dimensional data sets
  • Naturally inquisitive and skilled in exploratory data analysis, formulating and testing hypotheses
  • Strong verbal and quantitative skills
  • Ability to work on-site in our facility in Exton, PA
  • Ability to start work within 2 weeks of application (Spring Semester)

Key Behaviors:

  • Applicants need to work well with numbers, data, and units of measure.
  • Organization skills, attention to detail, effective communication skills (written and oral), and ability to multitask in a dynamic environment are a must.

The FARO internship program should be open-minded and curious about the world, seeking a potential career opportunity at a global company, and anxious to contribute to a challenging and diverse environment.  

Inclusive

At FARO, we are committed to encouraging different perspectives and ideas that foster innovation.  We believe that we are strongest with a diverse team of employees.  Our locations are free to respond to local needs to create a culturally sensitive workplace for everyone. In doing so, we want every FARO employee to feel our commitment to showing respect for all and encouraging open collaboration and communication.

FARO is an equal opportunity employer and provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. FARO is a government contractor and will take affirmative action as called for by applicable laws and Executive Orders.

We are a Drug Free Workplace with Pre-Employment Drug Screening

At Woodard & Curran, there’s nothing we love more than a tough engineering challenge. We handle a wide range of water and environmental issues—solving complex problems with creativity and tenacity. That’s how we make a difference to our clients, people, and planet. Our company was founded on a simple concept: provide a safe and enjoyable place to work with opportunity, integrity, and commitment, and we will attract talented people. Those people are at the heart of our firm, solving some of the most pressing water and environmental challenges for our clients.

Responsibilities:

We are looking for a motivated Software Engineering Intern to join our company. If you want to jumpstart your career and expand your skills while working alongside talented experts, then this is the opportunity for you! You will be involved with project work from your first day, working side-by-side with experienced engineers, planners, and scientists to help clients address their water and environmental challenges. Exercise your creativity and problem solving skills in a supportive environment where every perspective is valued. We are a mission-driven organization that puts our people first, with a culture that focuses on providing meaningful work, engaging challenges, recognition, and reward.

Duties and responsibilities vary based on level of experience and project expectations. An intern will generally shadow experienced professionals and participate as a member of a team by contributing to actual projects. Interns are able to apply what they have learned “from the classroom” via experience based-learning.

This Internship Position will be based in our Sacramento, CA Office.

Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will be a second or third year Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar with interest in environmental, sustainability, or water resources data management t.

You will need to attach a professional cover letter, as well as your resume. Your resume should include your GPA as well as a sample of courses that you’ve taken at college.
 

Woodard & Curran is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.

Woodard & Curran is a Drug Free Work Place.

Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Program Overview:


Fiserv’s Summer Internship Program offers talented college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain meaningful hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, team projects, and other networking opportunities. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.


  


Job Description


Fiserv Summer Interns will perform duties such as gathering and organizing data to provide information for departmental projects or reports; offering innovative suggestions; accompany professional level employees on assignments; request or give information and other related duties as assigned. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment. 


Qualifications:


+ Actively pursuing a bachelor’s degree and will graduate between December 2021 and June 2023.  

+ 3.0+ GPA preferred

+ Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge and technical aptitude to learn new applications quickly


+ Able to handle multiple assignments simultaneously and effectively meet deadlines

+ Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and verbal communications skills

+ Strong initiative; a self-starter with analytical skills, attention to detail, problem-solving and decision-making abilities

+ Experience working in a fast-paced environment and flexible to changing priorities

+ Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)


+ Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship


 


Majors:


A wide range of bachelor’s degree programs considered, based upon specific department needs, such as: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration, Mathematics, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Purchasing, Sales and Communications


 


_Please Note_ :  _Where we encourage you to apply now, our 2021 summer internship interview process begins in December and will continue through March.  You can expect to hear from one of our recruiters if your qualifications_


_align._


Learn more about Fiserv:


To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.


We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.


Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.


We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.


We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.


Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.


We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Are you a current student looking to experience building new software/hardware products? At Republic Wireless, we are continuously exploring challenging problems and solving them with innovative whole product approaches. We are currently seeking a part-time remote intern for Spring 2021 (with the possibility to extend into the summer for 40 hours per week) to join our Relay API Platform product team (Relay is a separate business unit within Republic Wireless). We are interested in students who have at least completed their sophomore year of college within computer science, computer engineering, or a related discipline with professional/intern experience. Knowledge of various programming and database/network technologies, with some business experience preferred. This paid internship will start at a minimum of 15 hours per week with room to grow into a full time role during extended breaks or after graduation.

As an intern with Republic Wireless, you will have the opportunity to work with top engineers in the industry on cutting edge technologies including Python, REST APIs, networking, telecommunication, and cloud services. This is a small team with a large variety of responsibilities, so you may engage in a large breadth of topics. Take a look at our products at https://relaygo.com/ and https://relaypro.com/api

Republic Wireless is reinventing the telecom industry, and you have the opportunity to learn and grow with us.


How You Contribute to Our Vision
