About the job

Software Engineers at Bear Robotics are researchers and developers who builds robot-as-a-service to revolutionize restaurant industry. Our engineers develop full-stack software from embedded firmware all the way to cloud services -- this requires adept research skills and awareness, the soft skills to effectively interact and ask questions, as well as the ability to quickly turning ideas into product. You'll develop competencies with data structures and algorithms, along with a technical fascination for how robot-as-a-service works. We focus on being a collaborative and open organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skills and a keen eye for quality.

About Us:

  • Our company was founded in 2017. Bear has developed a self-driving robot that shuttles food from a kitchen in a restaurant/dining hall out to customer tables, and then brings dishes back for cleaning.
  • A start-up gives you the chance for personal development and building expertise in your field, while providing opportunities for cross-functional growth. We’re not a big tech company yet, but we’re striving every day to be THE global player when it comes to robotics and AI in the hospitality sector. We have deployed robots with several global enterprise customers, and are on the cusp of mass manufacturing our robots for the world to use.
  • We are ~70 motivated people who work hard to make our robots a reality. This means occasional extra hours and last-minute improvements. We will challenge you to walk the extra mile, pick your brain until it smokes and make you think outside of the box. But, we would also like to hang out with you, have an after-work drink together and celebrate our collective success.
  • We provide excellent benefits, including comprehensive health coverage, lunch every day, remote work flexibility, internet and phone reimbursement, and employee bonus programs.

If you feel you’re ready for a professional adventure in robotics and artificial intelligence, we would love to hear from you. Please send us your resume with a short overview of yourself, salary expectations, and why this role is perfect for you.

About TI

As a global semiconductor company operating in 35 countries, Texas Instruments (TI) is first and foremost a reflection of its people. From the TIer who unveiled the first working integrated circuit in 1958 to the more than 30,000 TIers around the world today who design, manufacture and sell analog and embedded processing chips, we are problem-solvers collaborating to change the world through technology. Put your talent to work with us – change the world, love your job!

About the role

TI Kilby Labs is seeking highly qualified applicants for the position of a Vision Analytics Intern for developing Image Analytics and control flow optimization solution for optimizing manufacturing assembly and test processes. Our team pursues research and development in the areas of smart sensing with particular focus on ML enabled signal analysis and optimization targeting various IoT applications including factory automation, smart building etc.

As a member of the team, you will have the following opportunities to:

+ Work on some of the most challenging technical problems and develop solutions that leverage image signal processing and machine learning based algorithms targeting factory process optimization.

+ Research and develop innovative algorithms/solutions that will address challenging problems to shape the future of smart factory solutions.

+ Collaborate with broader teams across R&D as well as product businesses to combine AI/ML solutions into smart analog sensing signal processing flow.

+ Engage with technologists in the lab and across multiple disciplines (design, systems, applications, manufacturing, etc.) to discuss and develop your ideas and solutions as well as one-on-one mentoring from senior technologists in the company.

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements

+ Currently pursuing a PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science Engineering (Machine Learning, Image/Digital Signal Processing, Embedded Systems) or related field

+ Minimum cumulative 3.0/4.0 GPA

Key Qualifications

+ Expertise in image signal processing and DNN based image analytics algorithms

+ Familiarity with commercial or open source image process and ML SW tools and packages

+ Project level experience in image analysis/statistical signal processing/DNN algorithms using ML frameworks – starting from data collection, ML algorithm definition, NN training and deployment.

+ Excellent programming skills in Python, C/C , Matlab

+ Project level experience in Embedded Systems Programming for performance/memory optimal implementation of signal processing algorithms

+ Be able to deliver end results with highest standards of quality, scientific rigor and innovation while working in a virtual team setting

Preferred Qualifications

+ Self-motivated

+ Excellent problem solver, and a fast learner.

+ Ability to quickly forge relationships

+ Comfortable with change and ambiguity

If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition.

Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to protected characteristics, including race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or age.

Join us in making roads safer by making drivers better!

As a CMT Intern, you will work closely with members of our Claims group who will provide mentorship and guidance. You will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment, while contributing to product development and helping to make roads safer! Career opportunities at CMT include, but not limited to the following:

  • Work with Product Managers to help invent, shape, and launch new features and products for CMT.
  • Collaborate closely with our engineering team regarding the feature specifications and their development, testing, and release.
  • Write detailed requirements for features based on well-defined use cases and in some cases, create initial wireframes to illustrate them.







Requirements

  • Enrolled in an academic program as a sophomore, junior or senior working towards Bachelors of Science, Computer Science, Engineering or similar quantitative field
  • Strong communication skills
  • Attention to detail and well organized
  • Ability to work independently



Benefits

Cambridge Mobile Telematics' (CMT) mission is to make the world’s roads and drivers safer. Since its first product launch in 2012 that pioneered mobile usage-based insurance, CMT has become the world’s leading telematics and analytics provider for insurers, rideshares, and fleets. CMT’s DriveWell platform uses mobile sensing and behavioral science to measure driving risk and incentivize safer driving, while its Claims Studio reduces the claims cycle time with real-time crash detection, crash reconstruction, and damage assessment using telematics and artificial intelligence. CMT has over 50 active programs with insurers and other partners, improving safety for millions of drivers every day around the world. Started based on research at MIT and backed by the SoftBank Vision Fund to fuel its rapid growth, CMT is headquartered in Cambridge MA. To learn more, visit www.cmtelematics.com and follow CMT on Twitter @cmtelematics.

Summer 2021 Applications Engineering Intern
2100909

Description

 

Here at ON Semiconductor we take great pride in our internship program and the efforts we take to provide students with hands-on industry experience. We provide competitive pay, medical benefits, various networking event opportunities, and flexible hours based on school schedule. 

ON Semiconductor is seeking a self-driven and motivated student to join their Embedded Solutions Team, located in Pocatello, Idaho or Lindon, Utah. As an Applications Engineer Intern, you will have the opportunity to assist in developing and supporting embedded systems (HW and FW) using our internally developed embedded microcontrollers, Evaluation Board (EVB) and Software Development Kit (SDK). This is a hands on position, working under the supervision of the Applications Lead, to assist in the development and support of examples, demos, and prototype systems to highlight the feature set of the embedded solutions. 

This opportunity will ask a student to have the following performance objectives:

  • Develop and demo example application code for various microcontroller features
  • Create a prototype application system that will highlight multiple capabilities of the micro in a real world system
  • Create apps notes and other training documentation
  • Develop higher level APIs in embedded C to make the embedded system easier to use
 

Qualifications

 

In order to be considered for an internship, you must be a student currently enrolled in school pursuing an accredited degree program. This position is specifically looking for a Bachelors, Master, or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science (with an emphasis in embedded SW).

  • Experience with embedded programming in C
  • Experience with IDE, compilers, linker, etc.
  • Experience with using embedded microcontrollers system (RTOS experience is a plus)
  • Knowledge of standard communication interfaces such as SPI, I2C, UART, etc.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Familiar with lab equipment (scope, supplies, meters, etc.)

ON Semiconductor (Nasdaq: ON) is driving energy efficient innovations, empowering customers to reduce global energy use. The company is a leading supplier of semiconductor-based solutions, offering a comprehensive portfolio of energy efficient power and signal management, logic, standard and custom devices. The company’s products help engineers solve their unique design challenges in automotive, communications, computing, consumer, industrial, medical and military/aerospace applications. ON Semiconductor operates a responsive, reliable, world-class supply chain and quality program, and a network of manufacturing facilities, sales offices and design centers in key markets throughout North America, Europe and the Asia Pacific regions.

position: Web Content Strategist and Developer Intern
description:
BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.

Since our founding in 2009, Pure Storage has empowered innovators to build a better world with data. In less than eight years, Pure reached $1B in sales, faster than nearly every enterprise company in history, and our incredible growth continues to outpace the competition.

Our mission? Deliver a simple, evergreen data platform that enables everyone to turn data into intelligence and advantage. The secret sauce? More than 3,000 team members (and growing!) around the world who join forces to invent the next big thing. And then the next one. 

The world is experiencing a revolution driven by next-generation technology like AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing, and self-driving cars—all of which require unprecedented amounts of data. This sets the stage for Pure’s technology to grow exponentially in the coming years. 

If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.

SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE…

  • Develop professional-grade department websites that can be accessed by corporate customers, suppliers, and internal users.
  • Responsible for planning, developing, and managing information placed on the websites.
  • Create easily usable features to find information the users need to make decisions quickly and efficiently.
  • Determine effective data transfer methods with data source owners.
  • Set Up different security levels based on user privilege level.
  • Visualizing the data to allow end-users, including the senior management team, to review and understand trends, outliers, and patterns in data.
  • Set up weekly tasks, milestones, deliverables, and timelines for each assigned project.
  • Report challenges along with alternative solutions to minimize impact to the overall schedule.

WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BRING TO THIS ROLE...

  • Experienced in programming languages such as JAVA, React, Angular, C, C++, and Python.
  • Knowledge of data gathering, cleaning, and transforming using MySQL and PostgreSQL.
  • Reporting and data visualization skills using software like Tableau and Google Data Studio.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Great writing skills in the English language.
  • Good communication and presentation skills.
  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters program in Computer Science or related fields with an expected graduation date in or after December 2021.
  • Able to work full-time for 12 weeks during Summer 2021.

BE YOU—CORPORATE CLONES NEED NOT APPLY.

Pure is where you ask big questions, think differently, and make an impact. This is not just a job, but a place where you have a voice and can accelerate your career. We value unique thoughts and celebrate individuality, and with ample opportunity to learn, develop yourself, and expand into different roles, joining Pure is an investment in your career journey.

Through our Pure Equality program, which supports a flourishing field of employee resource groups, we nourish the personal and professional lives of our team members. And our Pure Good Foundation gives back to local and global communities through volunteering and grants.

And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events.

PURE IS COMMITTED TO EQUALITY.

Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire. TA-Ops@purestorage.com

Data Science Internship: (12-16 Weeks)

Alignment Healthcare is a data and technology driven healthcare company focused partnering with health systems, health plans and provider groups to provide care delivery that is preventive, convenient, coordinated, and that results in improved clinical outcomes for seniors.

We are experiencing rapid growth (backed by top private equity firms), our Data Science team is looking for the best and brightest data scientists. Data drives the way we make decisions. We love our customers and understanding them better makes it possible to provide the best clinical outcome and care experience.

This position will play a key role in uncovering deep insights from data using advanced machine learning technologies and advanced statistical analysis, processing very large data sets using cloud-based data pipelines, variety of analytic tools, visualizations and delivering actionable healthcare insights & solutions.

Problems you will work on every day will include:

  • Collaborate with key business leaders to understand their business problems and come up with analytical solutions.
  • Understanding the concepts and building algorithms in the healthcare domains
  • Working with large data sets and designing analytical approaches
  • Applying coding skills and knowledge data structures to develop projects in partnership with other scientists and engineers in the team
  • Build end-to-end data science solutions which will improve healthcare outcomes and reduce the cost for our members.
  • Develop scalable and efficient machine learning and deep learning algorithms that can work in production systems.
  • Collaborate with the engineering team to build end-to-end cloud based machine learning production pipelines.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Current PhD Student in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field with a focus on Machine Learning and Deep Learning.
  • Excellent communication, analytical and collaborative problem-solving skills
  • Experience in applying machine learning methods to real world problems with measurable outcomes.
  • Depth and breadth in state-of-the-art machine learning and deep learning technologies
  • Solid data structures & algorithms background.
  • Strong programming skills in Python or similar scripting language
  • Proficiency in open-source deep-learning and machine learning libraries & toolkits
  • Demonstrated proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
  • Experience with data visualization and presentation, turning complex analysis into insight.
  • Experience in setting experimental analytics frameworks or strategies for complex scenarios.
  • Understanding of relevant statistical measures such as confidence intervals, significance of error measurements, development and evaluation data sets, etc.
  • Experience with manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality and unstructured data from varying sources
  • Demonstrable track record dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in an agile, dynamic startup environment
  • Familiarity with code repositories, such as Github

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Healthcare experience
  • Published work in academic conferences or industry circles.
  • Desire to work at a fast-paced work environment

Responsibilities

STRATTEC Security Corporation is one of the world's largest suppliers providing access and security systems to the automotive market. This drives us to be an innovative company with the latest technology. STRATTEC creates exciting opportunities to people who like to work in an environment that challenges them to be creative, deal with multiple customers and projects, and research the latest technology. You will help STRATTEC to be a pioneer by working closely with the largest automotive customers in the world along with the largest electronic partners.

 

Let us know who you are! We want to know what motivates you and why you are the ideal candidate for our growing team. The ideal candidate will possess a team oriented attitude; have a multidiscipline background, and a passion for innovation. We are looking for leadership skills to develop a new group internally.

 

If you are one who like to build a team, has strong skillsets and likes to see your own ideas come to life, apply quickly!

 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES .

  • Learn on the job experience on the various computer applications used, their capabilities and their use, through the means of self-paced tutorials and every day real world experiences.
  • First level general Helpdesk support for End-Users focusing on proper operation of computer hardware and applications; Microsoft Office, Adobe Acrobat, Groupwise email, Internet browsers and others.
  • Provide user hardware support for workstation, printer, and plotter issues.
  • Assist with computer system imaging using standardized desktop management tools.
  • Assist with backup and archive operations.
  • Continued development into a strong and effective team player while working with a geographically distributed support team.
  • Ensure documentation standards are created and adhered to.
  • Participate in projects and testing as required.
  • Research, troubleshoot, and resolve issues reported via Helpdesk.
  • Ability to track and close tickets in the Helpdesk queue.
  • Other duties may be assigned

Qualifications

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

-At minimum, a High School diploma and in the process of obtaining either a four year bachelor’s degree, Sophomore standing. an Associate's degree (A. A.) or equivalent from a two-year College or technical school in Engineering, Information Technology or Computer Science.

-This is a year round internship and the right candidate must be available to work during the school year and during the summer break.

                                                                               

 

DESIRED COMPUTER SKILLS          

  • Novice computer skills with a minimum of “basic-to-moderate” skills in the operation of computer hardware and software; including but not limited to MS-Office, Internet Explorer/Chrome/FireFox, e-mail, and more.
  • Primary operating system knowledge of Windows is required. Additionally, basic knowledge/skills with UNIX/Linux operating systems is a plus.
  • Conceptual understanding of basic networking and network protocols such as TCP/IP, RDP, TELNET, FTP.
  • Conceptual understanding of basic wired and wireless networking.
  • Aptitude for learning quickly and a strong desire to become a computer support expert.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills a must.
  • General computer experience at home supporting friends and family a plus.

2021 Orrstown Bank Summer Internships

Multiple internships are available for the Summer of 2021 beginning in June in the Harrisburg and Shippensburg Areas.  Interns will shadow and assist with a variety of departmental initiatives, special projects and responsibilities in one of the following departments:  Credit, Information Technology, Wealth Management.  

Our paid Internship Program offers a 10-12-week immersion into a career in Banking starting in June through August. Interns will be provided meaningful projects, collaborate with and be mentored by experienced Banking professionals, and could earn college credit while building a professional resume. 

Candidates must possess excellent analytical skills; high level of attention to detail; strong interpersonal relations and communication skills; applied experience in leading and preparing presentations; above average computer skills to include applicable working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite.  

Interns should possess the following:

•    Undergraduate or graduate student in related field

•    Have an interest in banking/ finance and/or a concentrated study in one of the sponsoring departments.

•    Availability to work full-time hours (40 hours per week) during the internship program.  

Credit Internship

•    Assist loan officers in connection with financial analyses of all types of credit information; 

•    Develop and analyze all types of credit information pertaining to commercial loans, prepare credit reports, furnish information relative to credit inquiries

•    Make recommendations to appropriate personnel on the granting or denying of loans; prepare sufficient information to document recommendations

•    Provide thorough documentation of financial analysis work, including ratios and other related information; ensure credit analysis activities are conducted in accordance with prescribed lending policy.

•    1 year of related coursework preferred of experience 

•    Proficient reading, verbal and written communication, mathematical, computer, and interpersonal relations skills; good working knowledge of spreadsheets and database software.


Information Technology Internship

The main focus of the intern position will be building out the CMDB data.  The following is a list additional duties:

•    Assist in hardware and software inventory management (CMDB) envisioned by Orrstown IT Staff

•    Assist in the SharePoint cleanup and archive of old data

•    Assist in the cleanup, reorganization, and documentation of IT application software repository    

•    Support the IT team in maintaining hardware, software, and other systems

•    Assist with troubleshooting issues

•    Organize and maintain IT assets

•    Handle infrastructure administration activities such as server and storage capacity reporting

•    The Intern will also be included in building out the new infrastructure; they will gain knowledge of each of the infrastructure pieces.

The skills required for this position:

•    Computer Science, Information Technology, or Management Information Systems major

•    Basic infrastructure background

•    Skills utilizing SharePoint

•    Basic understanding of Virtualization

•    Familiarity with the Microsoft Office Suite

•    Strong verbal and written communication

•    Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

•    Ability to work well in teams

•    Strong work ethic and attention to detail


Wealth Management Internship

•    Assist in the day-to-day management of client portfolios and the investment management process under the guidance and direction of the Investment Team, an overview of wealth management and the roles within, and an overall education about the depth and breadth of Bank’s platform and capabilities.

•    Pursuing a degree in a related field preferred, with interest in the investment field. 

•    Excellent mathematical and analytical skills. 

•    A high level of attention to detail. 

•    Strong interpersonal relations and communication skills. 

•    Experience in leading and preparing presentations. Proficient reading, writing, and grammar skills. Ability to work with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, the internet, and trust accounting software programs; A minimum of two (2) years related coursework preferred

Role: Embedded Engineer Intern

Location: Redwood City, CA or Dallas, TX (Remote work available for COVID-19)

Type: Internship

Reports To: Chief Technology Officer

Job Overview: We are looking for a professional Embedded Engineer Intern to work on embedded software development lifecycle. The goal is to create scalable and optimized robotics software systems.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Design and implement software of embedded devices and systems from requirements to production and commercial deployment.
  • Debug and troubleshoot issues in complex systems.
  • Own and carry a design task from concept to implementation.
  • Document engineering requirements, document solutions, and test new firmware designs.
  • Work with cross functional teams to test and troubleshoot issues.
  • Support software QA and optimize I/O performance.
  • Provide post production support


Qualifications:

  • Pursuing BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
  • Experience in hands-on development and troubleshooting on embedded targets.
  • Solid programming experience in C or C++.
  • Solid CS fundamentals with a strong understanding of data structures and algorithms.
  • Understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle including Agile methodology.
  • Adequate knowledge of reading schematics and data sheets for components.
  • Strong documentation and writing skills.
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently.


Must have experience in:

  • Scripting languages like Python, Ruby, Lua, etc.
  • Git, Jira, Confluence
  • Hands-on design, development, and debugging


Nice to have experience in:

  • Microcontrollers, ARM processors, SoC
  • Embedded software development systems with Linux, RTOS, or bare-metal
  • Peripherals including UART/RS-485, SPI, I2C, CAN, BLE, USB, PWM, ADC
  • BLDC motor control
  • STM32 MCU (Cortex-M0, Cortex-M4, Cortex-M7)
  • TI C2000 MCU & MotorWare


About Us:

  • Our company was founded in 2017 and has developed a robot that autonomously shuttles food from the kitchen out to customer tables and then brings dishes back for cleaning.
  • A start-up gives you the chance for personal development and building up expertise in your field, while providing opportunities for cross-functional growth. We’re not a big tech company yet, but we’re striving every day to be THE global player when it comes to hospitality robotics. We have deployed to several enterprise customers and are on the cusp of mass manufacturing our robots for the world to use.
  • We are ~50 motivated people who work hard to make our robots a reality, which can mean occasional extra hours and last-minute improvements. We will challenge you to walk the extra mile, pick your brain until it smokes and make you think outside of the box, but we would also like to hang out with you, have an after-work drink together and celebrate your successes.
  • We provide excellent benefits, including comprehensive health coverage, lunch every day, remote work flexibility, internet and phone reimbursement, and employee bonus programs.

If you feel you’re ready for a professional adventure in robotics, we would love to hear from you. Please send us your resume with a short overview of yourself with salary expectations and why this role is perfect for you.

FleishmanHillard believes a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities. 

 

Deadlines for Summer submissions: March 1

The internship is a paid, full-time position requiring a commitment of at least three months (May 26 – September 2, 2021)

 

Interested candidates must attach the following items to their online application upon submission: 

  • Cover letter expressing interest in the internship program
  • Resume
  • Portfolio
  • Letter of recommendation from a former teacher, employer, supervisor, or personal reference (teacher or employer are preferred)

ART DIRECTORS / DESIGNERS

Our Art Direction/Design Interns work under the guidance of creative directors with their artistic prowess to fulfil the design needs of clients. Having an eye for aesthetic is vital for success on assigned projects. They show us how they create something from nothing, how they visually bring an idea to life, how their process unfolds, and the results.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:

•         Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year graphic design or advertising degree or related program. 

•         A portfolio demonstrating a strong sense of design and typography. 

•         A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

COPYWRITERS

•         Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year advertising degree or related program.

•         A portfolio filled with conceptual ideas and smart copy. 

•         Proficient in Microsoft Office. 

•         A willingness to learn and work within a team environment. 

 

VIDEO EDITORS 

Video Editor Interns work with directors and producers, being the tool that winds the story together, demonstrating the ability to jump from project to project, to find the shot that captures the moment, and to separate compelling content from filler.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:

•         Completed final year of a 4-year film, video production, broadcast journalism or related degree program. 

•         A reel and/or work samples demonstrating strong technical proficiency as well as creative and storytelling ability. 

•         A willingness to learn and work within a team environment. 

•         Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro and related programs.

•         Proficiency with videography and photography also a plus.

 

DIGITAL DEVELOPERS

Digital Development Interns get immersed into all aspects of development. They will see projects from front-end to back-end, the creation phase to the testing phase. They find what will work for a program and all its quirks. They are a problem-solver who loves finding that missing piece of the puzzle. The quicker, the better.  

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:

Completed a 4-year computer science or engineering degree 

•         Ability to work in a fast-paced, demand driven environment. 

•         Basic experience with HTML5, XML, Ajax, jQuery and JavaScript.

•         Strong communication skills, including proficiency in developing technical documentation 

•         A willingness to learn and work within a team environment. 

 

 

PROJECT MANAGERS

Project Management Interns work directly with creative directors, account teams, and clients to see campaigns develop from start to finish. They demonstrate leadership qualities but operate best working with others. This position teaches the intern how to manage several tasks at once, oversee projects, and value the importance of being a collaborative leader. 

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:

•         Completed a 4-year business, marketing, or related degree program.

•         Ability to work under aggressive deadlines.

•         Strong leadership, management, communication and analytical skills. 

•         A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

•         Proficient in Microsoft Office.


This full-time paid summer internship is 40 hours per week that runs from May 26 – September 2, 2021 with the opportunity for extension. 

  • Ideal candidates will have graduated and completed college coursework in journalism, public relations, communications or related fields.  
  • Fundamental writing, research, communications, and critical-thinking skills 
  • Ability to work easily in both large team environments and independently.  
  • Prior internship experience at a public relations firm or corporate communications department; Prior internship experience where the role involved writing, content creation, social media, etc. 
  • Demonstrate the ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced environment. 
  • A positive attitude and willingness to learn from our industry-leading team of counselors. 

 

About FleishmanHillard 

FleishmanHillard is part of the Omnicom Public Relations Group, a division of Omnicom Group Inc., and has more than 85 offices in 30 countries, plus affiliates in 43 countries. Our award-winning agency specializes in public relations, reputation management, public affairs, research and analytics, brand marketing, digital strategy, social engagement and content strategy. We’ve been named PRWeek’s Global Agency of the Year and Best Places to Work; a “Standout Agency” on Advertising Age’s A-List; the Human Rights Campaign’s “ Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality”; and NAFE’s “Top 50 Companies for Executive Women” for a decade. We’re also more motivated by what we can give than what we receive, with a longstanding worldwide service commitment to support social inclusion in the communities in which we work and live. position: SAP Intern -Personalization and Dynamic Digital Marketing
description:
Requisition ID: 283773

Work Area: Marketing

Expected Travel: 0 - 10%

Career Status: Student

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. Thats why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.


SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because its the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve peoples lives.


SAP Internship Experience Program


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP


1. Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.


2. Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.


3. Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team


The intern for the SAP Digital Platforms Personalization & Dynamic Digital Marketing team will support SAP’s digital mandate to make it easy to do business with SAP online by providing a relevant and engaging digital experience. The position will support the personalization program with analysis and reporting, project management, quality assurance, and communication. This role will work with many teams across the organization to assist in the global and regional execution and day-to-day operations to ensure the program’s success.


Personalization & Dynamic Digital Marketing is on the cutting edge of B2B marketing and digital approaches to the customer journey. If you like forging new paths and have an entrepreneurial mindset, this internship will be a great opportunity.


Position title: SAP Intern –Personalization and Dynamic Digital Marketing


Location: Newtown Square, PA – please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings


Expected start date to end date: May 31, 2021 - November 26, 2021


In this role, you’ll:


+ Provide insightful web analytics to help better gauge the success of our programs, including pulling data, building new reports and dashboards, analyzing results and segment construction.

+ Assist with project managing the personalization programs, including but not limited to tracking tasks, liaising with stakeholders, following up on deliverables, and ensuring deadlines are met.

+ Support the creation of new rule-based and machine learning personalization programs by participating in discussions, performing initial research and planning process steps.

+ Manage and run the account listening program for global sales and marketing, monitoring activities for groups of accounts on SAP.com digital properties.

+ Responsible for testing and monitoring the personalization programs on the SAP web properties by applying quality-assurance methods.

+ Maintaining the Personalization and Dynamic Digital Marketing team’s content to drive awareness and transparency of the team’s programs and offerings. Update the content on the site, write blog posts, monitor user-generated content, and suggest ways to make the site more of an effective tool in communicating the mission of the team.

+ Build thorough and well-designed PowerPoint presentations to educate audiences on upcoming or past personalization programs.

+ Other special projects and tasks as assigned


Who you are:


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


Skills / Competencies .


Web Analytics and Tech Competencies:


+ Experience with and interest in web reporting and analytics

+ Ability to articulate data stories to business audiences

+ Advanced level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint

+ Experience with Adobe Analytics preferred


Quality Assurance:


+ Detail-oriented

+ Commitment to accuracy


Communication and presentation skills:


+ Effective communication skills, both oral and written


Project Management:


+ Ability to work in a high-paced, dynamic environment, juggling multiple projects simultaneously

+ Experience with preparing meeting materials, taking comprehensive notes, and managing notifications/correspondence


General


+ Passion for technologyand a service-oriented mindset will be a major advantage in this role


Educational Requirements (degrees, class completion, etc.)


This position requires candidates to currently be enrolled in an undergraduate or Master’s program which is applicable to the position. Seeking degrees in Information Management, Computer Science, Marketing, or General Business. Commensurate experience in digital marketing positions a plus.


Qualifications:


+ Requires candidates to currently be enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s program which is applicable to the position

+ Experience with Adobe Analytics is a plus

position: Intern, Digital Quality and Data Integrity (DQDI)
description:
Intern, Digital Quality and Data Integrity (DQDI), QA

Agios (agios.com) is a biopharmaceutical company focused on providing medicines for some of the world’s most challenging diseases. We’re committed to applying our scientific leadership in cellular metabolism to transform the lives of patients with genetically defined diseases (GDD), encompassing both rare and more common diseases, and mining the extensive potential in the PK platform. We are leading the way in advancing PKR activation for hemolytic anemias, including pyruvate kinase (PK) deficiency, thalassemia and sickle cell disease, and have demonstrated a strong commitment to these patient communities. We continue to foster a productive research engine that yields new insights and potential therapeutic approaches. We’re a company that cares about our work, each other, and the people who are counting on us the most. We’re inspired to think big and welcome the different perspectives and backgrounds needed to deliver extraordinary results. We’re driven to be our best selves, together, so we can reach for the Other Side of Possible.

Agios Pharmaceuticals is searching for a dynamic DQDI Intern to join our growing QA team. The DQDI, QA Intern will confidently manage and maintain an inspection ready GxP Computerized System Validation archive; ensuring all GxP Computerized System Validations (CSV) and supporting Standard Operating Procedures at Agios are collected and archived in a manner the maintains its data integrity throughout the systems’ life cycles. The intern will maintain the inventory of all CSV documentation, follow the ‘True Copy’ verification process moving documentation from paper to digital Veeva platform, create appropriate metadata and ensure complete collection of all records for inspection readiness.

The intern will be expected to partner with Agios Business owners, IT and QA to perform this role.

Responsibilities (including, but are not limited to)

• High attention to detail, excellent technical writing experience.

• Creates, maintains, reviews and revises procedures that ensure GxP computer systems are maintained in a validated state and in a continual state of inspection readiness with regards to cGxP.

• Collects and tracks validation deliverables and packages for GxP computer systems to ensure accessiblity throughout document life-cycle.

• Maintains archive for compliance with company policies, procedures and government guidelines, directives and regulations.

• Provides training on document management related topics.

• Supports regulatory and internal audit inspections.

• Creates and reviews routine metrics and facilitates development of appropriate action plans as well as communication with key stakeholders.

• Perform other duties as required.

Skills and Qualifications

• Knowledge of technical writing principles and quality systems.

• Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Visio, Power Point and other applications.

• Knowledge of Veeva products desired.

• Strong written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to communicate and work independently with scientific/technical personnel.

Requirements

• Current undergraduate student majoring in IT, computer science, engineering, library science or related field

• 2+ years of MS Visio and PowerPoint

• 3+ years of MS Word and Excel

• Experience in the pharmaceutical industry

• Knowledge of Good Documentation Best Practices

Competencies

• Analytical thought leader with strong ability to analyze systems, data, and reports to identify creative solutions

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

• Skilled presenter with ability to command the attention of an audience at all levels throughout an organization

· Collaborative yet decisive leader with track record for creating agile solutions

Intern-Electrical Engineering


Location WA, Lynnwood


Department Engineering


Employment Type Temporary Full Time - Employee


Crane Aerospace & Electronics is seeking an Intern - Electrical Engineering in our Sensor Technology Group.


Crane Aerospace & Electronics internship programs give you the chance to work on a variety of critical business assignments, test your skills, use your academic knowledge and match your interests to a real job.


As an intern at Crane Aerospace & Electronics, you will develop knowledge about the business through exposure to a functional area (such as manufacturing, engineering, and lean principles). You will focus on developing the skills necessary for success by assisting employees with day-to-day job assignments. You may be assigned to additional training or project work. The Company's internship program is intended to provide students from diverse backgrounds with the opportunity to practice business skills learned in school while gaining work experience.


Essential Job Functions:


+ Handle projects or some of the work normally performed by an entry-level, professional employee

+ Provide support for assigned department

+ Work with other members of the department to learn how the department functions within the company

+ Work with other employees in different departments to learn how other departments operate within the company

+ Attend seminars and meetings as assigned.


_In addition, for Electrical Engineering:_


+ Assist other engineers in performing laboratory tests, including data collection using test equipment, and analysis and documentation of test results in EMC, thermal, and ambient environments

+ Writing test procedures to verify design requirements

+ Performing schematic capture using EDA tools

+ Performing analysis of component data sheets

+ Assisting electronics technicians troubleshoot test failures


Minimum Qualifications:


+ Must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university in engineering.

+ Education: 2+ years toward BS in Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science (or equivalent).

+ Must provide GPA, minimum accepted 3.1 on a 4.0 scale

+ Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills

+ Possess effective interpersonal skills in a team environment

+ Must be project-oriented and be able to multi-task

+ Ability to fulfill a one quarter or semester internship commitment, 40 hours per week

+ Available to work full-time during summer months

+ Skills: Proficiency with Microsoft Office products, and familiarity with mathematical modeling tools or requirements management is an advantage. Should be self-directed/motivated, and work and communicate well within a team that consists of several engineering, manufacturing, and other disciplines. Use effective English communication in presentations, analyses, and reports.


Eligibility Requirement:


+ Thisposition requires access to controlled data or information and therefore only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor, we are bound by _International Traffic in Arms Regulations_ (ITAR).


Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You’ll find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS).


Crane Aerospace offers a full line of products for sensing bothand pressure of mechanical, flight control and air data systems. All incorporate flight proven, highly reliable technology and are in use on many commercial and military aircraft.


We are committed to operational excellence and world class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value.


Crane Aerospace & Electronics offers competitive salaries and outstanding opportunities for career growth and development.


_In our efforts to maintain a safe and drug-free workplace, Crane Aerospace & Electronics requires that candidates complete a satisfactory background check prior to employment._

position: R&D Engineer Intern (Santa Rosa, CA, US)
description:
Job Description

Keysight is the world's leading electronic measurement company, helping scientists and engineers address their toughest technical challenges.  Our employees leverage their insight, passion and creations to deliver measurement solutions in wireless communications, aerospace and defense, automotive, energy, and semiconductor markets with world-class platforms, software and measurement science.  The company’s over 12,000 employees serve customers in more than 100 countries.

As market leaders, we are at the heart of the technology revolution. We help our customers accelerate their innovations to connect and secure the world anywhere, anytime with any information – voice, data, video, and whatever they can imagine next.

 

Job Description:


As a R&D software engineering intern at Keysight, you will join a high-performance R&D team located primarily in Santa Rosa, CA.  Our team is part of Keysight’s central research and development organization, Keysight Laboratories.  We help to create, validate, and implement next generation technology that differentiates Keysight products from the competition. 

Job Qualifications


Required Skills
•    Working towards a BS or MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
•    Experience in programming using C/C#/C++
•    Basic understanding of software development practices and software architecture
•    Self-motivated, quick-learner and excellent analytical skills
•    Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills
•    Must be flexible, adaptable and eager to push technical boundaries
•    Excellent written and verbal communications skills

Desired Skills
•    Interest in electronic test and measurement equipment and software
•    Interest in Digital Signal Processing (DSP)

Job Function

*Internships

Job ID : 40214

Applied Systems, Inc., a worldwide leader in insurance technology, is currently searching for a Mobile Development Intern to join us for the summer. You will join the team and be involved with a improve efficiency for the entire Applied Mobile and Applied Mobile Insured product development. You will be undertaking a development project, working with a team, to help migrate and upgrade new mobile technology and features. Your ability to develop these innovative mobile solutions will be key in delivering on our commitments to our customers and our industry.  

 

Applied’s internships are full-time, Monday through Friday positions, that run from May to August. Start dates and end dates are determined by both the department and the intern's availability. These internships will be 100% remote and interested applicants must reside in the United States or Canada. Equipment is provided for the internship program.. 
 

RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Development and testing of product features in for Applied mobile applications 
  • Assist with deployment for both Apple/Google mobile apps 
  • Develop advanced coding techniques that improve the quality of software written 
  • Collaborate with team members to self-manage business value-based solutions 
  • Undertaking a development project as we transition technology within product 
  • Work within an Agile Scrum team to deliver high technical solutions that provide business value 

 

QUALIFICATIONS FOR THIS JOB 

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, CIS, or equivalent 
  • Must be enrolled full-time at the college/university level for the Fall 2021 semester 
  • Basic understanding of any OOP languages (C#, Java, C++, Python, etc.) 
  • Interest in mobile development and testing 
  • Professional work experience OR strong academic experience (i.e., projects, internships) using C# experience with Xamarin, Android, or iOS development a plus 
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail 
  • Ability to work with others in a team-oriented environment 
  • Detail-oriented; self-motivated, able to work independently 
  • Must be able to work full-time (40 hours per week), Monday through Friday 
    • Internships run from May to August 
    • Ability to work 100% remotely 
  • Must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship / eligible to remain and work in Canada for any employer

 

WHO WE ARE 

  • LEADING GLOBAL PROVIDER OF CLOUD-BASED INSURANCE SOFTWARE- Applied Systems develops the top two Insurance Agency/Broker Management software products in the world. In addition, we also provide innovative mobile apps, Data Analytics, Customer Self-Service, Insurer Connectivity & Rating, eServicing, Benefits Design, and CRM software products. By automating the insurance lifecycle, Applied’s people and products enable millions of people around the world to safeguard and protect what matters most.  
  • CLOUD SOLUTIONS & PROFESSIONAL SERVICES- We offer cloud solutions, 24x7 technical support, consulting, implementation, and education services. 
  • AWARD WINNING TECHNOLOGY- We have been voted  
    • 2020 Company of the Year (Stevie Award) 
    • 2020 New Product or Service of the Year- 2 awards (Stevie Award) 
    • 2019 Best Cloud-Based Software Solutions Provider in the insurance industry (2019 Corporate Excellence Awards) 
    • 2019 Digital Service Provider of the Year (Business Excellence Awards) 
    • 2019 Best Broker Software Management House (Insurance Times) 
  • GOOGLE’S INVESTMENT IN APPLIED- Google/CapitalG made a minority investment in Applied that will spur AI, machine learning, and digital marketing innovation in the global insurance industry. 
  • CLIENTS- We provide technology to over 160k users within insurance agencies, brokerages, and carriers throughout the US, Canada, the UK, and Ireland.  
  • EMPLOYEES- Applied currently has 1,800+ employees across the US, Canada, the UK, and Ireland. 

 

COMPANY CULTURE & PERKS 

  • JOIN A GREAT TEAM- We believe that success comes from a dynamic working environment that offers professionals an opportunity to grow and succeed alongside extraordinary people. We encourage idea sharing, problem solving, and teamwork in our environment. 
  • DIVERSITY MATTERS- We strive to create a positive workplace culture for those of different thinking, backgrounds, experiences, expertise, and individual qualities across our organization. We want the best and the brightest to be a part of a growing culture that embraces a sense of belonging. 
  • RELAXED DRESS CODE- Applied allows for a relaxed dress code where jeans are permitted; we call this “Dress for your Day”. 
  • FUN PARTIES & PERKS- Fun perks are a staple at Applied, including holiday parties with games and contests, summer celebrations employee appreciation events, art contests, employee discount programs, and more! 
  • OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADVANCEMENT- We are a growing company that offers career opportunities, and not just “another job”. Applied believes in growing our employees and promoting from within, offering many opportunities for professional advancement along the way! 
  • CAREER STABILITY & LONGEVITY- Our average employee tenure is 9 years. 
  • CULTURE OF RECOGNITION- Applied provides a culture of employee recognition with our Circle of Excellence program, and our internal social network recognition program. 
  • APPLIED CARES- We have a culture that embraces and promotes volunteerism. Applied encourages our employees to help local charities and communities through the ‘Applied Cares’ program 

 

BENEFITS & REWARDS 

  • BENEFITS FROM DAY ONE- Applied offers Medical, Rx, Dental, Vision, Virtual Doctors’ Appointments, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Accounts, Critical Illness, Group Accident, and Wellness Incentives to ensure employees are covered from day one. 
  • FINANCIAL PEACE OF MIND- In addition to wellness benefits, Applied offers traditional and Roth 401k options, with employer match. Accidental Death & Dismemberment, Short and Long Term Disability, and Business Travel Accident insurance are also offered. 
  • WORKLIFE BALANCE- There is more to life than work: that is why Applied offers benefits to help balance your work and home life. We offer competitive paid vacation time, personal/sick time, paid holidays, summer hours, paid parental leave, volunteer time off, and a free day off for your birthday! 

 

TO LEARN MORE 

  • Please visit www.AppliedSystems.com

    Applied Systems is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Diversity and Inclusion is a business imperative and is a part of building our brand and reputation. At Applied, we are committed to recruit, develop, retain, and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. 

 

 #LI-Remote

COMPENSATION

  • Unpaid
  • College Credit


Essential Functions

  • Performs market analysis on top competitors marketing strategies (including but not limited to social media, event activations, web, etc.) as a part of a competitor research project.
  • Assists with all social media accounts.
  • Assists with database and all Client Relationship Management (CRM) accounts.
  • Assists with preparing printing and promotional items.
  • Assists with Coordinating set up of networking events and all other company events.
  • Assists with website design and maintenance.
  • Assists with web leads – tracking and coordinating response to and assignment of leads to loan terms.  
  • Develop emails, landing pages, forms, lead scoring, segmentation, and nurture flows to support the marketing team.
  • Organizes and assists with maintaining all marketing material.
  • Helps seek out prospective clients through making phone calls and utilizing the Internet and social media.
  • Researches and learns all new emerging technologies and trends.
  • May perform other duties as assigned.
  • Must have strong organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and projects.
  • Analyze marketing initiatives and provide feedback on next steps.
  • Contribute to overall marketing team responsibilities.

Organization: 

The Bail Project is a national nonprofit designed to combat mass incarceration by disrupting the money bail system one person at a time. The Bail Project’s National Revolving Bail Fund provides free bail assistance to low-income individuals who are legally presumed innocent, and whom a judge has deemed eligible for release before trial contingent on paying bail. We enable our clients to return home to their families and communities while awaiting their court dates, connect them with community organizations that can assist them in accessing resources, and provide reminders and assistance to ensure that clients return to court for their court dates. 

The Program:

The Intern and Volunteer Program invites members of the community, 18 or older, to intern with The Bail Project. All individuals who intern with TBP will be members of a cohort and that cohort will work with TBP for 2 months. All interns will be expected to participate in educational opportunities, community-building events, and other cohort activities. Interns will be expected to work 10-15 hours a week based on their availability. All interns will begin work on June 1, 2021. This is a hard start date and we encourage all candidates to consider this requirement carefully.

Position Summary:

TBP is seeking an individual with an interest in criminal legal system reform and improving outcomes for incarcerated and returning community members to assist with several data and research projects to improve TBP’s knowledge of system operations and community resources. This individual will also provide data input support by utilizing Salesforce.

Hours: 10-15 hours per week, flexible schedule

Term: June - July 2021

Start Date: 6/1/21

End Date: 7/30/21

Reports to: Volunteer and Intern Coordinator

Compensation: $15 an hour.

Responsibilities:

  • Document team referrals to social service providers on Salesforce.

  • Document client experiences with social service providers on Salesforce.

  • Use case lookup system to vet potential clients and provide recommendations to Bail Disruptors

  • Use court records and client records to improve TBP understanding of which clients retained private attorneys rather than public defenders and the impact that had on their cases.

  • Use court records and client records to determine which judges set bail for TBP clients.

  • Analyze and present preliminary findings on the degree to which judicial discretion plays a role in determining initial bail affordability and subsequent bail forfeitures for TBP clients.

  • Research client criminal backgrounds to understand past charges in relation to current charges.

  • Develop a list of community institutions and direct service agencies throughout TBP’s service area that may be willing to partner with TBP in providing support for TBP clients, advocate for the use of said institutions and agencies to the team, and add to the database within Salesforce.

  • Research and connect with activist organizations working on criminal justice reform that clients may be interested in joining and advocate for the value in promoting said organizations.

  • Participate in cohort events geared towards education around social justice, policy, nonprofit management, connection, and professional development.

  • Engage in weekly or bi-weekly check-ins with supervisor to evaluate progress, identify next steps, etc.

  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

You are driven, highly organized, and have a deep commitment to The Bail Project’s mission to eliminate race- and wealth-based disparities in our criminal justice system. We’re looking for someone who is comfortable working independently or in a team-based setting, and with a strong commitment to our clients. 

To excel in this role, you likely bring the following:

  • Passion for understanding and changing the system of mass incarceration and criminal justice

  • Familiarity or personal experience with the local criminal justice system a plus

  • Interest in data or computer science

  • Basic computer skills and familiarity with spreadsheet software (Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel preferred)

  • Some experience with quantitative research 

  • Must be well-organized and professional

  • Familiarity with Salesforce a plus

How to Apply: 

Interested applicants should submit a resume and cover letter. In the cover letter, please address the following:

  • Why do you want to intern with The Bail Project?

  • Please share 1-2 experiences that highlight why you would be a strong candidate for this internship and how you meet the qualifications for the position.

No emails, faxes, or phone calls, please. Applicants will be notified regarding whether or not they have been selected for an interview. Applications without cover letters will not be processed.

The Bail Project is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and actively seeks the candidacy of people of color, women, LGBTQIA people, and formerly incarcerated individuals. We are committed to inclusive hiring and dedicated to diversity in our work and staff.

Note: This position should ideally be filled by an undergraduate or graduate student, someone directly or indirectly impacted by the bail system, or an individual coming from an internship-providing institution. Only candidates who live within the state in question will be considered for this role. For example, if the internship you are applying for is based out of Missouri, you must already live within Missouri.

One of St. Louis’s top web and marketing companies is looking for Web Development Interns to support our production team. Want in?

We’re bringing on a few people to help out with exciting web development projects including websites, applications, ecommerce, databases, and marketing technologies. This is an in-person gig. Our office is located in downtown St. Louis at 1901 Locust Street.

Only unpaid positions are available at this time.

 

What We’re Looking For

Ideal candidates for this internship will be passionate about the web and tuned in to today’s latest tools and tactics. Computer Science or MIS/CMIS students, especially juniors and seniors, will gain a competitive edge over their peers with hands-on training and real-world web agency experience.

Requirements

  • Able to multitask and complete projects on time within reasonable deadlines
  • Basic HTML/CSS, PHP & database development skills

Responsibilities

  • Development Projects
  • Customer Support
  • Problem Solving
  • Research
  • Beta Testing & Quality Assurance

 

What You Get

Blayzer’s Web Development Internship is a 12-week program designed to provide participants with real-world web development agency experience. The program is divided into two phases. Phase I will focus on exploring the fundamentals of modern web development. Phase II will cover the application of acquired knowledge and skills on real, paid projects.

Phase I 6 Weeks

Phase I is a 6-week entrance program designed to familiarize participants with a broad range of tools, tactics, and practices one will encounter in the development field (see below). Interns will work hands-on with Blayzer developers and project managers to learn the ropes and then transition to independent projects and tasks that reinforce the curriculum.

Phase II 6 Weeks

At the end of Phase I, interns who meet expectations will proceed with hands-on, independent development project work. Projects will include a mix of paid and unpaid opportunities.

phase III Long Term

The ultimate goal of our Web Development Internship program is to help prepare the next generation of computer science and MIS/CMIS professionals for work in an agency environment. We hope to see one or more of our interns become long term members of our development team.

Quadratic provides advanced analytics, digital platform enablement, architected data solutions, and end-to-end relationship marketing services to more than 100 class-leading clients across a wide range of verticals.


Our rapidly growing digital analytics team is looking for a Summer intern who is ready to jump start a career in analytics. This is an awesome opportunity to learn the ins-and-outs of technical implementations, while honing your problem-solving and analytical skills. You will have the opportunity to gain exposure to a number of marketing analytics tools, like Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager, Adobe Analytics, and Tealium, receiving mentorship and training along the way.


But this won’t just be about learning, you will also be in a position to make an immediate and direct impact on our clients’ work––placing tags, validating data, running analyses, building and presenting reports, supporting website test development, and consulting clients on their marketing technology investments. 


Since our digital analytics team sits at the forefront of an ever-evolving digital landscape, we gravitate toward candidates who are equal parts left-brained and right-brained. If you’re ready to jump into one of the fastest growing career fields and excited to join a team of tireless learners within a growing company, you belong with us!


What you’ll do

  • Learn the foundations of digital analytics, starting with tag creation, tag implementation, and ongoing tag maintenance
  • Support the digital analytics team while gaining valuable skills for a long-term career in digital analytics
  • Maintain and optimize analytic platform integrations
  • Ensure integrity and reliability of data through ongoing quality control and data monitoring using various methods and tools
  • Extract and analyze data from Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, and other marketing analytics platforms for use in reports
  • Deliver impactful analyses to internal teams and key business owners, turning data into actionable recommendations

  • Gather business requirements and help other members of the digital analytics team translate those into technical specifications and solutions
  • Support digital analytics team members in development of website tests and personalized digital experiences through creation and maintenance of test roadmaps, plans, and results decks
  • Integrate with internal teams and external stakeholders to drive cross-team collaboration


What you bring

  • A bachelor’s degree with a focus in a quantitative field (e.g., mathematics, statistics, arts and sciences, or business administration), marketing field, or computer science field – or equivalent years of work experience
  • Strong communication skills comfort communicating with clients to help bridge the gap between technology and business stakeholders
  • Genuine curiosity of the evolving digital landscape and the role of analytics in improving digital experience
  • An eagerness to learn and humility to ask for help when you don’t have the answer
  • A desire to be a self-starter, balanced with a desire to be a team player
  • Experience developing and presenting reports or data visualizations (Tableau, Google Data Studio, etc.) with an emphasis on telling a cohesive and compelling story
  • Agency, analytics, media, or advertising experience a plus (this could be a career change for someone in web development or a business analyst role)
  • Experience in one or more tag management systems, such as Adobe Launch/DTM, Google Tag Manager, or Tealium, a plus

Knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS a plus

Explore an exciting opportunity to work with a global 3D visionary leader!

Our FARO University Internship Program is designed to equip students with the tools needed to succeed in the 3D world. You will be part of a cohort of students and work on meaningful projects that will add to your professional portfolio and skills. Internships can often lead to professional roles after graduation.

Our interns use their education and newly gained skills on real projects and are embedded in our teams, working side by side with FARO professionals. 

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will be developing the next generation of software that powers the FARO laser tracker.  You will work in a multi-disciplinary team developing efficient and innovative algorithms in the fields of 3-dimensional metrology and geometric processing.  You will perform research and development of new functions in software workflows, APIs and user-interface to provide increased data quality and create a human-centered product for our users.

In this internship, you will GAIN KNOWLEDGE – Become familiar with core processes and develop working knowledge of industry terminology. You will BUILD RELATIONSHIPS – Experience the business rhythm of the organization through participation in department meetings and observation of team role models. You will PRODUCE RESULTS – Complete projects and assignments as given. This is a part time position.

We have: 

  • Leading edge technology
  • Open and innovative team culture
  • Expert networks to drive the technology of tomorrow

You have:

  • Junior / Senior or Pursing a master’s degree in Computer Science, or related engineering or math degree
  • Availability for part time internship between January 2021 - May 2021
  • Ability to work some of the time in our facility in Lake Mary (this is not a remote position)
  • GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • Have a good grasp of Object-Oriented Programming
  • C# and .NET Framework / Core at least 3 years
  • Web API development on ASP .NET Core 2 or up (we are using version 3.1) and deployed at least one API to production
  • Experience using SQL to communicate with the database
  • Windows Desktop development, preferable WPF but WinForms should be good too
  • Database development with relational databases preferable Microsoft SQL Server

Desired Skills:

  • gRPC preferable on .NET platform
  • Unit test, Integration testing on the .NET platform
  • Docker
  • ASW Services (VPC, Route 53, S3, CloudFront, ECS, ECR, RDS, EC2, Cognito)
  • CI/CD

Key Behaviors:

  • Applicants need to work well with numbers, data, and units of measure.
  • Organization skills, attention to detail, effective communication skills (written and oral), and ability to multitask in a dynamic environment are a must.

The FARO internship program should be open-minded and curious about the world, seeking a potential career opportunity at a global company, and anxious to contribute to a challenging and diverse environment.

BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.

Since our founding in 2009, Pure Storage has empowered innovators to build a better world with data. In less than eight years, Pure reached $1B in sales, faster than nearly every enterprise company in history, and our incredible growth continues to outpace the competition.

Our mission? Deliver a simple, evergreen data platform that enables everyone to turn data into intelligence and advantage. The secret sauce? More than 3,000 team members (and growing!) around the world who join forces to invent the next big thing. And then the next one. 

The world is experiencing a revolution driven by next-generation technology like AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing, and self-driving cars—all of which require unprecedented amounts of data. This sets the stage for Pure’s technology to grow exponentially in the coming years. 

If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.

SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...

  • 1. Understand the current processes, ownerships, and data sources among cross-functional departments related to the assigned projects. 2. Identify sources of all product critical identifiers in the entire product life cycle spectrum. 3. Perform gap analysis using relevant data retrieved from all appliable sources. 4. Provide recommendations to connect the dots among all identified gaps. 5. Determine proper ownerships and define control mechanisms throughout the related processes. 6. Recommend database structures based on the data storage and retrieval needs. 7. Develop a comprehensive process to actively monitor and alert engineering on duplicated or abnormal records. 8. Provide recommendations to cross-functional teams to prevent record duplication and abnormality. 9. Setup weekly tasks, milestones, deliverables, and timelines for each assigned project. 10. Report challenges along with alternative solutions to minimize impact to the overall schedule

WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BRING TO THIS ROLE...

  • 1. Understand the key elements in project management - scope, objectives, resources, risks, schedules, and evaluation. 2. Analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills. 3. a Basic understanding of the electronic hardware product structure. (Preferably in Network Storage domain). 4. Knowledge in a WWN and MAC PUID and industrial standards, such as ISO/IEC 15459. SO/IEC/IEEE 8802 is preferable. 3. Coding skills in MySQL, PostgreSQL, Python, C, C++. 5. Knowledge of data gathering, cleaning, and transforming techniques using MySQL and PostgreSQL. 6. Reporting and data visualization skills using software like Tableau and Google Data Studio. 7. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel. 8. Excellent attention to detail. 9. Good communication and presentation skills. 10. Currently enrolled in a Bachelors's or Master's program in Computer Science or related fields with an expected graduation date in or after December 2021. 11. Able to work full-time for 12 weeks during Summer 2021

position: Software/UI Development Intern - Power Plant Smart Mgmt Platform Development
description:
About NICE America Research Inc:

NICE America Research, Inc. is an established R&D Incubator in Silicon Valley, a subsidiary of the National Institute of Clean-and-low-carbon Energy (NICE) in Beijing, China. NICE is the corporate research arm of China Energy Investment Corporation which is an integrated energy company and a member of the Global Fortune 500.

 

We are currently building teams to develop cutting-edge Power Plant Smart Management (PPSM) platform based on digital twin and machine learning technologies, to improve the operating efficiencies of existing power generation plants, so to reduce the plantsâ€™ OPEX and emissions to protect the environment, and mitigate climate change by reducing the plantsâ€™ carbon footprints. We have carved out some exciting projects in Power Plant Smart Management platform software/UI development for an Intern. .

 

Job Responsibilities:

The PPSM project team aims to develop a software applying digital twin and machine learning technologies to provide online performance monitoring and assessment optimization guidance for power plants.  The successful intern candidate, under the direction of a senior scientist, is expected to:

 

  1. Work with the team to develop software/UI which can process and visualize the power plant operating data and the digital twin simulation data, undertake the data communications on demand in between live data, database storage, digital twin, and PPSM platform. 
  2. Develop a web browser type PPSM platform user interface (UI) which takes user inputs for digital twin and fetch data from database and provide data visualization on demand.
  3. Develop protocol for data communication in between MS excel and database (Oracle or MySQL), code excel macros using VBA,
  4. Develop and code ML (machine learning) algorithms to couple with existing physics-based digital twin models.

 

Required Qualifications:

  1. Enrolled in or completed degree program in Computer Science or related fields
  2. Experience with website coding development
  3. Proficiency in MS Excel VBA/Python/C/PHP/JSON.
  4. Proficiency in Oracle, MySQL
  5. Eager to learn and contribute.

Desired skills:

  1. Coding expertise in MS Excel VBA, Python/C/PHP/JSON.
  2. Knowledge of Oracle, MySQL
  3. Project documentation through reports
  4. Good communication skills in written, oral, and presentations.
