As a PhD Applied Research Intern you will work closely with leading experts and apply real-world solutions that span across the areas of Machine Learning, Robotics, and Software Engineering. 
About the Work
Depending on your skill sets and areas of interest, your work will focus on some or all of the following below
Autonomy
Machine Learning Research and develop solutions for behavior prediction, intent understanding, planning using advanced sequence, graph neural networks based on supervised or reinforcement learning
Machine Learning Infrastructure Design scalable and optimizable systems that can process petabytes of data for model compilation & training in production
Perception Resolve real-world robotics problems in one or more of the following areas computer vision, sensor fusion, state estimation, object detection, classification, and tracking
Behavior Develop novel prediction & planning algorithms in domains like machine learning, trajectory optimization, reasoning under uncertainty, modeling system dynamics and reachability, and probabilistic reasoning.
Mapping & Localization Research, develop and implement algorithms to solve large-scale mapping and real-time localization problems for our fleet of self-driving delivery robots

About You

You are currently in a PhD program focusing in one or more of the following areas Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, Mathematics, or a closely related field
You have subject matter expertise and research in one or more of the following areas Advanced Algorithms & Data Structures, Distributed-Systems, Machine Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Robotics, Imitation Learning, Computer Vision, 3D Graphics/Geometry
You have strong problem solving and programming skills in C++ or Python

description:

COMPANY PROFILE:

Founded in 1993, JourneyTEAM has grown from a small software development shop into an award-winning, business technology consulting firm. They are a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner and serve technology needs of large public and private organizations, including many of the world’s best-known brands. JourneyTEAM’s expert level consultants dive deep into the dynamics of an organization and solve complex issues that improve a company’s sales, marketing, productivity, collaboration, accounting, and security. The company provides consulting and implementation services specifically for Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Office 365 solutions, including Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CRM), Microsoft Dynamics Business Central, Dynamics GP, Microsoft’s Enterprise Mobility and Security Suite, SharePoint, Okta and more.

Company Description

The Bosch Research and Technology Center North America with offices in Sunnyvale, California, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Cambridge, Massachusetts is part of the global Bosch Group (www.bosch.com), a company with over 70 billion euro revenue, 400,000 people worldwide, a very diverse product portfolio, and a history of over 125 years. The Research and Technology Center North America (RTC-NA) is committed to providing technologies and system solutions for various Bosch business fields primarily in the areas of Human Machine Interaction (HMI), Robotics, Energy Technologies, Internet Technologies, Circuit Design, Semiconductors and Wireless, and MEMS Advanced Design.

The Bosch Research and Technology Center (RTC) in Pittsburgh, PA is focused on the research and development of cutting-edge technologies that will shape the future of the company’s products. Specifically, our lab works in the fast-paced field of the Internet of Things and Services (IoTS) – an exciting combination of business, technology and user experience that is driven by the rapid development of connectivity, mobile computing, social networks, and multimodal sensor fusion.

Job Description

Our team works at the intersection of AI and IoT for developing exciting Cyber-Physical Systems. We are looking for an enthusiastic research intern to develop a novel localization solution by using Wi-Fi Channel State Information (CSI) and RSSI. The focus is to use the localization solution for addressing novel use cases in the automotive applications.

Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Develop a novel localization solution using signal processing and AI-based techniques by leveraging Wi-Fi CSI and RSSI for automotive applications.
  • Evaluate the performance of the solution.
  • Summarize the findings and publish a high-quality research paper.
  • Show a proof-of-concept demo.
Qualifications

  • Strong background in Wi-Fi CSI signal processing and AI based techniques.
  • Strong background in machine learning, AI-based techniques, and time-series analysis.
  • Strong research and problem solving skills.
  • Publication records in leading venues (SenSys/IPSN) are a plus.
  • Prior experience of developing a Wi-Fi-based localization algorithm is a plus.


Additional Information

  • Major(s): Computer Science or relevant area
  • Degree level: PhD or MS – Current student or recent graduate
  • Location: Pittsburgh, PA
  • Duration: 14 weeks
  • Start Date: May 2021

description:
Digital Consulting Intern - Tax Services - Winter 2022(

Description

 

Who is Grant Thornton?

Hi. We’re Grant Thornton LLP, the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd (A.K.A. one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms.) With us, business feels more personal — for our clients and for you. That makes us different. Better. And we’re looking for applicants who are too.


Different how? It means working with numbers doesn’t make you a number. Here, your voice matters. Our inclusive community and caring culture rejects limits and egos, which helps make our work stronger and you thrive. From our global clients and no-silos style, we empower you with opportunity from day one, then set you up for long-term success with flexibility, resources and connections. It’s how we help you create a career you love — and more.


Interested? Get to know us better at gt.com/careers and read on to learn more how you’ll help us become even bolder:

 
Why Join Tax Digital Consulting?
 

At Grant Thornton, our Tax Digital Consulting practice helps drive efficiencies, mitigate business risks, and increase the value of the tax functions of large enterprises.  In addition, our team manages, automates, analyzes and visualizes data using data transformation and visualization tools to support process improvement initiatives. We also have a large team that implements for large organizations (through standard or custom integrations) transaction tax engines and tax reporting/compliance technologies, and we provide technical support for these technologies during and after implementation.

 

We work with complex multinational companies to understand the regulatory landscape and influence business decisions. If you have a desire to think globally in a fast-paced environment and influence important decisions in variety of business functions, then Tax Digital Consulting may be an area for you to consider.

  • Experience working with back end databases and database management systems

  • Familiarity with Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation and Blockchain and their impact on the regulatory environment
  • Programming related coursework

  • Intellectually curious
  • Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills

  • Willingness to learn and adopt new technologies
  • Ability to function within a geographically-distributed team

Applicable Majors:

position: Internship: Network Engineer & NOC Technician- Full Time
description:
Wisper Internet of Mascoutah, IL is looking to hire a full-time Intern: Network Engineer & NOC Technician to participate in our Internship Program. Are you a humbly confident student? Would you like to take your career to the next level with a growing company in the internet service industry? If so, please read on!
With offices located in Illinois & Missouri, we are a leading local wireless high-speed internet provider in the Midwest. While growing at a rapid pace, we provide service with a human touch. We provide service to rural communities where other providers do not.We believe in building leaders within all levels of our company. In order to exemplify our core values, we offer interns competitive pay, career development, & a positive work culture. The total number of hires & start dates are subject to workload & business conditions. Locations will vary based on project needs, & may include Mascoutah, IL, Joplin, MO, & Washington, MO.


Internship Functions:

  • Train with department management, professional and support staff in order to gain work experience utilizing an Educational & Implementation Phase
  • Gain working knowledge of applications & tools related to assigned functional area
  • Perform assigned tasks & project work with supervision
  • Other specific duties/tasks determined by department management
    1.Education Phase
    All participants in this program will go through each overview, regardless which track they select at the end of the three months.
    Month 1 (Basics Overview):
    Basic RF Propagation
    Basic Networking - TCP/IP, Subnetting
    Equipment Overview (Fixed Wireless Access Points, Backhauls, Switches, Routers)
    Month 2 (Engineering Overview):
    Basic Wireless Design
    Reading RF Propagation Maps
    Tower Design/Overview
    Month 3 (NOC Overview):
    NMS (Network Monitory System) Overview
    Ticketing/Escalation Process Overview
    Change Management Overview
    2. Implementation Phase
    All participants in this phase will be offered the opportunity to apply what they have learned & will select which track they enjoyed the most from their first 3 months of education, with the final track placement subject to department availability.
    Engineering:
    Month 4 - Running RF Propagation Models
    Month 5 - Designing Wireless and Fiber Backhauls
    Month 6 - Complete Site Design - Building design packages that include RF Propagation & BH Design for single & multisite design
    NOC:
    Month 4 - Network Monitoring and Ticket Creation
    Month 5 - Customer Resolution - Tier 1 Tickets
    Month 6 - Customer Resolution - Tier 2 Tickets

Internship Requirements:

  • Valid Driver's License
  • Ability to commit fully to the Program for 12 months in a full- time status with an understanding that no full-time position is guaranteed upon completion
  • Currently enrolled in a four-year Bachelor of Science degree program in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Information Technology, Information Systems Management, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering
  • Completed at least two years of undergraduate studies in one of the above fields
  • Eligibility to work & remain in the U.S. without sponsorship

Internship Desired Skills & Competencies:

  • Completed relevant coursework with a 2.5 or above GPA
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Enthusiasm for technology, paired with a love of learning
  • Personal accountability with ability to be punctual

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:

  • Ability to pass a background check & drug screen
  • Work is performed indoors at a desk

About the Role:

As a security analyst intern at Pondurance you will work with other analysts to monitor, evaluate and report on clients network traffic in an effort to help mitigate their risk of attack, as well as immediately contain threats that do penetrate their defenses. 

Responsibilities:

  • Monitor and analyze large amounts of network traffic looking for attacker presence
  • Identify threat vulnerabilities
  • Document and escalate incidents
  • Use cyber defense tools for continual monitoring and analysis of system activity to identify malicious activity
  • Provide weekly threat reports to clients
  • Conduct monthly vulnerability scans of clients networks

Qualifications:

  • Strong technical and analytical skills
  • Ideal candidate will hold a degree, or is pursuing a degree, in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a related technical discipline and/or will possess equivalent experience
  • Highly organized, able to multi-task, the ability to work individually, within a team, and with other groups

About the role:

We are looking for a highly-motivated and beauty enthusiasts student to join our Machine Learning Engineering team. We have a range of exciting projects to meet your technical interests including large-scale classification of short text, deep learning problems for recommender systems, causal inference and heterogeneous treatment effects, as well as unsupervised user segmentation.

This will be a 3-month long internship and will start in the Summer of 2021. Each intern will be assigned a mentor and have the opportunity to lead their projects and present their results to the wider organization.

What You’ll Be Doing;

  • Work with a dedicated mentor to scope a project that fits our business needs and your technical interests
  • Develop exploratory data analysis to make the case for your project
  • Develop ML models to solve business objectives. Projects include: NLP, recommender systems, data augmentation, causal inference, and unsupervised user segmentation
  • Document your work via internal wikis, design documents, recorded demos, and slide presentations

What We’re Looking For:
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelors, Master’s or PhD in Computer Science or related field
  • Solid programming skills in Python
  • Practical experience in one or more of the following areas: natural language processing, causal inference, recommender systems, or deep learning
  • Practical experience with cleaning, manipulating, and analyzing large data sets
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively as a member of a team

Time Commitment: 40 hours per week

Job Description:

Leidos is seeking candidates for a Systems Integration Engineer for a mission critical program in Chantilly, VA. The Integration Engineer will apply technical knowledge and project management skills to integrate external programs with our services. The ideal candidate will enjoy learning new concepts and technologies, having a desire to take ownership for successfully integrating clients with our system.




Primary Responsibilities



+ Leverage your technical experience to understand a client’s functional goals and translate them into technical requirements. Expand your industry knowledge to include new concepts and technologies as our program evolves, and our client list expands


+ Leverage your project management skills to manage a client’s integration with us. Independently help clients identify the next steps to move their integration project forward. Reinforce SDLC best practices through a methodical approach to transition clients from development, test, into operational environments


+ Use your communication skills to explain to clients how their systems can integrate with ours. Advise clients on recommended integration methods


+ Using your attention to detail, follow standard procedures to configure our system to integrate with the client. Recognize when the client requires customizations to a standard solution


+ Confirm the integration satisfies the client requirements by performing standard tests, investigating and troubleshooting as needed. Take ownership to troubleshoot integration issues until finding a resolution





Basic Qualifications



+ Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree program in Engineering, Computer Science or a related major.


+ System integration or software development, and experience integrating services from different systems


+ Working across teams, to collect and translate requirements into actionable tasks


+ Software testing or validation procedures, improving the procedures as needed


+ Troubleshooting software issues, investigating root causes, and recommending fixes


+ Using a command line interface to navigate Linux or Windows operating systems


+ Coordinating activities of an external group


+ Demonstrated ability to learn and apply new concepts and technologies


+ Strong problem-solving and excellent written and oral communication skills


+ US Citizenship required per contract


+ Eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI clearance. No clearance is required to start; chosen candidates will be screened for eligibility.





Preferred Qualifications



+ System administration skills in support of RHEL, SE Linux, Solaris, Windows, Apache, IIS


+ Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC), Scrum, and Agile processes


+ Knowledge of Oracle Identity and Access Management (IdAM) suite, including OAM, OID, OVD, OHS


+ Knowledge of authentication standards using OAuth, SAML, and PKI

position: SAP Sales Solution iXp Intern - IT Technology Consultant
description:
Requisition ID: 284960

Work Area: Sales

Expected Travel: 0 - 10%

Career Status: Student

Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. Thats why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.


SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because its the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve peoples lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAPs global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP


1. Culture of collaboration : meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

2. Project-driven experience : gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

3. Gain visibility : with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, youll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team


Our Sales Solutions team is responsible for the End-to-End solution delivery supporting SAPs core Sales Deal Execution business processes closely interacting with the respective LoB Global Customer Organization (GCO). Here we act as the Business trusted advisor and expert, driving together the simplification of business processes based on a user-centric approach.


You can work on a wide variety of projects cloud applications, user experience, operational support, new development and implementation of new innovative technology.

You can be part of IT teams who showcase SAP as the companys first and best reference customer through The Best Run SAP program and close collaboration and co-innovation with our SAP standard development organization.


We are looking for bright minds to participate and contribute their great ideas through co-innovation and solution implementation projects empowered through SAPs cutting-edge technologies to enable SAP as the digital enterprise. Customer Experience, End-User Centricity and Immaculate Work Ethics is the key


What youll do:


Position title: SAP Sales Solution iXp Intern IT Technology Consultant


Location: NSQ/ Virtual USA please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings


Expected start date to end date: May 17, 2021 November 17, 2021


In this role, youll:


Work within our IT unit to enable best in class IT solutions for our Sales Solutions business processes which will include:


+ Being a part of an agile team, assume responsibility for tasks and complete them end-to-end with the best quality.

+ primarily focus on development and customization of cloud-based software application.

+ design and implement new solutions using SAPs latest Cloud Platform technologies.

+ drive continuous improvements with focus on quality, stability, usability, maintainability and ultimately customer satisfaction.

+ assume responsivity of all software development tasks working with multiple teams of developers supporting software product in ownership.

+ develop skill and competency on latest solutions and technologies relevant for internal sales processes.


Finally, bring your energy and passion and well give you the tools to develop your knowledge and grow!


Who you are:


Education and Qualifications / Skills and Competencies


+ Graduate in Computer Science or equivalent.

+ Practical knowledge of Iron Python is must.

+ Quick Learner, passionate, motivated and self-managed.

+ Experience in agile project delivery (Scrum, Kanban etc.) connected with End-User Centricity.

+ Ability to work in an international, virtual and highly diverse team.

+ Excellent English skills.

+ Familiarity of Callidus CPQ and Callidus Commissions solutions is a plus

+ Practical experience with SQL.


Work Experience


+ Ideally 1 2 years of working experience or experience through internships, working student employments or first full-time jobs.

+ Ability to work well in an international, virtual and highly diverse team as well as independently and have a positive self-motivated can-do attitude

+ Experience working in an Agile development environment.

+ Ability to deliver in the set timeframe.


Follow @SAPiXp onInstagram (https://www.instagram.com/sapixp/)and dont miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US


Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If youre searching for a company thats dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now _._


SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.


SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com , APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com , EMEA: Careers@sap.com ).


Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Additional Locations :

Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world including Alipay, Stripe, Airbnb, and Microsoft leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern to be based out of Seattle, who thrives on designing, coding, and maintaining high performance data processing applications on the JVM platform (primarily in Clojure and Scala), running on AWS. 

Your ideal internship should be one where you work in a small team and are empowered to make yourself and your team more productive on a daily basis. You should want to be part of a team where your desire to grow and learn are valued and aptly rewarded; where using and contributing to open source are looked upon as an asset; where innovating and executing are core to your teams' beliefs.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will:

  • Write performant code and write automated test to validate correctness of code
  • Develop and deploy large-scale microservices and/or data processing systems
  • Meet development milestones and business requirements on schedule
  • Independently analyze, propose and develop solutions for technical problems and issues
  • Ensure the adherence to the standards and procedures that result in an environment compliant with information security policy

Our ideal Software Engineering Intern will have:

  • A willingness to learn new languages and techniques to solve challenging problems.
  • Experience in functional programming fundamentals.
  • BS degree in Computer Science, related degree or equivalent. Graduating before August 2022. 
  • Ability to write clean code that works, is readable, maintainable and follows best practices and coding standards
  • Understanding of OO and functional design, languages, algorithms and data structures
  • A philosophy of iteration and continuous improvement
  • A desire to own design and architecture end to end

Unwavering in our pursuit of standardizing global identity data, we are approachable, real people that genuinely care about the success of those we partner with. With a commitment to service, innovation, and ownership, Ekata is a dynamic place to work for folks who want to make an impact on a global scale. We provide learning & development opportunities for each employee and promote work-life flexibility through self-managed time off. Headquartered in downtown Seattle, Ekata is growing internationally with offices in Budapest, Hungary, Amsterdam, and in Singapore.

To learn more about the experience of working at Ekata visit: https://ekata.com/careers/

Ekata prides itself on celebrating diversity, inclusivity, and being an equal-opportunity employer.

position: Business Builder Intern - Card Linked Offers (Summer)
description:
Business Builder Intern - Card Linked Offers

As a business builder intern you will explore, develop and build businesses around new project opportunities for numo's card linked offers portfolio.  In this role you match unsolved business problems with emerging technologies.  Our ideal intern is a creative thinker and explorer that dives into details to uncover and pursue high growth opportunities.  Ultimately the intern builds the business side by side with the existing team and the CLO leadership to drive growth.  Our interns develop expertise in current industry gaps and sees gaps that no one is talking about to shape the opportunities that we will pursue.

Responsibilities

  • Drive development of the product, technology and/or operations in our nascent businesses
  • Gather industry information and assess market landscapes to shape our strategy
  • Conduct due diligence, operational metrics assessments, competitive analysis, product and technology evaluation, reference calls, and financial and exit modeling
  • Articulate thoughtful analyses into recommendations/business cases for development

Requirements

  • Progress toward a Bachelor's degree required; Business, finance, computer science or related field preferred  
  • Progress toward an MBA or other post graduate work preferred
  • Prior experience in VCs, startups, or consulting preferred
  • Prior experience in banking (retail, commercial banking, wealth and asset management, investment banking), specifically in payments or card linked offers

Skills/Experiences

While there is no "ideal" profile for this role, we are looking for candidates with some combination of the following experiences / skills:

  • Ability to uncover needs / problems (both consumer and business) through consumer research, structured interactions, and discovery
  • Ability to synthesize findings into cohesive, succinct messages to crisply, concisely convey complex information to high level audiences in written and verbal forms
  • Ability to "pitch" ideas and convince the organization to continue pursuing ideas
  • Ability to work independently and drive multiple dynamic projects
  • Grittiness in uncovering information and insights (phone calls, visits, connections, etc.) – using more than just Google
  • Understanding of technologies required to stand up a digital product
  • Self-starter with technology background
  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and tackle something hands-on
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and a focus on execution
  • Experience standing up business lines / new offerings / innovative products
  • Experience developing / launching digital products
  • Experience working on a cross-functional product / design / technical team
  • Experience in technology assessment and industry commercialization

Who we are

numo creates software for the financial services industry.  We are a team of technologists, designers, business thinkers, and academics that create software and data products.  The model is unique. We build innovative consumer and enterprise software in house by applying cutting edge approaches, technology, and data analysis techniques to financial service opportunities.  Through academic and corporate partnerships, we source our project ideas by understanding immediate business challenges at PNC. We work directly with staff inside the bank to build products that will create immediate value for PNC we architect products so that they can be spun off into standalone companies.

What do we do? We are building an Integrated fintech platform designed to transform existing payment processing ecosystems and improve both aesthetic practice economics and patient experiences.

There is nothing like your own experience. An internship within the Data Analytics team at Revance Therapeutics not only offers an opportunity to build your skills and confidence, but also to work on projects that give you insight into who we are and what we do as a Biotech and Fintech Company (who’s growing at a rapid speed) as well as for the wider community. This is a unique opportunity to intern with an integrated digital services platform targeted to aesthetic practice payment services.

You will be assigned tasks to develop your understanding of what we really do, and you will build networks with your colleagues in Data Analytics and Software Engineering. Not only will you work on tasks that address the present needs but will help with tasks that drive value for the future of the team. Opportunity is at the heart of a career at Revance Therapeutics and our Data Analytics internship offers just that. 

 Essential Duties/Responsibilities
  • Work closely with Product team, QA Engineers, SME’s to determine appropriate data sources and to define data provisioning mechanism from building data pipelines to dashboards
  • Conceptualizing, developing, and maintaining dashboards and visualizations
  • Examine through large amounts of data, extract key insights, and communicate concisely
  • Identify key metrics and build executive facing dashboards to track progress of the business
  • Identify data automation opportunities and manage projects to refine the process by getting hands-on with the data stack
  • Improve the quality of existing data pipeline, data warehouse, setting up alerts on anomaly detections, well-thought out ETL, and clearly documenting the workflows
  • Learn and contribute to the design of data management and any future transformation of the data engineering landscape
  • Demonstrate flexibility as needed. Participate in manual testing, automated testing, put out fires (not literally) and troubleshooting when required.
  • Prepare presentations, reports, and analytics
  • Collaborate with intern peers to propose solutions to real business problems
  • Execute a group project with fellow interns
  • Participate in the mentoring sessions, guest speaker series, and training modules
  • Participate in a community service program
  • Assist with the engagement survey action plan project
  • Other duties as assigned

Education

  • Current 3rd or 4th year students pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics or related field

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Familiarity with ETL tools. Knowledge in Redshift and PostgreSQL is preferred.
  • Familiarity working in finance, sales.
  • Familiarity in data validation and data integrity testing.
  • Familiarity with the concepts of Data-Dictionaries.
  • Familiarity in BI/Reporting tools like Looker, Periscope, Quick sights, PowerBI.
  • Excellent analytical, troubleshooting skills, verbal and written communications skills.
  • Familiarity of working in a Scrum/Agile environment.
  • Ability to work in teams and cultivate relationships
  • Intellectual curiosity: seeking opportunities to develop
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrated leadership or initiative at school, work and/or community
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office—Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Demonstrated leadership or initiative at school, work and/or community

position: Summer 2021 - Smart Ops Tech - Utility Technologies Intern
description:
Requisition ID:  65492 

Job Function/Category:  University Recruiting 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Part Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSE&G is seeking a Utility Technology intern for the summer of 2021.

Summer interns will assist engineers on various DSCADA projects which include supporting Energy Strong II.

• RTU Asset Database - Record SCADA devices in the asset database for inventory tracking

• Energy Strong II Reporting - help automate reporting in SQL (for example, perform SAP data dumps for cost control purposes)

• Assist with ServiceNow Tickets by tracking open tickets and work engineers to resolve

• Assist team member on SCADA data metric reporting and automate process

• Assist with Remote Device Management (RDM) project activities and other SCADA projects

Assist in providing business support to the Distribution SCADA (D-SCADA) initiatives which includes but is not limited to:

• Work with the Engineers within GE&C on Energy Strong 2 to support project schedules, budgets, and associated reporting • Analyze reports to ensure functionality and performance meet all product and service level requirements • Provide support on asset tracking • Use tools such as SQL to automate reporting and assist with data governance • Applies Agile concepts, practices, and procedures

Candidates need to be able to meet deadlines, juggle competing priorities, operate independently while knowing when to ask for help or guidance, and view all work from a customer's perspective..

Required Education/Skills: The successful candidate (s) must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Engineering, Computer Science, or similar related major. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

All PSEG internship roles are paid at an hourly rate, however there are no benefits associated with these positions. Candidates are expected to work 40 hours per week over the summer period for the full 10-12 week period. We are targeting: Currently enrolled students, staying in the NJ/NY/PA metro area for the duration of the internship and able to commute to the assigned work location. Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions.

Preferred Skills: GPA of 3.0, As an employee of PSE&G or PSEG Long Island, you should be aware that during storm restoration efforts, you may be required to perform functions outside of your routine duties and on a schedule that may be different from normal operations.

This site ( http://www.pseg.com ) is strictly for candidates who are not currently PSEG employees. PSEG employees must apply for jobs internally through empower which can be accessed through the mypseg homepage by clicking on the employee center tab, then under the empower header, choose careers.

Business needs may cause PSEG to cancel or delay filling position at any time during the selection process.

Certain positions at the Company may require you to have access to Part 810-Controlled Information.  Under the law, the Company is limited in who it can share this information with and in certain circumstances it is necessary to obtain specific authorization before the Company can share this information.  Accordingly, if the position does require access to this information, you must complete a 10 CFR Part 810 Export Control Compliance Nationality Request Form, a copy of which will be provided to you by Talent Acquisition if an offer is made.  If there is a need for specific authorization, due to the time it takes to obtain authorization from the government, we will likely not be able to further proceed with an offer.

Job Segment: Architecture, Intern, Utility, Engineer, Engineering, Entry Level, Energy, Operations

Thank you for your interest in II-VI Corporation! Our summer internship program has proven to be very successful. In addition to getting hands-on experience in the field(s) of your interest, this might be your first time working for a large corporation. This opportunity gives managers insight into your true future as a potential employee after graduation. We are excited for this summer's program and can't wait for our interns to add great value to the company! You must be a returning student in Fall 2021 to be considered. Our internships do not exceed 90 days. II-VI does not provide relocation or housing assistance.


KEY JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Collect Characterization data using existing software programs (FICPanel and FICSoft)
  • Analyze and Report Characterization Data in Excel or PowerPoint
  • Preproduction test program(s): Collect data, perado failures, adjust test limits
  • Add New software functions, using Visual Studio and VB.NET code, built into existing application.
  • Setup/configure Test station hardware and instrument connections; DC and RF.
  • Communicates professionally and works with Designers and other characterization engineers

SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Electrical Engineering or Computer Science Student.
  • Some electrical engineering courses completed.
  • Basic knowledge of electronics
  • Electronic lab instruments/Equipment usage
  • Lab instrument automation (NI-VISA)
  • Programming experiences
  • Communicate well and present information

About Cubist

Cubist Systematic Strategies is one of the world’s premier investment firms. The firm deploys systematic, computer-driven trading strategies across multiple liquid asset classes, including equities, futures and foreign exchange. The core of our effort is rigorous research into a wide range of market anomalies, fueled by our unparalleled access to a wide range of publicly available data sources.

Job Responsibilities

  • Independently conduct quantitative finance research with a focus on statistical and predictive models
  • Design, backtest, and implement algorithms for optimal portfolio construction
  • Evaluate new datasets for alpha potential
  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of the investment process and the team’s research and trading infrastructure

Desirable Candidates

  • PhD graduate student (expected to graduate in May-July 2021) in finance, applied economics, operations research, statistics, mathematics, electrical engineering, or computer science
  • Demonstrated ability to conduct independent research utilizing large data sets
  • Proficient in Python and C++
  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills
  • Detail-oriented
  • Willing to take ownership of his/her work, working both independently and within a small team

Teradata helps businesses unlock value by turning data into their greatest asset. We’re the cloud data analytics platform company, built for a hybrid multi-cloud reality, solving the world's most complex data challenges at scale. Collectively, we endeavor to serve equal parts innovator and contributor. Because our mission isn’t just about the collection of data – it’s about revolutionizing the future of transportation to save lives, optimizing energy costs to make the planet a cleaner place, and using data to predict and identify cancer risks.


Our Company


With all the expenditures made in analytics, it’s time to stop buying into partial solutions that overpromise and underdeliver. It’s time to invest in answers. Only Teradata leverages all of the data, all of the time, so customers can analyze anything, deploy anywhere, and deliver analytics that matter most to them. And we do it on-premises, in the Cloud, or anywhere in between, throughout the world. We call this pervasive data intelligence. It’s the new way we transform how businesses work and people live through the power of data.


Our summer internship program lasts 10-12 weeks beginning in May/June and ending in August/September. Fast-paced, flexible, fun. The Teradata culture isn’t just about one kind of person. So many individuals make up who we are, making us that much more unique. It’s what sets apart the dynamic, diverse and collaborative environment that is Teradata.


Our Team


Welcome to our team of top-notch data analysts and master data management professionals! We utilize Teradata’s Master Data Management products to manage the data that is used to generate insights on behalf of Teradata’s business teams. Teams like Sales, Finance, Customer Service, and Marketing all rely on these insights to measure business health and make strategic, data-driven decisions.


Your Opportunity


During your internship, you will work independently, with the support of an assigned mentor, and with other team members, on challenging and exciting assignments. As part of the Enterprise Data Services’ Master Data Management Team, you will validate some of the analytical approaches that are generating new insights on behalf of the business teams. You will support and verify the enhancements made to the MDM tool’s user experiences. You may also support the program that is establishing enterprise-level MDM standards and processes.


Your Work


+ Perform a key role in the SQL-driven data analysis efforts to validate master data

+ Help shape the Master Data Management user experience and ensure alignment with the underlying business requirements

+ Contribute to the quality assurance activities that will verify the Master Data Management user interface is correctly reading from and writing to the corresponding database

+ Summarize and present the findings of your quality assurance activities


Qualifications/Requirements


+ Self-starter, takes initiative

+ Independent thinker

+ Strong analytical skills

+ Ability to write SQL queries

+ Experience with relational databases

+ Passionate, self-motivated, and team-oriented

+ Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills

+ Must be enrolled in BS/MS degree program. Graduation dates between December 2021-June 2024. Your major is probably in a field related to Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Science, Mathematics, or Statistics.

+ Minimum 3.0 GPA


Teradata invites all identities and backgrounds in the workplace. We work with deliberation and intent to ensure we are cultivating collaboration and inclusivity across our global organization. n​nWe are proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, ancestry, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related conditions), national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, military and veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

JOB SUMMARY

This intern will be responsible for supporting multiple areas of the business with various business data analysis. You will support the sales, dealing, and account management teams on analysis of client data for prioritizing client management efforts, optimizing pricing and margins, and compiling overall statistical data for executive leadership.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Data Analytics & Reporting

Daily, weekly, monthly & ad-hoc reporting & data analytics, to support Moneycorp North America in all aspects/divisions as required by business units.

Reporting/Analysis

  • Daily, weekly, monthly reports / KPIs for dealing, sales, finance outlining revenue, spread, margin, flow analysis by channel, client vertices, categories, product, new, established, and transitioned accounts.
  • Examine datasets and draw conclusions about the information they contain. Take raw data and uncover patters and extract insight for sales & dealing team for improved decision making & customer service. Gain a 360-degree view of clients to understand them more fully and better meet their needs.
  • Analyze data to market more effectively. Gain useful insights to improve campaigns and performance by fine-tuning message to targeted clients for optimal outcomes

Projects

  • Business has multiple ongoing and ad-hoc projects such as pricing optimization (Phase I/II/III), beneficiary address project, frequency reports, variance reporting, commission reconciliation, compliance and audit, CRM Database clean up. Also target project to target client base for hedging with bespoke hedge proposals based on historic flows, and trading patterns.
  • Targeted data analytics to send email blasts to new and established clients that will require significant coordination and support with marketing, BI, sales and dealing teams.
  • Operations. Work to streamline our processes, save money and boost bottom line. Use data to understand work flows, and improve results and reducing costs.


QUALIFICATIONS:

Knowledge and Experience:

  • Prior summer internship in related field required.
  • Relevant course work in Statistics, Computer Science/Programming, or related subjects

Skills:

  • Strong analytical skills, High attention to detail
  • Adept at MS Excel; conditional formatting, pivot tables, creating macros, etc.
  • Strong skills in R, SAS, Python or other related languages
  • Strong writing and communication ability

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher
  • Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field of study
  • 3.5 GPA (4.0 scale) minimum

Languages:

English

Personal Attributes:

Professional, adaptable, able to work in fast paced & open office setting.

Role: Business Development Intern (MBA Only)

Location: Remote

For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,500 companies and 100 Million threats detected a day.

Business Development Team

The Business Development team develops partnerships and alliances that have an impact on the bottom line.  We manage strategic, ecosystem and OEM partnerships. We are a small team of professionals that see partnership opportunities at the intersection of technology, business value and sales. 

As a BD intern, you will work with the team to develop and manage technology partners. You will be exposed to a wide range of technologies and be able to understand and communicate how they work together to solve customer problems.

Responsibilities:

  • Work alongside experienced Bus Dev leaders to develop and nurture technology partner ecosystem
  • Work alongside experienced Bus Dev leaders to qualify and scope solutions that have a positive impact on driving business for partnership
  • Draft marketing content to showcase joint solutions
  • Apply Account based Marketing tools and tactics to identify and engage key stakeholders for developing new sell-with partnerships
  • Develop framework for getting inputs from partners and internal stakeholders on performance and improvements to tech partner program

Required Skill Sets:

  • Business Acumen – Understand the value of a technology partnership. Understand how business objectives align or compete. Be able to communicate succinctly on why a partnership matters.
  • Technology Acumen – Understand a wide variety of technologies and how they impact Zscaler and possible integration points.
  • Analytical – Be able to research a company or industry and present findings to reach a conclusion.
  • Strong writing and presentation skills – actively listens and communicates well.
  • Collaborative – must be easy to work with.
  • Organized – ability to prioritize and multi-task extensively.

Qualifications:

  • Be currently enrolled in a MBA program at an accredited University. Must be enrolled in a program for the duration of the internship. 
  • Bachelors Degree required in Computer Science or a related engineering discipline.
  • Prior work experience in drafting marketing content preferred.

 What You Can Expect From Us:

  • An environment where you will be working on developing solutions with cutting edge technologies to disrupt the market incumbents
  • Mentored by the best talent in the industry to learn the skills for developing a technology partner ecosystem that not only solves customer problems but also contributes to pipeline
  • Learn how to execute an Account Based Marketing campaign, from start to finish.
  • A fun, passionate and collaborative workplace
  • The pace and excitement of working for a hyper growth Silicon Valley Unicorn

Why Zscaler?

People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.

Learn more at zscaler.com or follow us on Twitter @zscaler. Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ : ZS ) is available athttp://www.zscaler.com.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

How you'll make a difference:

The ideal candidate will help develop infrastructure software to support software development on Motional's self driving vehicle platform. They will work closely with applications teams and systems engineers to ensure delivery of safety certified code.

Bachelor’s or Master’s candidate in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or equivalent knowledge.

Experience with tools such as buildroot/yocto, conan and docker is a plus.
Knowledge of the math behind robotics and sensor systems is a plus.
Experience working with robotics and with robotics researchers is a plus.

Position Title:  VxWorks Engineering Intern

 Preferred Location:  Alameda, CA

In a world increasingly driven by software innovation, Wind River is pioneering the technologies to accelerate the digital transformation of our customers with a new generation of Mission Critical AI Systems in an AI-first world with the most exacting standards for safety, security, performance, and reliability.

Imagine being part of a global team that is building the technology foundation for self-driving cars. Life-saving medical breakthroughs. Environmentally sustainable energy. 5G networks. Or safe and smooth landings on Mars. When someone asks, “What did you do today?” you’ll have an awesome answer.

About the Opportunity

Wind River has a great opportunity available for Summer Intern (approximately June - September) to join the Core OS development team of Wind River's flagship VxWorks Operating System. Candidate will focus on Wind River Studio a cloud-based environment for build and validation pipelines used for kernel related features. They may also contribute to VxWorks kernel features.  This is a 40- hour per week paid internship.  Qualified candidate must be an enrolled student or recent college graduate looking to gain work experience.  

 

Responsibilities: 

The main responsibilities of this position will be to contribute to the development, maintenance, enhancement of features and tests related to the kernel technologies and Wind River Cloud solutions. The position will work with a variety of target platforms (PowerPC, Intel, ARM) on physical targets and simulators. You will be working closely with a talented group of OS, kernel, and architecture experts.

Qualifications:  

  • GPA of 3.0 or higher majoring in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
  • Completing 3 years of study as of May 2021 or higher
  • Knowledge of Operating Systems or taken courses in Operating Systems is a plus
  • Cloud development using Docker / Jenkins / Kubernetes
  • Practical experience with at least the C language
  • Good debugging and problem-solving skills
  • Good written and oral communication skills
  • Assembly language is a plus.
  • Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python, shell scripts etc. is also a plus.

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.

We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, modeling, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.

We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. Join us in building the future of energy

  • Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
  • Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
  • Advantageous: Experience with Python and/or MATLAB

Benefits

Paid time off, holidays

COMPANY

AccuWeather, recognized and documented as the most accurate source of weather forecasts and warnings in the world, has saved tens of thousands of lives, prevented hundreds of thousands of injuries and tens of billions of dollars in property damage. With global headquarters in State College, PA and other offices around the world, AccuWeather serves more than 1.5 billion people daily to help them plan their lives and get more out of their day through innovative digital media properties, such as AccuWeather.com and mobile, as well as AccuWeather for Business (AFB), radio, television, newspapers, and the 24/7 AccuWeather Network.

Additionally, AccuWeather produces and distributes news, weather content, and video for more than 180,000 third-party websites. Among AccuWeather’s many innovative and award-winning features free to the public are MinuteCast® Minute by Minute™ forecasts with Superior Accuracy™. Further, AccuWeather serves more than half of Fortune 500 companies and thousands of businesses globally.

 

SUMMARY

The AccuWeather Product Intern will work across a variety of initiatives that impact the enterprise product portfolio. This role is an exciting opportunity that will enable the intern to gain experience from working across all of AccuWeather’s portfolio products, as well as supporting the product systems that are integral to bringing our product vision to life. The intern will work on a rotation that encompasses a variety of projects required to achieve our goals.

The intern is part of a team whose focus is to transform the existing suite of products used by more than 300 million consumers worldwide, as well as lead the next generation of innovative product development. This internship is an exciting opportunity to gain experience in product management and contribute to the development of impactful strategies that will include various skill development including feature definition, experience design and executing with teams. This internship is perfectly suited for someone with a passion for science, technology, and leveraging data to improve people’s lives.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

 Participate in projects and initiatives as prescribed by the product management leadership team; rotating through a variety of product disciplines throughout the course of the internship

  • Support the delivery of products, services, features and functions that contribute to the achievement of AccuWeather’s product goals
  • Undertake audience research to develop user profiles; who they are, the features they use and enhancements they want
  • Attend scrum team meetings comprising of engineers and product designers to learn how to execute against plans
  • Collect and analyze feedback from customers, stakeholders, and other teams to inform recommendations
  • Participate in the development of business cases to support elements of the product strategy; use your business acumen to lead research projects to understand the opportunity in detail
  • Ideate new opportunities for AccuWeather to develop products against consumer needs throughout the conversion funnel

 About you

  • Meticulously detailed. Mobile savvy. Strong business acumen
  • Creative thinker. Exceptional communicator. Collaborator by nature
  • Desire to learn. Curious mind

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • You must be 18 years of age or older
  • Must be enrolled in a U.S. based college, university or trade school to qualify. Students who have completed at least two years of college are preferred
  • Marketing or Business majors preferred. Computer science or engineering most welcome to apply
  • Working knowledge of digitally distributed products and technology
  • Ability to interact and communicate with peers
  • Attention to detail

 

AccuWeather is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity to all applicants and existing employees and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity/expression), sexual orientation, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, marital status, political affiliation, religion, citizenship status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other basis protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. human.resources@accuweather.com

and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

description:

Job Function/Category:  University Recruiting

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG is seeking 2 summer interns to work in the Electric Asset Strategy team in the following areas:

• Transformer Engineering Group: • Engineering and implementation support to assist the Reliability Centered Maintenance group with transformer analytics and design aspects for IBM Asset Health Performance Platform • Perform work with transformer data, systems, contractors, and the RCM group to achieve more efficient methods of equipment ranking compared to existing methods • Model testing with various data inputs to modify and enhance model accuracy • Summer project includes inputting additional in service system equipment data into CMMS/SAP to enhance equipment database • Identify TRV capacitors and arrestors in our system based off of the one-line drawings of various substations and properly enter them into CMMS • Transmission Engineering: • Provide support of engineering for hydraulic and mechanical design aspects of underground transmission system • Development of specifications and standards for installation of "pipe-type" and extruded cable systems (i.e. pressurization plants, valve cabinets, thermal dynamic and fluid expulsion calculations, piping design) • Validation and testing of the Company's Pipe-Type Cable leak detection thermal models • Examine field data collected from monitoring systems, examining accuracy of the model and its various inputs • Modify existing model to enhance data collection and model accuracy
Required Education/Skills: The successful candidate (s) must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or similar related major. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Preferred Skills:

3.0 GPA; .

Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions. You know us as the food and beverage company behind a lot of your favorites like Stouffer’s, Nesquik, Toll House, and Lean Cuisine, as well as new discoveries like Sweet Earth and Chameleon Cold-Brew coffee. Across our organization, we’re building a workplace where collaboration is essential, courage is rewarded, speed is encouraged, and agility is the norm to delight our consumers every single day!


Here at Nestlé USA, you are empowered to become a student of the business and deliver the best to our consumers. We’re inviting forward-thinking and courageous future leaders to embrace an entrepreneurial approach and start their journey of growth.


If you're a current technologist and analytically focused graduate student eager to make an impact on an enormous scale, take strides into greatness by joining Nestlé USA.


What To Expect


Our 12 week paid internship with the Digital Acceleration Team is an opportunity to drive high-visibility, high-impact global outcomes for Nestlé. The environment will challenge you to think differently about problem solving and is a phenomenal way to get a feel for working at Nestlé. You will have hands on involvement with a significant business project from start to finish and get experience you won’t find in the classroom. You will apply the analytical and coding knowledge you have gained in school in a real world setting, while being supported by a team that includes a project manager, buddy, and mentor. You will have an opportunity to develop your professional network and extend your own portfolio of work.


Our projects are challenging, engaging and represent current business challenges that need a fresh perspective. You showcase the work you have done on your project at an end-of-internship presentation to senior leaders in the Digital organization. The internship experience also provides interaction with senior management and collaboration with team members across the business.


Interns experience life at Nestlé in a hands-on environment. We encourage students to question why we do things the way we do, provide fresh ideas, and improve processes and products. You’ll be part of the action and working from day 1.


After Your Internship


Our intern program is designed to bring High Achievers into the Digital organization at Nestlé USA and is intended to be a feeder into a full time position. We match your skill sets and passion with positions in our Digital organization. High performing summer interns are offered the opportunity to join the Digital organization after graduation and start their careers at Nestlé.


Education Requirements


+ Graduate students pursuing Master of Science in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering (Operations Research, Industrial), Economics, Applied Mathematics and/or Statistics. Graduating between December 2021 and June 2022.

+ Showcases a strong level of academic success (Cumulative GPA 3.0+)


Preferred Skills


+ Coding skills for analytics and data analysis (SQL, R Python, etc.)

+ Experience with large data sets.

+ Results focused and can clearly speak to projects they’ve executed.

+ Passionate lifelong learners who are agile and stay abreast of the evolving technology and data landscape.

+ Embraces courage to propose new ways of operating and challenges the status quo.

+ Leverages their intellectual curiosity to aid in problem solving and distills complex information into simple ideas

+ Resourceful, self-starter who applies varied means to uncover answers and arrive at conclusions.

+ Fire from within to execute and deliver a successful end product and do it better than the competition.

+ Strong communicators who encourage others and excel in a team environment.


Perks


+ Competitive compensation package.

+ Exposure to senior leadership through project presentation and mentoring

+ Volunteer in a community service opportunity with one of Nestlé’s Share Valued Organizations (e.g. Boys & Girls Club of America & Nestlé Adopt-A-School Program)

+ Potential employment opportunities after completion of degree


The Nestlé Companies are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer seeking diversity in qualified applicants for employment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.


EOE M/F/D/V Nestle is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is looking for diversity in candidates for employment. All candidates must apply online at Nestlejobs.com

position: SAP iXp Intern- Business Operations and Planning
description:

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. Thats why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.


SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because its the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve peoples lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program:


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP:


1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team:

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

We are seeking a Transformation and Planning Senior Associate, Engineering and CloudOps to join our Transformation and Planning organization located in South San Francisco, CA.


What you’ll do:


Position Title : SAP iXp Intern- Business Operations and Planning

Location : (Virtual)

Expected start date to end date: 6 Months


In this role, you’ll:

• Develop a deep understanding of our product development process, capacity and technical details.

• Validate team’s output and technical design decisions against the product strategy and timeline

• Contribute to product technology roadmap and business planning activities

• Support program teams with business case development by quantifying cost impact of infrastructure build of material (BOM), software development activities, and IT service operation activities.

• Drive and actively participate in engineering training and DevOps operating model improvement initiatives

• Create an environment for continuous learning and improvement


Skills / Competencies

• Demonstrated strong interest in enterprise software technology and human capital management (HCM)

• Independent thinker with both technical background and business perspectives - backed by data and structured analysis

• Intellectual curiosity in building and supporting innovation technologies

• Business acumen to connect technical impact with strategy and accounting knowledge

• Data analytics skills – can create pivot table, run basic regression, and construct SQL statements

• Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills.

• Strong execution orientation – find creative ways to get questions answered and thing done

• Be a responsive and dependable source of information in a fast paced, multi-functional environment


Desirable Additional Skills & Experience:

• Experience with Product Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and enterprise Software-as-a-Service(SaaS) cloud delivery model

• Experience with enterprise SaaS business model, sales process, customer segments, and market analysis

• Experience with Agile, Scrum methodologies


Qualifications

• 0-2 years of software engineering or related consulting experience

• Information System Management OR Computer Science degree

• MBA or business degree a plus


WHAT YOU GET FROM US


Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If youre searching for a company thats dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now _._


SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.


SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com , APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com , EMEA: Careers@sap.com ).


Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Additional Locations :Virtual - USA

We are one of the world’s largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies connecting people to the lifestyles, activities and experiences they cherish through our family of iconic outdoor, active and workwear brands including _Vans®, The North Face®, Timberland® and Dickies®_ _._


We’re proud of the scale, diversity and resources we can make available for you so you can explore new and exciting options as your career advances forward.


We offer a uniquely supportive, people-first environment that gives you the chance to be yourself while making a real impact, every day.


We’re a down to earth and straight forward culture, filled with smart people, working incredibly hard, doing what they love while striving towards something we all believe in.


We’re determined to make a difference and set an example for social and environmental impact at scale. Everyone can play their part and see their efforts recognized, appreciated and rewarded.


_All Internships will be remote. Depending on World Health Organization guidelines this may change over the course of your internship or be at the discretion of our management._


Job Title: Intern – Scrum Master


What you could be doing on a daily basis;


As an Intern on the Scrum team, you will be embedded on a team that works across applications on design, development, testing, documentation, implementation & maintenance. You’ll be partnered with a senior Scrum Master and work alongside them to learn the skills first-hand.


You’ll be assisting team members to track & communicate team velocity & sprint/release progress, removing team impediments, as well as engaging in the practice of core agile principles: collaboration, prioritization, accountability, continuous improvement.


This will give you the opportunity to network across VF teams, work on your presentation skills, organization skills, utilize mediation & negotiation skills, and learn strong teamwork & interpersonal techniques.


The types of strengths we would like you to bring;


+ Working toward a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business, Management or Information Systems (Junior or Senior status preferred)

+ Interested in retail, technology & business for a diverse global company


+ Have a can-do attitude, motivated & work well with others

+ Able to clearly communicate both written & verbally

+ *Knowledge of JIRA or other Enterprise Agile tool is a plus

+ *Familiarity with Agile Development Methodology is a plus


Our Intern Program runs from June 7th through August 13th, 2021! During your time with us, you will have opportunities for training that will enhance you as a professional, give back in our communities and of course have FUN with your colleagues! All VF internships are paid and offer you work that matters with some of the best teams around!

Job Description

The person in the role will work closely with the Architecture team and help operationalize frameworks, processes and practices.
