Description: Our client is currently seeking a Market Research Manager

 
POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team’s capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team’s intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying AmerisourceBergen’s guiding principles. In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive. Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
· Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
· Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
· Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
· Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
· Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
· Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
· Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of AmerisourceBergen’s performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
· Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
· With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
· Becomes AmerisourceBergen’s foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team’s goals
· Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
· Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
· Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
· Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
· Manages the intern’s workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern’s professional development.
· Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team’s workflows, processes, and deliverables
· Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
· Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Typical Education
· Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
· Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
· Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
· Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
· Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
· Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
· Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
· Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
· Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
· Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
· Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
· Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
· Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
· Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
· Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
· Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
· Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
· Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
· Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
· Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
· Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
· Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
· Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
· Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
· Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
· Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
· Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
· Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME’s as required to meet project objectives.

4. What special requirements/skills you would like us to screen for (i.e.: "Must Haves")? See job description as well.
Data analytics skill, statistical modeling skills should be advanced. Intermediate to advanced experience with statistical software (R, SPSS, Qualtrics, Sawtooth etc.)

description:
The objective of the Student Programs at Nexteer Automotive is to select students with high potential and provide them with "real world" work experiences. Assignments are designed to assimilate acquired classroom education with actual hands-on work experience in a technical environment. In addition, Nexteer Automotive gains the opportunity to find new talent to enhance productivity while providing students exposure to full-time career opportunities.

This position will allow the Student to understand and appreciate the Software Development activities involved in an Embedded System for an Automotive domain, where system timing and performance are crucial. Students will get an opportunity to develop automotive functionalities using C programming language on AUTOSAR based architecture, automation tools and scripting languages. They may also get an opportunity to work on Customer programs and define innovative approaches that improves the efficiency and productivity of the team.

  • Prototyping is a useful tool to quickly convert ideas into software and verify accuracy of the solution. The task here would be to prepare Prototype software in Embedded/Application domain using C language or any scripting language and test out solutions.

 

Requirements:

  • Candidate must be attending a 4-year university local to Saginaw
  • Candidate must be pursuing a Bachelors in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science

    • C language skill is required

  • Must have cumulative 2.7 GPA on 4.0 scale
  • Must be a full-time student (12 or more credits) during Fall and Winter semesters

The Human Health & Performance Systems Group focuses on objective, technology-based human-centered solutions to measure, model and modify cognitive and physiological function for enhancement, sustainment, or recovery. This goal is accomplished through three broad technical areas: health and resilience monitoring, trauma care, and performance enhancement. Research in all areas includes capability gap analysis, advanced sensing, machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms, biologically-based modeling, prototyping, system integration, and field testing of systems to monitor the human state, predict outcomes, and intervene to improve health and performance. Typical goals include increasing physical, cognitive and psychological performance and resilience of end users in their operational environments; measuring, modeling, and modifying the brain to mitigate neurotrauma and neurodegeneration of end users after exposure; and developing human-machine interfaces for enhanced end user performance and communication within groups. This highly interdisciplinary group draws on skills from biology, physiology, cognitive science, neuroscience, psychology, biosignal processing, engineering, machine learning and artificial intelligence, computer science, physics, and medical research areas. Primary government sponsors and partners are in the Departments of Defense, Veterans Affairs, Homeland Security, NASA, the National Institutes of Health, and the National Science Foundation.

Job Description

Job Description:
The candidate will participate in projects to develop automated and semi-automated systems for classification, segmentation, and target detection in biomedical imagery, including ultrasound, microscopy, and x-ray/CT. These projects are in support of the group's efforts in algorithm development for AI-enhanced medical image processing, medical devices, and more broadly, biomedical research. The candidate will process large biomedical image databases, prepare data for machine learning, develop machine learning algorithms, evaluate performance, and implement data visualization tools.

Requirements:
The candidate is a student in a B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. program in Bioengineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or other relevant engineering, science, or math program. Proficiency in MATLAB is required. Experience with Python is strongly desired. Experience with JavaScript, Android, or general user interface development will also be considered favorably. Interest in and exposure to machine learning, deep learning, statistical pattern recognition, and/or image processing is a plus.

  • Apply lean principles to the value stream to support business needs and plant targets.
  • Work within the value stream teams to create and maintain manufacturing documentation according to company standards, especially Process Quality Instructions (PQI), standardized work sequences, etc.

position: Graduate Co-Op - Summer/Fall 2021 - Engineering Process & Tools
description:
Why Crestron?

At Crestron Electronics, Inc we build the technology that integrates technology.We are proud to be the largest and most recognized brand in automation and control solutions, and the premier technology partner for fortune 500 businesses globally.

 

Our products are integrated into new high-tech commercial buildings’ to include some of the most exciting real estate throughout the world. Our clients include Google, Microsoft, Amazon, LinkedIn and many others. We are the leaders in one of the most exciting and fastest growing industries in the world!

Our automation and control solutions for homes and buildings allow our clients to control entire environments with the push of a button, integrating systems such as Audio Visual, Lighting, Shading, Security, Building Management Systems and HVAC to provide greater comfort, convenience and security.

Overview

Crestron Electronics continues to experience rapid growth as we invest in resources and create new opportunities; as a result, we have an exciting opportunity for a Summer/Fall 2021 Co-op (May 26th, 2021 - December 17th, 2021) to join our Engineering Division's Process and Tools organization either in Rockleigh, NJ or Plano, TX.

Responsibilities

 

  • Work with our professional developers in creating and testing new code that streamlines Engineering processes and workflow
  • Learn how to administer tools such as Jira
  • Contribute ideas on automating engineering workflows
  • Additional tasks and projects as assigned

Qualifications

General Requirements

  • Must be enrolled in a college or university working toward a Graduate Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or closely related field
  • Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher strongly preferred
  • Must be available to work up to 40 hours per week during the entire co-op period beginning May 26th, 2021 and ending December 17th, 2021
  • Commutability to and from either the Rockleigh, NJ or Plano, TX area for the duration of the co-op preferred

Technical Skills

  • C# experience is required

  • In addition to C#, experience with one or more of the following is highly valuable:

    • ASP.Net
    • SQL Server
    • Javascript

Other Skills:

  • Must be responsible, self-motivated, creative, have a solid work ethic and have a desire to produce a quality product
  • Strong communication skills (verbal, non-verbal, written, and listening) with the ability to articulate work at different levels of the organization
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Inquisitive individual with a desire to learn, possessing a long term desire to work on the  hardware/software development lifecycle
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and handle numerous assignments simultaneously
  • Positive, personable, and able to work cohesively with other across various divisions
  • Able to work through problems in an organized manner
  • Methodical and detail-oriented
  • Able to work independently with minimal superversion

 

EOE/M/F/D/V

At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

The Circuit Simulation intern will assist R&D staff in developing new algorithms and software for the Spectre circuit simulator.  Job duties may include hands-on experience in researching new algorithmic approaches, software engineering to implement new features, performing software validation and testing, and investigating performance/accuracy issues in the simulator.

  • Applicant should have previous exposure to the circuit simulation area and experience in EDA-relevant software development, particular C/C++ unix development.  

  • Background in one or more of numerical techniques for VLSI circuit simulation or related general numerical simulation algorithms (numerical linear algebra, computational electromagnetics, parallel numerical algorithms) or semiconductor device modeling is required.

  • Applicant should be a candidate for an advanced degree in the electrical engineering, computer science, or related field.  

  • Understanding of analog/RF/custom IC design and verification practices is a strong plus.

We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

Job summary

This position will be involve working as part of an Agile team of business owners, product owners, IT resources, and application experts.  The focus of the Quality Analyst is to write and execute testing procedures to be sure new and existing software and processes meet business requirements.  Testing includes manual, functional, integration and regressions testing. 

Summary of essential job functions

  • Work as part of an agile team building trust with the business to achieve organizational, business owner, and process owner goals.
  • Learn current business processes and software to be a valued team member and provide insight on possible improvements.
  • Analyze user stories for completeness and correctness, work with Agile teams to identify gaps and resolve issues during testing cycles.
  • Develop test plans, test scenarios, test cases and test data for different types of testing activities such as System, Regression, QA, DR/BCP, and Performance.
  • Performs execution of test cases, captures test results, test metrics and reports on results, revising tests based on team feedback.

Minimum requirements

  • Working towards a bachelor's degree in computer science, computer programming, software engineering, network administration or a related study.

Knowledge/Skills preferred

  • Customer focus with excellent communication skills.
  • Understanding and/or experience with Agile Methodology as well as Waterfall.
  • Demonstrate the ability to build a plan to learn new concepts, the steps it will take to achieve the goal, and commitment level needed to succeed.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and hands on experience with applications such as ERP, Ecommerce, Oracle EBS, Salesforce, WMS and Phone Systems.
  • Experience with manual, functional testing, integration testing and/or regression testing.
  • Experience with logging defects.
  • Demonstrate a strong desire to learn new tools, techniques, and processes.

The Executive Internship Program (EIP) is a 10-week (summer) or 12-week (semester) intensive experience for both undergraduate and graduate students. The program attracts individuals from all backgrounds who are committed to learning about equity, diversity, inclusion in human resources, marketing & advertisement, leadership development and/or research in these areas. Our interns are an extension of our team and participate in workshops, networking events, leadership programs etc. They work under the tutelage of great leadership and are given meaningful projects to make an impact for our practice, clients, and community.

EDI is a premier consulting firm founded on inclusive values with corporate office in Rochester, NY. Servicing educational institutions, corporate/HR, non-profit and STEM industries. Our mission is to help our clients recruit, develop, and retain talented diverse and inclusive leaders. We help transform organizations into environments where employees can become the best authentic version of themselves to perform at their optimal best. Equally dedicated to working with clients that are fundamentally committed to their people and making a difference in their communities and world. We demonstrate our commitment to diversity by engaging with difference and practice inclusivity by modeling a sense of belonging within our firm and helping all our clients achieve the same.

Our Values: Our company culture is guided by our ICARE values that include innovating with integrity, a commitment to inclusion, adoptability, respect of difference and empathy. This is a 10-week summer internship that starts from June 2nd to August 9th (up to 25 hours per week). Application review is from April 15th - May 17th and interviews will be held from May 17th - 21st. Accepted candidates can expect to be notified no later than Wednesday, May 26th 2021.

 

We are looking for interns in these areas:

HR - Compensations & Benefit, Talent Acquisition, Org. Dev & Change

UX Design - User Interface / Experience

Preferred:

*** Patience and charisma a plus

About us

Founded in 2009 and headquartered in San Jose, California, Nutanix is a passionate team of 6000+ employees worldwide. Our people (we call ourselves “Nutants”) are the heartbeat of #LifeAtNutanix and one of the many things that makes Nutanix a great place to work at. We share an intellectual curiosity, a bias for action, and an obsession for our customers. We are builders and problem solvers with an entrepreneurial spirit. Above all, we celebrate what makes each of us unique. 

We are humbled to be recognized as one of Bloomberg’s Top 50 Companies to Watch in 2020 and one of the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® 2020. 

We’re growing fast and disrupting the computing industry. Join us and make your mark.

About our business

Nutanix is a global leader in cloud software and a pioneer in hyperconverged infrastructure solutions, making computing invisible anywhere. Companies around the world use Nutanix software to leverage a single platform to manage any app, at any location, at any scale for their private, hybrid and multi-cloud environments.

The Role: Software Engineer - Intern

The Engineering Summer Internship is an opportunity to gain exposure to one or more Nutanix engineering roles according to your skills and interests. Some potential roles include (but not limited to) working on the core data path, storage and filesystems development, distributed systems, infrastructure and platform/hardware deployment, data protection and replication, tools and automation, development of a big data processing platform, development of the API and analytics platform, and Web and front-end UI/UX development.

Each intern is paired with a Member of Technical Staff (Software Engineer) who serves as a guide through our engineering culture, toolsets, and development methodology. Our internship program also includes a series of lunch and learns, training events, and social outings to expose you to other aspects of a rapidly growing Silicon Valley technology company. This a full time, 12 week internship program. 

Responsibilities:

  • Architect, design, and development software for the Nutanix Enterprise Cloud Platform
  • Develop a deep understanding of complex distributed systems and design innovative solutions for customer requirements
  • Work alongside development, test, documentation, and product teams to deliver high-quality products in a fast pace environment
  • Deliver on an internship project over the course of the program. Present the final product to engineering leadership.

Requirements:

  • Love of programming and skilled in one of the following languages: C++, Python 
  • Extensive knowledge or experience with Linux or Windows
  • Have taken courses or completed research in the areas of operating systems, files systems, big data, machine learning, compilers, algorithms and data structures, or cloud computing
  • Knowledge of large scale distributed systems preferred
  • Knowledge of NFS, SMB protocols preferred
  • Interest or experience working with virtualization technologies from VMware, Microsoft (Hyper-V), or Redhat (KVM) preferred
  • Detailed oriented with strong focus on code and product quality
  • The passion & ability to learn new things, while never being satisfied with the status quo

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related engineering field required. If pursuing a PhD, please refer to the careers page for other opportunities.

We’re an equal opportunity employer

Nutanix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and (in the U.S.) an Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants are considered for employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status or any other category protected by applicable law. We hire and promote individuals solely on the basis of qualifications for the job to be filled.

We strive to foster an inclusive working environment that enables all our Nutants to be themselves and to do great work in a safe and welcoming environment, free of unlawful discrimination, intimidation or harassment.

As part of this commitment, we will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If you need a reasonable accommodation, please let us know by contacting

hr@nutanix.com

About Canoo

If you're intrigued by the dream of working alongside the smartest & most revolutionary designers and engineers in the EV space, Canoo just may be the place for you. Are you a person who is irked by the status quo? Do you derive personal satisfaction from doing something you've never done before, and seeing that work actually put into production? Here at Canoo, every day is vastly different from the one before it, as we're moving swiftly toward our goal of changing the way the world looks at Urban Mobility. We’re a well-funded start-up, led by the who's who of EV business leaders, whose passion brought them together on this special mission. We're diligently preparing for our first vehicle launch and looking for deeply experienced and passionate talent, who are not just looking for a “job," but rather are driven to raise the bar and create new benchmarks within the global EV industry. Read on...

Job Purpose

The Controls Engineering Intern will assist the Canoo Battery/Powertrain team. You will contribute primarily to the development of controls components including requirements authoring, algorithm development, model simulation, and unit testing of various controls functions. The Controls Engineering Intern will contribute to the integration and verification of controls components which will make the car work as designed. An ideal candidate will be able to start from problem definitions with some ambiguity and work towards definition of the problem and execute tasks to deliver solution.

This is a paid internship for Summer 2021 with an option to start on May 24, 2021 or June 21, 2021 and an option to end on August 13, 2021 or September 10, 2021.

Responsibilities

  • Develop additions to control logic & algorithms in Simulink
  • Review data from reported bug / concern tickets to determine root cause / propose solution
  • Develop test case for MiL simulation
  • Author / update requirements for software components and integration

Required Experience

  • Current pursuing or recently completed Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Science or Aerospace Engineering
  • Basic knowledge with Microsoft Office applications: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visio, and Adobe Acrobat
  • Experience with MATLAB / Simulink
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Preferred Experience

  • Maintaining a minimum of 3.2 GPA in a 4.0 grade scale
  • Experience with CAN tools such as Vector Canalyzer & CANape / Etas Inca / ATI Vision is considered an asset
  • Previous work on extra-curricular teams such as Mini Baja, Formula SAE etc. is considered an asset
  • Experience with software versioning tools such as git/svn/mercurial is considered an asset
  • Experience with issue tracking software such as Jira, or Bugzilla is considered an asset

What’s cool about our internship program…

  • Work with some of the most innovative minds in EV
  • Work closely with leaders working on LIVE projects in the EV industry
  • Build long lasting relationships in a high-growth start up that will redefine urban mobility
  • Take a big step towards your future career
  • Lots of team-building and networking opportunities (even remotely)
  • All Internships are PAID internships

Canoo is an equal opportunity-affirmative action employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, past or present military service or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles submitted in response to our job posting shall be considered the property of Canoo Inc. and its subsidiaries and are not subject to payment of referral or placement fees if any such candidate is later hired by Canoo unless you have a signed written agreement in place with us which covers the applicable job posting.

position: Digital Consulting Intern - Tax Services - Winter 2022
description:
*Who is Grant Thornton?*
*
*
Hi. We’re Grant Thornton LLP, the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd (A.K.A. one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms.) With us, business feels more personal — for our clients and for you. That makes us different. Better. And we’re looking for applicants who are too.
Different how? It means working with numbers doesn’t make you a number. Here, your voice matters. Our inclusive community and caring culture rejects limits and egos, which helps make our work stronger and you thrive. From our global clients and no-silos style, we empower you with opportunity from day one, then set you up for long-term success with flexibility, resources and connections. It’s how we help you create a career you love — and more.
Interested? Get to know us better at gt.com/careers and read on to learn more how you’ll help us become even bolder:

*Why Join Tax Digital Consulting?*

At Grant Thornton, our Tax Digital Consulting practice helps drive efficiencies, mitigate business risks, and increase the value of the tax functions of large enterprises. In addition, our team manages, automates, analyzes and visualizes data using data transformation and visualization tools to support process improvement initiatives. We also have a large team that implements for large organizations (through standard or custom integrations) transaction tax engines and tax reporting/compliance technologies, and we provide technical support for these technologies during and after implementation.

We work with complex multinational companies to understand the regulatory landscape and influence business decisions. If you have a desire to think globally in a fast-paced environment and influence important decisions in variety of business functions, then Tax Digital Consulting may be an area for you to consider.


*Baseline Requirements*
* General business knowledge with a strong preference for Accounting Major or Minor
* Familiarity with analytics / visualization tools (e.g. Alteryx, DOMO, Power BI, Tableau)
* Familiarity with system infrastructure and application design
* Database architecture; creating queries and tables using, e.g., Oracle or SQL server
* Project management/project life-cycle knowledge and experience with systems/business analysis
* Technical/advanced writing skills
* *
*Advanced Requirements*
* Experience with web development techniques
* Experience working with back end databases and database management systems
* Knowledge of multiple ERP systems and databases (e.g. SAP, Oracle, MSFT)
* Transaction tax engine experience (e.g., Vertex, Thomson Reuters, Avalara)
* Familiarity with Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation and Blockchain and their impact on the regulatory environment
* Programming related coursework
* Java, C or .NET (C# or VB), R, Python proficiency
* *
*Candidate Characteristics*
* Intellectually curious
* Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
* Dynamic thinker who challenges conventional wisdom
* Willingness to learn and adopt new technologies
* Ability to function within a geographically-distributed team
* Good listening skills and the ability to grasp business trends and needs
* *
*Applicable Majors:*
* Accounting degree with Data Science, Analytics, or Information Systems minor
* Information Systems or Computer Science degree with Accounting or Business minor
* Data Science or Analytics degree with Accounting or Business minor
* Software/system engineering
*TRAINING:
*
Grant Thornton LLP provides both local and national training programs related to an individual’s job responsibilities. We are committed to ongoing professional development and we encourage individuals to attend outside training seminars.

*BENEFITS:*
Grant Thornton LLP offers an outstanding opportunity for career growth and development, an attractive compensation and incentive program, generous benefits including immediate participation in our 401(k) plan, and a flexible work environment that offers individual enrichment opportunities in a team environment.

It is Grant Thornton’s policy to promote equal employment opportunities. All personnel decisions, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits and termination, are made without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Thank you for your interest in a position with Equitable.

Our Power is in our People.

At Equitable, we're individuals from different cultures and backgrounds with a variety of skills and interests. Our differences make us stronger as a team. That's the power of our Equitable community! We embrace the diversity of our teams by continuously investing in them while working to be a force for good in the local community.

We recognize that the well-being of our people outside of work is just as important to their successes at work, and we encourage every employee and advisor to be their unique self.

More about this Opportunity.

Each summer, Equitable invites a select group of diverse and talented college students to spend ten weeks learning from our actuarial team. In addition to leading an actuarial project, you will:
  • Prepare for Society of Actuaries exams with our prep classes.
  • Improve your technical skills through Excel and VBA trainings.
  • Research and collaborate on an actuarial topic that you will present to the senior leadership team.
  • Work with a mentor to enhance your actuarial knowledge and learn how to work in an office setting.
  • Learn from experienced actuaries at the Summer Speaker Series.
  • Have fun at weekly social events.

For over 35 years, our program has provided summer interns with an in-depth look at a challenging and exciting actuarial career. Combining on-the-job training with structured learning opportunities, you will receive personal attention and guidance to make meaningful contributions to current company initiatives. You will gain first-hand experience with the techniques used to solve insurance business problems by working closely with actuaries across the Pricing, Valuation, Actuarial Modeling and Risk Management areas.

Length of internship: 10 weeks, full-time hours
Internship Dates: Begins on June 7, 2021 and ends August 13, 2021
Location: 8501 IBM Drive; Charlotte, NC

Unlock your potential and help us magnify the power of our people! Apply and start your journey today.Minimum Qualifications
  • Rising Senior or Rising Junior in undergraduate degree, or in a Graduate program
  • Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • Passing of one or more Society of Actuaries exam(s)


Preferred Qualifications
  • Coursework that includes math, probability and statistics, computer science and/or economics
  • Flexibility to adapt to new situations
  • Ability to think creatively, communicate clearly and work collaboratively


About Equitable
We have been providing stability and reliability to our clients since 1859 to help them live their lives with confidence, to give them peace of mind, and enable them to realize their dreams for their loved ones and their legacy.

As an employer, Equitable is committed to creating an environment where everyone feels completely comfortable bringing their true selves to work every day. Equitable has been recognized and certified as a great place to work by the Great Place to Work Institute.

We provide our employees opportunities to move within our organization so they can grow their career and skills without ever having to leave Equitable. Almost 40% of our open jobs are filled with current employees.

In addition to competitive compensation and an outstanding benefits package including 401(k) and medical programs, we offer the opportunity for continued professional development in a congenial corporate environment.

Equitable is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to our employees, applicants and candidates based on individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, mental or physical disabilities, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information or any other class protected by federal, state and local laws.

NOTE: Equitable participates in the E-Verify program.

If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process or to perform the essential job functions of this position, please contact Human Resources at (212) 314-6368 or email us at TalentAcquisition@equitable.com.

Responsibilities:

Under the direction of a senior engineer, the Co-Op employee will be responsible for developing or revising module and subassembly test procedures and test software for functioning and testing our next generation products. Will design and construct semi-complex test fixtures and switch boxes. May revise or develop new test code in LabVIEW and National Instruments TestStand, for the interns with software experience. Will review existing test procedures and test software to determine its adequacy and to improve as necessary. May also assist in developing a database for test data that is automatically collected by the factory test systems. Generate reports and conduct data analysis or SPC on data contained in the new database. Develop documentation and procedures on how to use the software applications that are created and conduct training of manufacturing test personnel as needed. May also work with new potential or existing Contract Manufacturers and other test design houses to ensure that their products meet our requirements.

Required skills:

Must have ability to read schematics to determine design intent (for EE’s) or have a proven ability to program in C/C++, Java, LabVIEW or VB (for CE & CS majors).

Knowledge of Microsoft Access is desirable.

Required Experience:

EE, Computer Science or Computer Engineering major.

Must have created at least one complex software project that works (CS and CE majors).

Experience programming in National Instruments LabVIEW would be a plus.

Skills Candidate should possess:

Good communication skills. Ability to work in a team environment. Desire to program or learn a programming language.



Required Skills


Required Experience

Appian is a platform for building enterprise software applications, faster. With Appian, customers get the speed of low-code development with the power of intelligent automation in one trusted and unified cloud platform.

At Appian, we’re seeking to grow our culture of passion, energy, and innovation; Empowered by the “the best idea wins,” we thrive on collaboration and debate, encouraging all employees to challenge and elevate one another. We strive for diversity and inclusion through continued education and a commitment to equity.

Appian’s low-code platform is revolutionizing the way people work. Customers rely on Appian Cloud to run mission-critical applications, and our Cloud Engineering team is responsible for building reliable, secure and highly scalable systems that make up the infrastructure supporting this digital transformation.

We’re looking for brilliant software engineering interns who not only love to code, but also are passionate about solving some of the most difficult technical challenges the industry faces today.  The internship we offer is an outstanding opportunity to learn how a world-class cloud infrastructure is built, and it is one of the most fun and engaging experiences you’ll ever have.

Applicants will be considered for Summer 2021

About the Internship:

  • Take ownership on enhancing key pieces of our system and participate in all the aspects of product development all the way to deployment and rollout.
  • Partner with various teams to build applications of enterprise scale, including but not limited to data analytics, content delivery, monitoring, observability systems, etc.
  • Collaborate with Software Architects, InfoSec Engineers and fellow Software Engineers building full stack applications and services.
  • Be a full member of our team: participate in our daily scrums and be held responsible for delivering your work on time,  with high quality
  • Mix it up at the end of the day;  join our social events such as game nights, segway tours of DC, concerts, and much more!

About You:

  • Pursuing B.S. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar, with 3.7 GPA & above

  • Passion for Software Engineering with strong interest in Cloud technologies
  • Are team-oriented. You’re also energetic, results and delivery oriented,  and have a strong commitment to delivering quality work
  • Fluency in any modern object oriented programming language (e.g., Java, Python, Javascript, etc.)
  • Exposure to public clouds such as AWS, Azure or GCP

Appian helps organizations build apps and workflows rapidly, with a low-code automation platform. Combining people, technologies, and data in a single workflow, Appian can help companies maximize their resources and improve business results. Many of the world’s largest organizations use Appian applications to improve customer experience, achieve operational excellence, and simplify global risk management and compliance. Our employees create opportunities to drive hands-on impact both with our customers and throughout the organization, which creates an environment where meaningful work is met with career growth and opportunity. Description


Full-time or Part-time options available to start now ; You will be required to work in-office at least one or two days a week working directly with the team for at least 2-4 consecutive hours within the office hours of 9 AM - 5 PM. Can be flexible to accommodate your school schedule for additional hours. Working full-time during Summer is not required but highly encouraged. Acima is looking for someone who has an interest in data analysis, wants to get some practical experience on what they're learning in the classroom, and can help us manage our data visualization system. We have a robust data team that primarily uses an Amazon Redshift data warehouse in conjunction with Sisense CDT and Tableau, and you will learn these tools and use them to support your daily functions. You will spend most of your time administrating the front-end of the BI system, writing SQL queries against the data warehouse, and communicating with managers across the company to improve our current reporting efforts. You will focus primarily on data from the Operations department, but will ultimately be exposed to data from every corner of the company. You will also have the opportunity for exposure to Data Science and Data Engineering - all of our data teams work hand-in-hand, giving us unique exposure to tasks and challenges that other data analysts might not have the opportunity to encounter.


Compensation:


Starting pay of $15/hour with opportunity for generous raise based on performance after roughly 6 months employment


Responsibilities:

  • Learn and develop expertise on Acima's BI tools (Sisense for Cloud Data Teams and Tableau)
  • Write numerous and complex queries against the Acima data warehouse
  • Carry out various administrative tasks inside the BI tools - manage new users, communicate permission changes, etc.
  • Cover (or escalate) bug requests coming in from various company departments
  • Keep an eye on the contents of the BI system and make recommendations for upgrades/improvements to the current reporting process
  • Communicate with a variety of stakeholders on a regular basis, gathering requirements and lending expertise on new reporting processes

Requirements

  • Current student in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related
  • Moderate SQL proficiency - looking for someone who has mastered the basic syntax of SQL and can move straight into learning the data itself
  • Previous experience with Python is a plus, but not required
  • Previous experience in the financial industry is a plus, but not required
  • Previous experience with Sisense/Tableau/AWS is a plus, but not required

New York Institute of Technology offers 90 undergraduate, graduate, and professional degree programs in more than 50 fields of study, including computer science, data, and cybersecurity; biology and biomedical studies; architecture and design; engineering; health professions and medicine; IT and digital technologies; management; communications and marketing; education and counseling; and energy and sustainability. A nonprofit, independent, private, and nonsectarian institute of higher education, it welcomes more than 9,000 students worldwide. The university has campuses in New York City and Long Island, New York; Jonesboro, Arkansas; and Vancouver, British Columbia, as well as programs around the world.

 

New York Tech embraces its mission to provide career-oriented professional education, give all qualified students access to opportunity, and support research and scholarship that benefits the larger world. More than 100,000 alumni comprise an engaged network of doers, makers, and innovators prepared change the world, solve 21st-century challenges, and reinvent the future.

 

For more information, visit nyit.edu.

 


Basic Function

Provide on-site and in-house technical support for hardware, software and configuration issues related to end-user computing technology; provide second and third-tier support to resolve faculty, staff and student technology issues.

 

Major Responsibilities

  • Maintain hardware and software for all NYIT owned end-user computing equipment.
  • Develop procedures to allow first and second tier support to resolve common end user computing issues.
  • Install, configure, upgrade and patch Windows and macOS operating environments
  • Inventory, prepare, and validate computer hardware and associated peripherals before they are deployed to the field.
  • Deploy computing resources to public computing spaces (i.e. labs, kiosks, classrooms); assist Client Services with deployment of personal computing devices during in peak times as needed.
  • Facilitate the ordering of parts and processing of warranty RMAs for the replacement of defective parts with supported vendors.
  • Provide second and third-tier technical support; concisely and effectively document issues to facilitate resolution and maintain user satisfaction.
  • Adhere to anti-virus and device encryption policies
  • Maintain inventory, tools, and media necessary for the delivery of support services used within the Endpoint Systems team and within Client Services.
  • Manage specific applications in support of end-user computing, including but not limited to, system management, Windows and macOS deployment, antivirus, endpoint encryption and print release.
  • Manage student intern staff within Endpoint Systems team.
  • In conjunction with Manager of Endpoint Systems, develop and implement policies related to desktop security.
  • Provide excellent customer service to all members of the NYIT community so as to maintain and improve user satisfaction.
  • Other duties as needed by the department and defined by the supervisor.

  • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field and a minimum of three years relevant technical experience; additional work experience may be considered in lieu of degree requirement.
  • Expert knowledge of current versions of Windows, macOS, MS Office, Google Suite for Education including the use of Outlook/Exchange in a networked environment, as well as advanced knowledge of PC and Apple hardware/configuration issues.
  • Experience creating and updating OS images for Windows and macOS workstation/laptop configurations and supporting imaging processes
  • Experience deploying and managing Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) and Windows imaging methodologies and toolsets: DISM, USMT, ICD, SIM.
  • Demonstrated ability with Windows PowerShell utilizing task automation and configuration management framework and remote troubleshooting.
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively diagnose and resolve hardware issues; expert understanding of the inner workings of PC and related hardware along with the ability to configure office productivity software, such as MS Office, virus protection software and email clients required.
  • Knowledge of networking and internetworking concepts including TCP/IP and Virtual Private Networking
  • Knowledge of application installation packaging, scripting and deployment tools
  • Sophos Endpoint configuration and Encryption is desirable
  • Strong inter‑personal and communication skills; ability to establish effective collaborative working relationships at all levels of the University.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team; ability to work concurrently on multiple tasks and projects; ability to communicate progress/problems to appropriate personnel effectively.
  • Able to physically move and install computers, printers, and peripherals in locations that may not have an elevator.
  • Must be detail oriented; possess excellent customer service and problem-solving skills; and a display a high degree of integrity.
  • Ability to work nights and weekends on an as-needed basis is required.

Overview

Snap-on Incorporated is seeking a Desktop Engineering Intern in its I/T Department, in the Kenosha, Wisconsin General Office. This position is an in-person, long-term internship and will be expected to be onsite in the Kenosha General Office. This person will be a working member of the Desktop Engineering team. This resource will assist in the troubleshooting, development and deployment of Windows Images; assist with troubleshooting both hardware and software issues and build, test and troubleshoot other scripting and imaging tasks as needed.

 

If we are interested in moving forward with your candidacy, you may receive an email invitation from Spark Hire, or from a Snap-on representative, for a one-way video interview.

Qualifications

  • Ability to troubleshoot a variety of software/hardware

  • The ability to troubleshoot scripts, install failures and hardware issues
  • Excellent communication, organization and documentation skills

Snap-on is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

COMPANY 

AccuWeather, recognized and documented as the most accurate source of weather forecasts and warnings in the world, has saved tens of thousands of lives, prevented hundreds of thousands of injuries and tens of billions of dollars in property damage. With global headquarters in State College, PA and other offices around the world, AccuWeather serves more than 1.5 billion people daily to help them plan their lives and get more out of their day through innovative digital media properties, such as AccuWeather.com and mobile, as well as AccuWeather for Business (AFB), radio, television, newspapers, and the 24/7 AccuWeather Network.

 Additionally, AccuWeather produces and distributes news, weather content, and video for more than 180,000 third-party websites. Among AccuWeather’s many innovative and award-winning features free to the public are MinuteCast® Minute by Minute™ forecasts with Superior Accuracy™. Further, AccuWeather serves more than half of Fortune 500 companies and thousands of businesses globally. 

 

SUMMARY

The AccuWeather Product Intern will work across a variety of initiatives that impact the consumer and enterprise product portfolio. This role is an exciting opportunity that will enable the intern to gain experience from working across all of AccuWeather’s portfolio products, as well as supporting the product systems that are integral to bringing our product vision to life. The intern will work on a rotation that encompasses a variety of projects required to achieve our goals. Through this rotation, the intern will gain experience across a variety of work that includes consumer websites, mobile applications, connected devices, subscription offerings, enterprise services, localization and more. 

 The intern is part of a team whose focus is to transform the existing suite of products used by more than 300 million consumers worldwide, as well as lead the next generation of innovative product development. This internship is an exciting opportunity to gain experience in product management and contribute to the development of impactful strategies that will include various skill development including feature definition, experience design and executing with teams. This internship is perfectly suited for someone with a passion for science, technology, and leveraging data to improve people’s lives. 

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  •     Participate in projects and initiatives as prescribed by the product management leadership team; rotating through a variety of product disciplines throughout the course of the internship
  •     Support the delivery responses to the Google and Apple Store ratings and reviews
  •     Attend app team meetings comprising of engineers and product designers to learn how to execute against plans
  •     Collect and analyze feedback from customers, stakeholders, and other teams to inform recommendations 
  •     Assist product operations with a variety of projects related to the portfolio within AccuWeather Product Team

 About you 

  •     Meticulously detailed. Mobile savvy with strong writing skills
  •     Creative thinker. Exceptional communicator. Collaborator by nature
  •     Desire to learn. 

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  •     You must be 18 years of age or older
  •     Must be enrolled in a U.S. based college, university or trade school to qualify. Students who have completed at least two years of college are preferred
  •     Marketing or Business majors preferred. Computer science or engineering most welcome to apply
  •     Working knowledge of digitally distributed products and technology
  •     Ability to interact and communicate with peers
  •     Attention to detail

 AccuWeather is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. position: Intern for Device Modeling (Device Physics, Numerical Analysis, Circuit Simulation)
description:
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

Spectre is the leader in circuit simulators. Device modeling is very important part of circuit simulator. This intern position is responsible to exploit various new device and Spice modelings, including radiation modeling, cryogenic modeling, quantum device and modeling.  The ideal candidate would have expertise in device physics, device modeling, and numerical techniques for VLSI circuit simulation. Candidate should have an advanced degree in electrical engineering, computer science, applied mathematics, or similar.  Candidates with experience in related fields will be considered, particularly:  


1.    Device physics, compact device modeling, behavioral modeling, statistical modeling, reliability modeling
2.    Numerical analysis, numerical methods for solution of ordinary and partial differential equations
3.    Statistical analysis, reliability aging analysis, electro-thermal analysis, circuit check algorithms
4.    High performance computing / large scale scientific computing and deployment of parallel numerical algorithms
 

We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

position: Product Configuration Software Dev Internship (Santa Rosa, CA, US)
description:
Job Description

Job Title: Software Developer Intern

 

Keysight Technologies is #1 in Electronic Design and Test products.  Through our almost 80-year history as Hewlett-Packard, and then Agilent Technologies, and now Keysight Technologies we have innovated through new business expansion.  Our customers now demand full solutions with broader offerings of software and services.  Typical applications which use our products are the design and test of Wireless 5G, Automotive Radar, Space and Satellite, and Internet Infrastructure.  It is imperative that Sales people quickly create accurate quotes/orders of our products for our customers.

 

The Knowledge Engineering team at Keysight headquarters (Santa Rosa, CA) is looking for a student who is passionate about data processes and end user experience.  This intern will contribute to a major project within Keysight to help digitalize our New Product Introduction (NPI) processes and systems.  You would be working with a small team to enhance a custom web-based platform we've developed in-house.  We're excited to have you join the team to exercise your software development strengths in the areas where you will have the most impact.

 

You'll interface with NPI Planners, Buyers, Product Configuration experts, and process analysts to streamline our information flows into a robust web-based system.  You'll be working in a factory where we develop our complete vertical supply chain of parts on site.  From integrated circuits, to gold-brick microcircuits, to printed circuit assemblies, to the final finished product, this is a true "dirt to dollars" operation.  Help us make our product introduction lifecycle more efficient than it's ever been!

Job Qualifications

Join some of the brightest minds in the measurement world. Learn more at www.jobs.keysight.com.

  • Currently enrolled in college program for a Computer Science, IS, or equivalent degree program
  • Java and/or C/C++
  • JavaScript
  • Angular, React, Vue.js, Ember, Node
  • Unit Testing or End-to-End (E2E) experience
  • Bonus skills: HTML/CSS, SQL, Cypress, Mocha, Karma, REST API
  • Demonstrated ability to do analytical problem solving.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to define complex logic expressions.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, focusing on partnership with NPI teams

position: Internship - Product Manager, Credit Cards - Summer 2021
description:
**Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you. 

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the Charlotte, NC area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer. 

 

THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree's Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn't have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here's what you can expect:

  • Real work. The only person you'll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You'll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
  • Training. Sure you'll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you'll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
  • You're not alone. In addition from the support from your team you'll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
  • End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Own a project – Analyze current customer experiences. Define and run qualitative and quantitative customer research to inform the development of web-based products
  • Monitor and analyze product performance and communicate findings and recommendations for meaningful changes. 
  • Define Product requirements for actionable changes and reiterate.
  • Put together wireframes to support product requirements and changes to be done.
  • Understand scope of the internal web-based product, participate in workshops. Own feature delivery, and write product requirements by working with business and development teams.
  • Communicate to partners on the progress of the feature/functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered).
  • Preferred majors: Business, Information Technology, Computer Science, Sociology, Psychology
  • Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
  • Good understanding of customer research methods (qualitative, quantitative)
  • Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred.
  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation's largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know: 

  • We're a publicly-traded company (TREE).
  • We've welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
  • We've built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.  
  • We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We're a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We're collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you'll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we're pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, "Get Stuff Done"). Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

**Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you. 

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the Chicago, IL area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer. 

 

THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree's Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn't have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here's what you can expect:

  • Real work. The only person you'll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You'll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
  • Training. Sure you'll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you'll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
  • You're not alone. In addition from the support from your team you'll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
  • End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Own a project – Analyze current customer experiences. Define, and run A/B tests and optimize consumer web-based product to specific metrics.
  • Monitor and analyze product performance and communicate findings and recommendations for meaningful changes. Define Product requirements for actionable changes and reiterate.
  • Put together wireframes to support product requirements and changes to be done.
  • Understand scope of the internal web-based product, participate in workshops. Own feature delivery, and write product requirements by working with business and development teams.
  • Communicate to partners on the progress of the feature/functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered).
  • Preferred majors: Business, Information Technology, Computer Science.
  • Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
  • Good understanding of how APIs work.
  • Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred.
  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation's largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know: 

  • We're a publicly-traded company (TREE).
  • We've welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
  • We've built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.  
  • We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We're a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We're collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you'll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we're pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, "Get Stuff Done"). Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

position: Software Engineering Intern - Machine Learning/Circuit Simulation
description:
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

Circuit Simulations group of Cadence Design Systems is looking for an inquisitive, passionate, and hard-working person who is interested to take part in tasks related to machine learning model development and python-based GUI creation.

  • Expert on Python, also knows C++

  • Strong program debugging skills

  • Machine learning background

Be a proud member of our One Cadence –One Team culture.

We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

Sentinel is seeking candidates looking to gain hands on experience in a one of the following categories during a paid summer internship.

  • Networking (security, wireless, routers/switches, etc.)
  • Storage (cloud, netapp, vmware, servers, Microsoft, etc.)

You will spend your summer working with Sentinel’s top engineers shadowing and training to build your skills in technical competencies and customer relations.  You will have the opportunity to learn some of the most innovative technologies.  This internship program is designed to take your knowledge from classroom knowledge and skills into hands on practical implementation.   • Minimum of a junior in college or higher working towards a Bachelor’s degree

MOTIVATED…..make IT happen!

   

 

About Us:      

Sentinel delivers solutions that can efficiently address a range of IT needs – from security, to communications, to systems & networks, to software applications, to cloud and managed services; all of which include our staffing solutions for our clients. Since 1982, Sentinel has grown from providing technology maintenance services to our current standing as one of the leading IT services and solutions provider in the US. Sentinel services customers both nationally and internationally with primary support operating centers in Downers Grove (HQ), Chicago, and Springfield, IL; Phoenix, AZ.; Detroit, Lansing, and Grand Rapids, MI; Milwaukee, WI; Denver, CO; and Fort Lauderdale, FL.

If you share our passion about what technology can do and want to be part of a top workplace environment – we’d like to have you join our team.  Learn more at www.sentinel.com/careers.

 

As part of Sentinel's employment process, candidates will be required to complete a background check. Only those who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted. No phone calls please.

position: Connected Vehicle Device Management Analyst Internship
description:
When you join Daimler, you become an agent of change within our global community of people working to create a cleaner, safer, and more efficient world for today and tomorrow. Through innovation at all levels, our teams ensure our world-changing brands continue to increase the quality of life and the business success of our customers, their customers, and the world around them. The Daimler Trucks North America (DTNA) brand portfolio is second to none, and includes Freightliner Trucks, Western Star Trucks, Detroit engines and components, Thomas Built Buses and Freightliner Custom Chassis.


We are the undisputed leader in the commercial vehicle market and the industry’s technology trendsetter. Empowered by purpose, DTNA employees drive a Technology Revolution through innovative products and a customer-centric culture. Our dedication to our customers and society does not end once our products hit the road. That’s because we believe that business success and social responsibility go hand in hand. We immerse ourselves in our customer’s experience, and support the environmental responsibilities of our sites to ensure our products are the reliable, sustainable and the desired tools of the future.


Job Overview


The Connected Services Group at Daimler Trucks North America delivers values to our customers through connected vehicle products and services.


This intern position will be working with the device management team to build out and contribute to the connected device field support landscape of the future. This individual will collaborate with local and global groups that bring connected vehicle strategies to reality. The candidate will be able to use their skills and creativity to help create our connected device field support strategy as well as build out the robust processes and procedures to support that strategy. This is an exciting and dynamic area to be working in. A high performing driven individual would be an ideal candidate for this position.


Responsibilities


• Collaborate with internal device management team as well as business partners to create the ideal field support strategy and experience. Identify processes and procedures to support the strategy for the identified customer profiles.


• Gather all connected vehicle data insights and establish the requirements for each customer profile.


• Analyze connected vehicle device operations that support overall device health. Identify patterns and areas of opportunity within procedures. Recommend baselines driven from your research that support all profiles.


• Collaborate with internal groups to gather voice of the customer to establish desired requirements to support Detroit Connect services in the field.


Target Major


Business, Computer Science, Engineering, IT


+ Must be participating in a Bachelor's Program or higher (or have graduated within the past 12 months) required

+ GPA of 3.0 or higher required

+ An attached resume is required


Basic Qualifications & Required Skills:


Ability to analyze large volumes of data to find patterns


Effective communication skills with the ability to work in teams and independently with confidence


Confidence in presenting


Ability to create plans and proposals in PowerPoint


Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Proficient in Microsoft Office, including PowerPoint, Excel and Word


Preferred Skills


Experience with Business Intelligence Tools


Additional Information


+ Applicants must be legally authorized to work permanently in the U.S. at the time of application.

+ Final candidate must successfully complete a pre-employment drug screen and criminal background check.

+ EEO/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans


For an accommodation or special assistance with applying for a posted position, please contact our Human Resources department at 503-745-8982 or toll free 800-206-3369. For TTY/TDD enabled call 503-745-2137 or toll free 866-355-6935.
